directions:
1. Sprinkle salt on eggplant cubes.
  2. Place aside for 1 hour.
  3. Fry eggplant cubes in hot oil.
  4. Remove and drain on absorbent paper.
  5. Fry chopped onion for 2 minutes then sauté meat with 2 tbsp of butter.
  6. Cover with water, add salt and spices, and cook on high heat.
  7. Bring to a boil.
  8. Cover pot and cook on medium heat for 2 hours.
  9. Add fried eggplants to meat and stock.
  10. Cover pot and cook for 10 minutes.
  11. Serve eggplant stew with lemon wedges and eggplant dip.
title: Yakhnet Bathinjan
Cream of Red Split Lentil and Vegetable

directions:
1. Line a strainer with 2 layers of cheesecloth; place the strainer over a bowl and pour the yogurt into the strainer; set aside at room temperature for at least 8 hours or until very, very thick.
  2. If using the garlic, push it through a garlic press and stir into the thickened labaneh.
  3. Refrigerate.
title: Labaneh

directions:
1. Clean the fresh spinach well removing damaged or discolour bits.
  2. Chop coarsely. Place fresh spinach in a large pan, cover and put over medium heat for 7–8 minutes.
  3. Cook only until wilted.
  4. Place fresh wilted or defrosted frozen spinach in a sieve and press with the back of a spoon to extract moisture.
  5. Transfer to a bowl.
  6. Gently fry the Onion in the oil until transparent and add this to the spinach with Cheese, egg and Parsley.
  7. Combine ingredients thoroughly, seasoning to taste with salt and pepper.
title: Ispanak

directions:
1. Mix all ingredients together well.
  2. Pour into a colander lined with muslin.
  3. Tie the muslin to form a bag.
  4. Hang the yogurt|yoghurt mixture for 2 days, placing a pot or bowl underneath to catch the liquid.
  5. After the 2 days, remove the labna from the muslin, roll into walnut sized balls.
  6. Place in a large jar, then cover with a light olive oil.
title: Labna
Cold Armenian Yogurt-Barley Soup by Sy

directions:
1. Clean salmon and remove head tail and fins. Cut the salmon into 1 lb steaks (not fillets).
  2. Place 1 salmon steak onto a sheet of foil squeeze the juice of ½ a lemon spread 1 tb of butter plus salt and pepper on the salmon.
  3. Wrap the salmon steak tightly in the foil (heavy duty) so as to make the best water tight seal as possible. Repeat for each steak.
  4. Boil the packages in water for 20 minutes.
  5. Remove and place in the freezer for an hour then refrigerate for 2 hours.
  6. When ready to serve unwrap the salmon steaks carefully on a large platter and cover with warm Hollandaise Sauce.
title: Salmon in Jelly

directions:
1. Cut the stems of the Mushrooms and peel the heads. Clean thoroughly and slice.
  2. Cook Mushrooms gently in hot butter for 5 minutes.
  3. Mix in the flour thoroughly then stir whilst adding milk.
  4. Cook at low heat until the soup is smooth and thick.
  5. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  6. Mix the grated lemon peel with a little whipped cream and place a blob on the soup after it has been poured into bowls.
title: Mushroom Stew

directions:
1. Tie all the herbs together with a string.
  2. Then, hang the herbs into the soup or any other dish which is being slow-cooked.
  3. Tie the loose end of the string to the handle of the pan.
  4. Note: alternatively, you can tie the herbs in a muslin cloth.
  5. Enjoy the extra awesome burst of flavour this will provide to your soup!
title: Flavour Enhancer Bouquet Garni for Soups

directions:
1. Cut bacon strips into thirds.
  2. Break crackers along perforated lines.
  3. Around each cracker, wrap a strip of the bacon (around the width).
  4. Place on ungreased cookie sheets and bake in 200°F oven for 2 hours.
title: Bacon-Cracker Snacks

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
  2. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients until well blended, but do not beat.
  3. Pour into greased and floured loaf pan, I use Baker's Joy spray.
  4. Bake for 1 hour or until the top is lightly browned.
title: Love and Dishes Corn Bread

directions:
1. Wash rice in cold water for 3 – 4 times.
  2. Put in a rice cooker.
  3. Add water and cook.
title: Korean Bap

directions:
1. Boil tea in 4 cups of water for about 10 minutes.
  2. Remove from flame.
  3. Remove the tea leaves from the liquid by pouring through a sieve.
  4. Add half-and-half and butter to the strained tea.
  5. Add salt to taste (Tibetans like it very salty).
  6. This will cool the tea, so warm it briefly over a low flame, making sure the tea doesn't boil.
  7. For a frothy tea, pour it back and forth between two containers a few times.
title: Tibetan Butter Tea

directions:
1. You will need a saucepan a bowl and a sieve.
  2. If using yogurt bring the milk to a boil and then leave it to cool to finger temperature (100 F).
  3. Mix the milk with the yogurt in a basin.
  4. Put in a warm place for 4 to 5 hours to set as solid as yogurt.
  5. If using vinegar or lemon juice stir into the milk and bring it to a near boil (200 F) in a bowl set in a saucepan of water.
  6. Remove and keep in a warm place for 4 to 5 hours.
  7. Pour the mixture into a sieve lined with a scalded clean cloth.
  8. After an hour put a plate on top to weight and encourage the whey to drip through.
  9. The curds in the cloth are the Cheese.
  10. Cover and store in a cool pantry and it will keep for about a week.
title: Homemade Curd Cheese

directions:
1. Wash fillet and cut into serving slices.
  2. Sprinkle with salt and let stand for 1 hour.
  3. Put bread crumbs, flour, and beaten eggs in three separate dishes.
  4. Roll each slice of fish first in flour, then eggs, then bread crumbs.
  5. Fry slices on both sides in shortening until golden brown.
  6. Arrange slices on a hot platter and garnish with lemon.
title: Gebackener Karpfen

directions: 1. Add to the pickles some rice and vegetables as carrot.
title: Pickles Salad

directions:
1. Prepare the asparagus but washing well under cold water and cutting off any woody stems.
  2. Boil in salted water for 15 minutes, depending on size.
  3. Drain and keep warm.
  4. Meanwhile, cut the hard boiled eggs in half and separate the yolks.
  5. Finely chop the whites and yolks separately.
  6. Melt the butter in a saucepan but do not allow to colour.
  7. Season with salt and pepper.
  8. To serve - pour the butter over the asparagus and garnish with the chopped egg whites and yolks.
  9. Sprinkle with herbs.
title: Flemish Asparagus

directions:
1. Scrub the potatoes under cold running water.
  2. Place in a medium-size saucepan and cover with cold water.
  3. Add the salt and bring to a boil.
  4. Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, until tender, about 20 minutes.
  5. Drain.
  6. As soon as the potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel them and slice or cube them into a salad bowl.
  7. While they are still warm, pour the shallot vinaigrette over them so they can absorb the flavors of the vinaigrette.
  8. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve.
title: My Mother's Potato Salad

directions:
1. Grate potatoes and Onion together.
  2. Add flour and egg.
  3. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Mix well.
  5. In fry pan add enough oil to coat pan.
  6. Place 1 heaping tablespoon of mixture in pan and spread out.
  7. Cook until crisp and then turn over.
  8. Place on paper towel to remove grease.
title: Potato and Onion Pancakes

directions:
1. Wash and dry the Scallops and separate the coral from the white flesh.
  2. Peel and smash the garlic.
  3. Melt half the butter in a saucepan and cook the white flesh very gently for 10 minutes, until tender.
  4. Season to taste.
  5. Place on paper towel and keep hot between two plates over a pan of hot water.
  6. Pour out the butter from the pan, wipe it out with paper and add the remaining butter and the coral, cook for 1 minute only on each side.
  7. Add the white flesh and the herbs and garlic, leave over the heat just long enough to mix thoroughly and divide between the heated shells, (plates).
  8. Serve immediately with a dry rosé wine|rose wine.
title: Coquilles St. Jacques à la Provençale

directions:
1. Heat 150g of cream with the bacon, bring to a boil and reduce to a thick liquid, strain, leave to cool and preserve in the fridge.
  2. Throw away the bacon strips.
  3. Melt the butter, add pumpkin pieces and cook for 3–4 minutes.
  4. Add the milk, salt and leave to cook (covered) for 30 minutes.
  5. Whip the remaining cream (very cold) rapidly until consistency of whipped cream.
  6. Incorporate the equally cold bacon cream.
  7. Keep the mixture in the fridge.
  8. After 30 minutes blend the pumpkin milk mixture.
  9. Adjust the seasoning by adding salt and maybe pepper.
  10. Serve this soup hot and top gently with a tbsp of bacon cream.
title: Marc Veyrat's Pumpkin Soup with Bacon-flavoured Whipped Cream

directions:
1. Cut the melon into half, then half again.
  2. Cut each quarter into three "boats"
  3. Remove the rind.
  4. Wrap a piece of prosciutto on each boat.
  5. Serve immediately.
title: Prosciutto e Melone

directions:
1. Knead ingredients to a dough.
  2. Model rolls (about 20 pieces per dough).
  3. Put rolls on oiled baking-sheet or baking-paper.
  4. Bake them for 30–45 minutes in oven at 200-220 °C (392-428 °F).
title: Selfmade Bread

directions:
1. Lightly salt chicken.
  2. Dredge first in flour then in eggs beaten with salt, finally in bread crumbs - press on crumbs firmly with palm of hand and shake off excess.
  3. Fry quickly (so a good crust forms) in hot lard deep enough so chicken swims.
  4. Lower flame and continue frying about 15 minutes or until chicken is done.
title: Wiener Backhendl

directions:
1. Pare and cut each Potato in 6 pieces.
  2. Cook in salted water to cover until tender; do not drain.
  3. Blend butter, flour, egg and milk.
  4. Add gradually to hot potato water.
  5. Heat again til boiling, remove from heat, add vinegar.
  6. Serve in soup plates containing chopped fried bacon.
  7. Garnish with parsley
title: Dutch Potato Soup

directions:
1. Mix all the ingredients and roll to about 3 inches in diameter.
  2. Cut off a good double-fistful, aobut a fourth.
  3. On dry flour-powdered surface, roll out to about 3/4 inch round, cut into pieces 1-1/4 inches long.
  4. To make interesting pattern, roll the pieces along the underside of a larger grating surface.
title: Gnocchi (Njoki)

directions:
1. Put the potatoes and onion in a large pot with the water and cook until the potatoes are almost soft.
  2. Place the Finnan haddock on top of the potatoes and onions and cook, covered, for a further 5 minutes until the fish is just cooked.
  3. Remove the fish, skin, bone and flake the flesh.
  4. Partially mash the potatoes and onions in the cooking liquor (some prefer a "lumpy" soup, while others like a smoother base).
  5. Return the flaked fish to the pot, mix thoroughly and add enough milk to create the desired consistency, either a thickish stew-soup or a thinner soup.
  6. Season the Cullen skink to taste and serve with hearty bread.
title: Cullen Skink

directions:
1. Boil the potatoes in salted water for ten minutes or until tender.
  2. Drain and pat dry.
  3. Cook the peas separately for about five minutes or until tender and then drain.
  4. While the vegetables are still warm, mix together and stir in the chopped parsley and onion and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Fold in the salad dressing (or salad cream) to moisten, and garnish with sprigs of fresh parsley.
title: Arran Potato Salad

directions:
1. Chop the shrimp, except for 12, which will be used for garnish.
  2. Half the eggs remove the egg yolk|yolks; mix them with the shrimp and the other ingredients. Check the seasoning.
  3. Fill the eggs with the mix and garnish each one with a shrimp.
  4. Serve on a lettuce lined platter/plate.
title: Shrimp-stuffed Eggs

directions:
1. Clean the kale, strip off the stalk and vein together.
  2. Chop roughly.
  3. Peel and cube the potatoes.
  4. Cook the kale and smoked Ham together in a little boiling water, salted if necessary, for 10 minutes.
  5. Add the cubed potatoes and the Oats.
  6. Prick the sausages, and place them on top of the mixture.
  7. Cover the pan with a lid, and boil the mixture gently until the kale is tender and the potatoes are soft; this takes about 30 minutes.
  8. Remove the sausages and smoked Ham, and mash the potatoes and kale together.
  9. Season as required, with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
  10. Replace the sausages and smoked Ham, and serve with plenty of mustard.
title: Boerenkool met Rookworst

directions:
1. Peel, core and chop green apples.
  2. Place green apples in a pan with water and simmer 20 minutes.
  3. Peel, core and chop green red apples and potatoes.
  4. Add the red apples and the potatoes.
  5. Cook an additional 30 minutes.
  6. Drain then mash all together.
  7. Add butter, salt and cloves.
  8. Add milk as needed.
title: Hete Bliksem

directions:
1. Boil 8 cups of lightly salted water.
  2. Add the asparagus and cook for about 20 minutes.
  3. In the meantime, hard-boil the eggs.
  4. Mash the egg yolk|yolks and the egg whites separately
  5. Mince the parsley
  6. Melt the butter and serve in a preheated sauce boat.
  7. Arrange the asparagus on a dish.
  8. Cover with the mashed egg yolks (not on the tips)
  9. Put the mashed egg whites over the mashed egg yolks and lastly decorate with parsley.
  10. Serve the melted butter separately (it has to be poured over the dish).
title: Asparagus in the Flemish Manner

directions:
1. Mix egg egg yolk|yolks with butter and mustard.
  2. Top with red or black Caviar.
title: Caviar-stuffed Eggs

directions:
1. Combine grated raw potatoes with melted butter, beaten eggs, onion, salt and paprika, and mix well.
  2. Place in a well buttered baking dish and pour the milk over mixture.
  3. Bake 40 minutes in a preheated 350ºF oven.
  4. Remove from oven and sprinkle with grated cheese.
  5. Return to oven and bake until cheese has melted and browned.
title: Bagt Kartoffelrand

directions:
1. Cut off green top and rinse to remoe sand.
  2. Cook in salted boiling water until tender.
  3. Drain, serve with butter.
title: Danish-style Leeks

directions:
1. Peel the onions and split them in pieces.
  2. Place them in the water or fish stock together with the allspice berries and bring to the boil.
  3. Cook for a while for the stock to become tasty.
  4. Peel the potatoes and cut into small pieces the size of your fingertips.
  5. Also cut the fish fillets into small cubes.
  6. Remove the onions and allspice berries from the stock and add the potatoes to cook.
  7. Let the soup boil for about ten minutes.
  8. Then add the fish and continue to cook for a few minutes until the fish is done.
  9. Chop the herbs and add to the soup.
  10. Serve the soup with melted butter and chopped raw onions, which every eater can add to the soup according to taste.
  11. The soup is at its best when eaten with rye bread.
title: Fish Soup à la Kainuu Kainuulainen Kalakeitto

directions:
1. Place the rice in hot water, bring to boil and let simmer.
  2. Add milk and bring to boil, then let simmer till very soft and sticky, at least 40 minutes.
  3. Stir often to avoid scorching.
  4. Add salt.
  5. Serve either with luumukiisseli or granulated sugar|sugar, cinnamon and milk.
title: Riisipuuro

directions:
1. Cut the meat into thin slices, and roll each each in a mixture of salt and pepper.
  2. Put a slice of bacon on each slice of meat, roll up and tie up with twine.
  3. Brown in a hot pan. Add the water and cook until done through. Use the flour to thicken the sauce.
  4. Serve with potatoes, rhubarb jam and garden pea|green peas.
title: Beinlausir Fuglar

directions:
1. Take about half a cup of mayonnaise and stir well to prevent it from lumping.
  2. Cut the herring into small slices and the apple and beet into small cubes.
  3. Add to the mayonnaise and mix well.
  4. The salad should be a rose-pink colour - if not, add some of the juice from the beets.
  5. Serve with rye bread or crackers.
title: Síldarsalat

directions:
1. Pre-heat oven to 200 °C / 400 °F / gas 6.
  2. Stretch bacon so it doesn't shrink when it's cooked.
  3. Use the back of a knife. Cut each rasher in half.
  4. Wrap a piece of bacon round each oyster. Place on a baking sheet.
  5. Keep them packed up tight so that they don't unravel.
  6. Bake for about 8 minutes.
  7. Butter the toast.
  8. Arrange 2 angels on each piece and garnish the dish with the watercress.
title: Angels on Horseback

directions:
1. Cut the rind of the pork and season it with salt and pepper.
  2. Peel and slice the apples and spread with the prunes over two thirds of the pork and roll it like a roulade.
  3. Tie with cotton.
  4. Brown the roulade in a large pan and add water and a little browning.
  5. Simmer for about 2 hours or until tender.
  6. Slice roulade and serve with the thickened sauce, boiled potatoes, cranberry or currant jelly|red currant jelly and red cabbage.
  7. he roulade can also be cooked in the oven for 2 hours at 170°C.
title: Flæskeroulade med Svesker

directions:
1. Rinse veal (or wipe with a damp paper towel) and remove any skin.
  2. Cut into rather small pieces.
  3. Peel potatoes and cut into strips or slices.
  4. Use half of margarine to grease a deep, covered baking dish or casserole.
  5. Cover with a sprinkling of bread crumbs.
  6. Peel and slice onion and lightly brown in remainder of margarine.
  7. Place a layer of potatoes in casserole and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
  8. Add a layer of meat, season with salt and pepper, and cover with onions.
  9. Repeat, with a layer of potatoes on top.
  10. Cover casserole and bake in a hot oven (400°F) for ½ hour.
  11. Remove cover.
  12. Combine veal broth and tomato pulp or paste and pour over casserole ingredients.
  13. Bake, uncovered, for another ½ hour or until meat is tender.
title: Kalfakjot a Fati

directions:
1. Pour milk or cream into a shallow pan. If using milk leave undisturbed for 24 hours.
  2. Heat the pan, gently, to about 82°C (180°F) and hold at this temperature for approximately 1 hour.
  3. When the surface cream has developed a thick, rich, yellow wrinkled crust, turn off the heat and allow the pans to cool slowly.
  4. Once cold, skim the cream off and serve with scones, fruit or fruit pies.
title: Clotted Cream

directions:
1. Melt the butter and add the sifted flour.
  2. Add boiling milk and mix well.
  3. Cook on low heat for 5 minutes.
  4. Adjust flavour with salt.
  5. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar and serve with milk or sweet berry juice / berry fruits (make from berry syrup or use sweetened juice).
title: Flauelsgrautur

directions:
1. Beat all ingredients together well.
  2. Drop by spoonfuls into heated butter or margarine, and brown quickly on both sides.
title: Parsnip Fritters

directions:
1. Drain the boiled pumpkin with a colander.
  2. Mash it with a fork or a mixer.
  3. In a saucepan heat the butter and add the flour.
  4. Add gradually the milk and mix constantly.
  5. Add the pumpkin mash and stir the soup, keeping it in low temperature.
  6. Add the ginger, salt, pepper and the Ham.
  7. Stir and serve hot.
  8. Optionally: Add croutons, grated Cheese or finely chopped parsley.
title: Soupa me Kolokytha kai Ginger

directions:
1. Cut the green part of the beets and wash them.
  2. Boil beetroots and green parts for ½ hour and then remove outer skins from the beetroots.
  3. Slice the beetroots in thin pieces.
  4. Add oil, salt and vinegar and serve beetroots and green parts in a bowl.
title: Patzarosalata

directions:
1. Wash the eggplants and remove stems.
  2. Cut them along side.
  3. Let them stand in water for half an hour.
  4. Drain and salt them.
  5. Fry them in oil in order to soften.
  6. Remove from oil and let them drain from oil.
  7. In the same oil add the tomato mash and let them boil until they form a thick sauce.
  8. Add garlic and nuts and stir.
  9. Place the eggplants back into the sauce and boil for 3 – 4 minutes.
  10. Remove from heat, let the sauce stand and serve.
title: Melitzanes me Saltsa Karydia

directions:
1. Prepare pudding according to package direction.
  2. Cover (so it will not get that icky skin) and let completely cool down over night.
  3. Do NOT put it in the fridge.
  4. Lay butter next to it, so butter and pudding will have the same temperature later.
  5. On the next day, mix butter with mixer on medium speed until it is fluffy.
  6. Add pudding- one spoon after the other.
  7. Mix constantly.
  8. If pudding is mixed completely with the butter, blend everything well some seconds, so that it is mixed up completely and is free of lumps.
  9. TIP: Please do not use fat reduced products or a cheap pudding- the taste will not as good as with rich ingredients
title: German Buttercreme

directions:
1. Mix ingredients.
  2. Add savory, marjoram, dill, allspice and ginger according to your own personal taste.
title: Homemade Poultry Seasoning

directions:
1. Add all ingredients for the stuffing. Mix well. Set aside.
  2. Rub meat with salt, pepper and butter.
  3. Put cider or water into a casserole dish.
  4. Place meat along edges of casserole dish and cover with foil.
  5. Bake for 1⅕ hours at 350 °F.
  6. Serve roast pork with potato stuffing.
title: Irish Roast Pork with Potato Stuffing

directions:
1. Burn butter on a saucepan and roast the meat on all sides.
  2. Add tomato mash plus little water, enough to cover the meat.
  3. Simmer until half of the water is absorbed.
  4. In the meantime, roast the quince, which have already been cleaned and cut.
  5. Add them into the saucepan and simmer until the remaining water is absorbed.
  6. Add more water if meat is not ready and simmer for more time, if necessary.
title: Mosxari me Kidonia

directions:
1. Wash the shrimps and put into pot.
  2. Add enough water to cover.
  3. Add salt and whole onion and celery, and bring to a boil.
  4. Cook for 5 minutes.
  5. Remove the shrimps with slotted spoon and keep the liquid.
  6. Shell and devein the shrimp.
  7. Heat the oil in pot.
  8. Saute chopped onions until light golden.
  9. Add shrimps, turning 2 or 3 times.
  10. Add tomatoes (or tomato paste).
  11. Cook about 5 minutes.
  12. More, then remove shrimps.
  13. Set aside and keep warm.
  14. Measure liquid in which shrimp were boiled, allowing 2½ cups.
  15. For each cup of rice.
  16. Add liquid to the pot with the tomato sauce.
  17. Bring to the boil and add the rice.
  18. Stir for the first few minutes to prevent sticking.
  19. Cook about 12 to 15 minutes.
  20. Until the rice is tender but has not absorbed all of the liquid.
  21. Add ⅔ of the shrimps.
  22. Mix well.
  23. Remove the pot from the heat.
  24. Cover with a clean towel and cover the towel with the lid.
  25. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes.
  26. , until all liquid is absorbed.
  27. Mold rice into a pyramid shape.
  28. Garnish with remaining shrimp.
title: Pilafi me Garides

directions:
1. Peel the eggs and halve lengthwise.
  2. Carefully remove the egg yolk|yolks and combine with the remaining ingredients.
  3. Stuff the egg whites with the mixture.
title: Stuffed Eggs I

directions:
1. Bring milk and margarine to a boil.
  2. Pour over the flour.
  3. Stir to make a thick porridge.
  4. Cover and refrigerate overnight.
  5. Knead in flour to make a pliable dough.
  6. Divide the dough into pieces of equal size.
  7. Roll out into thin sheets and cook on a griddle , rolled side down.
  8. Immediately as the lefse are placed on the griddle, sprinkle with lukewarm water.
  9. Cook until light brown on both sides with small golden bubbles and crisp.
  10. Store in a dark, cool place.
  11. These keep well.
  12. Soften in a damp cloth.
  13. Spread with butter and sprinkle with granulated sugar|sugar if served with coffee.
title: Lefsekling from Telemark

directions:
1. Chop vegetables, removing seeds from chilies.
  2. Combine all ingredients and chill for two hours before serving.
  3. Try this on any meat, fish or egg dish.
  4. Our favorite is melted Monterey jack cheese spooned onto floured tortilla halves and topped with this.
  5. Roll them up and attack!
title: Salsa I

directions:
1. Cover vegetables with water, add seasoning and cook until well done.
  2. Force through sieve.
  3. Heat butter until light brown, stir in flour, and let mixture cook until it bubbles and is well blended.
  4. Gradually add hot milk to the flour mixture and let simmer just below the boiling point until mixture is smooth and thick.
  5. Add to strained vegetables and let simmer until smooth and thickened.
  6. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve with egg barley.
title: Zupa Kartoflana

directions:
1. Cut lobster into bite size pieces and toss with above ingredients.
  2. Serve on lettuce leaves.
title: Newfoundland Lobster Salad

directions:
1. Mix white flour, boiled potatoes, a little salt, granulated sugar|sugar and cinnamon.
  2. The addition of an egg is optional.
  3. Klimpor may also be cooked in milk.
title: Potato Dumplings I

directions:
1. Cut salt Pork into small pieces and fry until brown in frying pan.
  2. Remove Pork cubes, leaving fat in pan to fry fish cakes.
  3. Mix fish, potatoes, Onion together.
  4. Shape into fish cakes and coat with flour.
  5. Fry on both sides until golden brown.
title: Fish Cakes

directions:
1. Wash the cauliflower and divide into florets.
  2. Cook in a little salted boiling water until just tender.
  3. Drain.
  4. Meanwhile, melt butter and fry the breadcrumbs until golden; pour over cauliflower just before serving.
title: Kalafior po Polsku

directions:
1. Combine fish and cauliflower.
  2. Chill.
  3. Blend cream with mayonnaise.
  4. Add mayonnaise mixture to mixture to coat ingredients.
  5. Toss to mix.
  6. Place in center of lettuce-covered platter.
  7. Surround with tomatoes and cucumber.
  8. Serve with remaining mayonnaise mixture.
title: Sunday Supper Salad

directions:
1. Mix flour and mashed potatoes by hand until you get a smooth dough.
  2. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface.
  3. Cut into quarters. Put Apple slices on 2 dough quarters.
  4. Cover with remaining dough quarters to make 2 "sandwiches".
  5. Fry in butter until golden brown on both sides.
  6. Make a cross on the top, open and place butter and Granulated sugar|Sugar inside.
title: Irish Potato and Apple Cake

directions:
1. Mix the potatoes with the egg and add flour until you have a loose dough that does not stick to your fingers.
  2. Roll out the dough on a floured board and cut into thin noodle strips.
  3. Bring some salted water to boil and drop the noodles into it.
  4. They are ready when they float to the surface.
title: Kopytka

directions:
1. Stir together flour and salt and milk.
  2. Mix in eggs, beat until batter is bubbly.
  3. Set aside for 30 minutes.
  4. Heat fat or oil in 9 x 9 inch baking dish in oven for 15 minutes, or for individual puddings heat the oil in a bun or muffin tin.
  5. When oil is very hot pour in batter.
  6. Bake at 450°F until puffed and brown, about ½ hour.
  7. Serve with roast and gravy.
title: Yorkshire Pudding

directions:
1. Fresh grind your own nutmeg.
  2. Once you grind the nutmeg, it should be used in about a month.
title: Apple Pie Spice
Basic Egg Salad and Egg Salad Plus

directions:
1. Boil beets, covered in water for ½ hour, until skins can be easily peeled off and beet is soft when poked by fork.
  2. Peel and chop beets into small squares (about ½ inch).
  3. Slice onion into thin pieces.
  4. Squeeze lime juice over the beets, add the onions.
title: Beet Salad II

directions:
1. Place eggs in a pot of cold water with 1 teaspoon salt and boil them till they are hard-boiled.
  2. Onions can be diced in the food processor and later the mushrooms too.
  3. Place onions in a pan and cook on low for one minute to remove the bitter taste.
  4. Add pepper.
  5. Then pour oil on them and stir.
  6. After a few minutes, add diced mushroom pieces.
  7. Fry all together.
  8. Peel hard-boiled eggs under cold water.
  9. Chop eggs, fried onion mixture, salt, mayonnaise and dill together.
  10. The texture should be a fine spread.
title: Egg Salad

directions:
1. Sauté onions in small amount of oil until soft but not brown.
  2. Add apples and cover pot and cook over lowest possible light until they are soft, stirring occasionally. Apples should let out some juice.
  3. If they do not, add a small amount of water just to keep them from drying up or burning.
  4. When they are soft and glazed looking, add one shake of salt, ¼ tsp cinnamon, ½ tsp sugar or substitute.
  5. Stir, cover and cook another five minutes.
  6. Taste.
  7. Add more sugar or cinnamon if you wish, but keep the taste delicate.
title: Apples and Onions

directions:
1. Hard boil 1 egg.
  2. Then finely chop the hard-boiled egg and mix with 2 tablespoons salsa.
  3. Spread onto medium-sized flour tortilla and roll up jellyroll style.
  4. Wrap tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate.
title: Salsa Egg Salad Roll-Up

directions:
1. In medium bowl, combine eggs, milk and flour; beat until smooth.
  2. Add all but final ingredient; mix.
  3. Pour into greased 9" pan.
  4. Top with or mushrooms if desired.
  5. Bake at 400 °F for 30–35 minutes (until golden brown and slightly puffy).
title: Muenster and Cheddar Cheese Pie

directions:
1. rumble sausage into large heavy skillet and cook until lightly browned.
  2. emove from the pan and keep warm.
  3. our off all except 2 tablespoons of the pan drippings.
  4. ook the onions in the drippings until golden brown and transparent.
  5. dd the apple slices and cook until tender.
  6. n a buttered 2 quart casserole, arrange layers of potatoes, sausage, and onion-apple mixture.
  7. ake in a moderate 350°F oven for 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
  8. erve over rice or pasta
title: Korvgryta

directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 200 °C / 400 °F.
  2. Butter a 1.75 litre / 3 pint / 7½ cup loaf tin with the slices of streaky bacon.
  3. Stretch the slices with the back of a knife, if necessary, to completely fill the tin.
  4. Fry thediced bacon in a large frying pan until almost crisp.
  5. Stir in the onion and garlic and fry for a further 2–3 minutes until they are soft and a pale golden brown.
  6. In a large bowl soak the bread crumbs in the milk for 5 minutes, or until all the milk is absorbed.
  7. Add the minced meats, bacon, Onion, garlic, herbs and eggs to the breadcrumbs.
  8. Season and mix well.
  9. Spoon the mixture into the loaf tin.
  10. Level the top and cover the tin with foil.
  11. Bake for about 1hour and half.
  12. Turn out and serve in slices, with herby mashed potatoes and carrots.
title: Serbian Meatloaf

directions:
1. Beat the eggs with half the milk.
  2. Beat in flour and salt.
  3. Stir in melted butter and remaining milk.
  4. Heat a griddle with vegetable oil.
  5. Pour about ¼ cup batter onto the griddle and cook over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes.
  6. Turn the pancakes and cook about ½ minute.
  7. Serve immediately.
title: Traditional Swedish Pancakes

directions: 1. Mix the first 3 ingredients then add the wine.
title: Venezia

directions:
1. Separate the whites and yolks of the hard-boiled eggs.
  2. Grate the whites into the bowl.
  3. Grate the cheese (the 2nd layer).
  4. Put the tinned sardines on a plate and crush them with a fork until they get soft.
  5. Divide the crushed sardines into two halves, and put a half into a bowl, making the third layer.
  6. Cover it with half a jar of mayonnaise.
  7. For the next layer grate the frozen butter into the bowl.
  8. Chop the onion.
  9. Put the chopped onion onto butter.
  10. Then put the rest of the sardines, and cover with half a jar of mayonnaise.
  11. Finish by grating the yolks onto the top of the salad.
  12. Put into refrigerator and let it stay for half an hour.
title: Fish Salad "Mimosa"

directions:
1. Place milk in a medium-size saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
  2. Simmer for 5 minutes while stirring (be careful not to let it burn) *let cool to about 100% - 112%.
  3. (use a cooking thermometer or own judgment) *pour milk into a sterilized glass jar.
  4. Add yogurt (pick out the ginger).
  5. Cover jar with loose fitting lid and completely wrap it in a kitchen towel (you want the yogurt to maintain the ideal temperature but not suffocate it as it needs air to multiply).
  6. Place in oven next to the bulb (to culture properly it needs an environment of 95%.
  7. Leave overnight without disturbing it and you will have fresh yogurt in the morning!.
title: Homemade Yogurt

directions:
1. Boil dried mushrooms, then take them out and set aside.
  2. Dress mushroom water with flour so that there are no lumps.
  3. Combine mushrooms with fried chopped onion.
  4. Knead unleavened dough and roll it out finely.
  5. Make rounds with a saucer, put mushroom filling in the center and pinch the edges.
  6. Fry in oil.
title: Mushroom Soup with Ushki

directions:
1. Put beef into a large saucepan and cover with 3 l cold water.
  2. Boil,reduce heat and then remove the grease and froth from the broth surface with a spoon.
  3. Add one onion.
  4. Cook at low heat for 1–2 hours.
title: Simple Borsch

directions:
1. Cook macaroni and combine with canned fish and sliced tomatoes.
  2. Dress with mayonnaise.
title: Ukrainian Fish Salad

directions:
1. Peel potatoes and grate finely, squeeze out the juice and combine with salt and chopped fat.
  2. Shape small rounds and fry in oil.
  3. Serve hot with fried chopped onion.
title: Potato Rolls

directions:
1. Cube lard and fry with finely chopped onion.
  2. Put half-cooked cauliflower parts, sliced potatoes on lard pieces and pour over beaten eggs with flour and salt and bake in the oven until done.
  3. Decorate with parsley greens before serving.
title: Cauliflower with Potatoes

directions: 1. Wash spinach and dry it then roll in flour, soak in a beaten egg with ground garlic, pepper and salt, roll in breadcrumbs and fry in butter until golden.
title: Spinach in Breadcrumbs

directions:
1. The day before cooking put the mushrooms, raisins and prunes into the water and let stay for a day.
  2. Rub the hen with salt and pepper outside and inside and with butter inside.
  3. Boil the rice and then mix it with prunes, mushrooms and raisins.
  4. Stuff the hen with the mixture and bake it the open heat for 50 minutes.
title: Chicken stuffed with Mushrooms, Raisins and Prunes

directions:
1. Rimmer chicken in boiling water until tender.
  2. Remove bones and skin.
  3. Strain the stock.
  4. Return stock and chicken to pot.
  5. Add onions, celery, corn and parsley.
  6. simmer till vegetables are tender.
  7. Mix flour with egg and milk.
  8. Rub mixture with fork till it crumbles.
  9. Drop crumbs in soup.
  10. Cook 10 more minutes covered.
title: Amish Chicken-Corn Soup

directions:
1. Chop fish fillet finely, add flour, salt, oil and pepper.
  2. Stir thoroughly and shape small balls.
  3. Cook in salted boiling water.
  4. Chop onion finely and serve with tolcheniki.
title: Fish Tolcheniki

directions:
1. Mandi Candy is a tasty strawberry/raspberry flavored shot drink. It was invented by bartender Mandi Z, Uncle Paulie's, Glen Ellyn, Illinois.
  2. Serve at room temperature or double-chilled, depending on taste.
title: Mandi Candy

directions: 1. Stir ingredients together in a shot glass, and serve.
title: Mexican Titty

directions:
1. Slice bread and spread butter.
  2. Dice cucumbers and cover bread slices with them.
  3. Sprinkle salt and chopped herbs|greens.
title: Sandwich with Cucumber

directions: 1. Cut all of the fruit into small pieces and mix them up with yogurt!!
title: Ukrainian Fruit Salad

directions:
1. Wash pears, peel off, cut into 4 parts and core.
  2. In a stew pan, put pears, pour over water, add honey and butter and stew on low heat until done.
title: Zimmes from Pears

directions:
1. Rinse leaves.
  2. Stripe from stems and coarsely chop leaves.
  3. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
  4. Add collards and salt.
  5. Cook until wilted (about 4 minutes).
title: Collard Greens (or Kale)

directions:
1. Pour bourbon and water into old-fashioned glass.
  2. Add ice and a twist of lemon peel, if desired, and stir.
title: Bourbon and Water

directions: 1. Pour bourbon into old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice.
title: Bourbon on the Rocks

directions:
1. Shake with cracked ice, strain into cocktail glass.
  2. Garnish with cherry and orange slice.
title: Bull and Bear

directions: 1. Pour into old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir.
title: Stiletto

directions:
1. Pour all ingredients (bailey's to taste) into a blender and puree for several seconds, or until smooth.
  2. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
title: Bailey's Shake

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
  2. Bring milk to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
  3. Gradually stir in cornmeal and cook, stirring.
  4. Beat in egg egg yolk|yolks, butter and seasonings.
  5. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites .
  6. Fold whites into corn mixture and pour into a 2-quart baking dish.
  7. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes .
title: Cheyenne Batter Bread

directions: 1. Mix the ingredients and serve with ice.
title: Saketini I

directions:
1. Slice the watermelon lengthwise into slices 1 to 2 inches thick.
  2. Carefully cut away the rind and discard.
  3. Place as much of the fruit as will fit into a food processor and process until smooth, about 15 seconds.
  4. Press through a fine sieve and discard seeds and pulp.
  5. Pour the juice into a pitcher.
  6. Repeat this process until all the watermelon has been blended and sieved.
title: Watermelon Juice

directions: 1. Mix and serve.
title: Explosion Millennium Bacardi 151

directions:
1. Fill large cooking pot with red corn hominy and water.
  2. Cook hominy, covered, over medium heat until kernels burst open and are "al dente".
  3. Add remaining ingredients, cover, and simmer until meat is tender.
title: Pueblo Posole II

directions:
1. Dress swamp or cotton-tail rabbit.
  2. Wash, cut up, and cover with water, and cook until nearly done.
  3. Take pieces out of liquid, dust with flour and salt, and fry until brown in a skillet of pork fat.
title: Apache Fried Rabbit

directions:
1. Process all ingredients in a blender.
  2. Enjoy!
title: Mango Lassi

directions:
1. Place milk in a heavy bottom saucepan.
  2. Bring to boil over high heat while stirring.
  3. When the milk foams stir in yogurt (make sure your careful so the curds dont break).
  4. Add lemon to finish the separating process. Allow to set for a few minutes.
  5. Hold the curd back with a big spoon and poor off the whey.
  6. Trying not to separate the curd, place curd into Cheese cloth.
  7. Drain for 5-10 minutes and then place the paneer while still in cloth under a pot filled with water to finish pressing out the water.
  8. You should have a loaf that you can cut into cubes.
title: Paneer ( Indian Cheese)

directions:
1. Place yogurt in a colander lined with cheesecloth and let drain overnight.
  2. Discard the liguid left in bowl.
  3. Serve as a lowfat substitute to whip cream.
  4. Alternatively press under a heavy pot and continue to drain, now you have an even thicker Cheese that can be used in place of ricotta.
title: Yogurt Cheese

directions:
1. Sprinkle Caribbean or jerk seasoning on a catfish fillet and let sit for five to ten minutes.
  2. Preheat a grill or grill pan.
  3. Carefully place the fillets in the pan and cook for two to three minutes on each side.
title: Caribbean Catfish

directions:
1. Mix Beef, Onions, Crumbs, Mint, Salt and Pepper
  2. Add water until mixture holds together.
  3. Form into bite-sized balls;
  4. Arrange balls in single layer in shallow oven dish.
  5. Pour tomatoes over meatballs; sprinkle with Cinnamon.
  6. Dot with butter.
  7. Bake in 400-degree oven for 1 hour.
title: Abondigas Venezolanas

directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 200°C / 400°F / gas mark 6.
  2. Place the flour and salt in a large mixing bowl and gradually add the warm water, mixing to form a stiff dough.
  3. Leave to stand for 5 minutes.
  4. Knead the dough for a couple of minutes then form into 8 balls.
  5. Flatten with the palm of your hand so they measure about 7.5 cm / 3-inches in diameter and are about 18 mm / ¾-inch thick.
  6. Heat a little oil in a large frying pan, add the arepas and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side until crisp and golden, turning 3 or four times.
  7. Remove them from the pan and drain on kitchen paper then transfer to a baking sheet and bake in the oven for about 15 minutes.
title: Basic Arepas

directions:
1. Place anise leaves in cup and pour boiling water over them.
  2. Let steep 5 – 8 minutes.
  3. Stir in honey and serve with lemon slice.
title: Anise Tea

directions:
1. ½ crackers, crumbled ½ asparagus, ½ pimentos (in strips), ½ mushroom soup mixed with pimento juice, ½ grated cheese.
  2. Repeat the layers using other half of ingredients.
  3. Top with cheese or crumbled chips|potato chips.
  4. Heat in moderate oven (375 °F).
  5. Until bubbly and topping has browned.
title: Asparagus Casserole I

directions:
1. First add the salt and butter to the water.
  2. When boiling add the flour, all at once, stirring constantly until the mixture leaves the side of the pan
  3. Remove from the fire and add the unbeaten eggs, one at a time, beating continually.
  4. Drop by spoonfuls onto a buttered pan, about two inches apart.
  5. Bake in a moderate oven for twenty-five minutes.
  6. When cool, with a sharp knife make a cut in the top or side and with a pastry tube fill with cream filling.
title: Cream Puffs I

directions:
1. Bake potatoes until done (either at 400°F in oven for 45 minutes or in microwave).
  2. Cut open lengthwise and scoop out insides.
  3. Put insides in a bowl and mix with milk, butter, salt and pepper until creamy consistency.
  4. Scoop back into potato hulls, top with shredded cheddar cheese and bake until cheese melts.
  5. I add bacon bits, cooked broccoli, and chives.
  6. These are wonderful.
  7. Enjoy.
title: Twice-baked Potatoes

directions:
1. Combine flour and sugar in a large pot.
  2. Slowly stir in cold water to form a paste.
  3. Slowly add boiling water, stirring vigorously to bread up lumps.
  4. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring constantly, until thick and clear.
  5. Remove from heat and add alum.
  6. Stir until well mixed.
  7. Add oil of cinnamon if paste will not be used immediately.
  8. Makes about 1-½ qts.
  9. How to use it: classroom paste is a good all-purpose paste, especially appropriate for work with children.
  10. It is also excellent for papier-mache projects.
  11. Stored in a closely capped jar, this paste will keep for several weeks.
  12. It keeps longer than paper paste and is a little softer.
  13. If it gets too thick it can be thinned with hot water for easy spreading.
title: Classroom paste

directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
  2. Oil muffin or popover tins and preheat.
  3. Combine all the ingredients in a bowl.
  4. Beat with a rotary beater or wire whisk just until smooth.
  5. Pour the batter into the hot muffin tins.
  6. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, or until brown.
title: Low-cholesterol popovers

directions:
1. Mix dry ingredients together.
  2. Gradually add warm water until the mixture can be kneaded into shapes.
  3. Make beads by rolling the dough into little balls, piercing the balls with toothpicks and allowing the balls to dry.
  4. Paint and string the beads.
title: Jewelry Clay for Kids

directions:
1. In medium saucepan, combine juice or cider and candies; bring to a boil.
  2. Reduce heat and simmer 4 minutes or until candies dissolve.
  3. Serve hot or cold.
  4. If desired, garnish with apple wedge or cinnamon stick stirrer.
title: Red Hot Cinnamon Cider

directions:
1. Cut the avocados in half.
  2. Remove the stones and scoop out the flesh into a small mixing bowl.
  3. Add the remaining the ingredients to the bowl and mix.
  4. Pile the chicken mixture into the centre of each avocado half.
  5. Serve immediately.
title: Stuffed Avocados

directions:
1. First take any variety of thin, unsweetened cracker, spread lightly with butter and set in a baking pan.
  2. On the center of each cracker dispose a marshmallow, with a bit of butter above, - the butter may be omitted.
  3. Put the pan into a hot oven until the marshmallow is softened and browned a little.
  4. Then serve at once.
title: Marshmallow Marguerites

directions:
1. Slice cucumber lengthwise and remove seeds.
  2. Dice the cucumber and add remaining ingredients.
  3. Mix thoroughly and chill at least ½ hour before serving.
  4. This was for 5 servings, but since I like cucumber so well I increased it for 10 nice folks.
  5. Love them leftovers!.
title: Hess Cucumber Salad

directions:
1. Make the dough using the ingredients above.
  2. put veggies on the top, using fresh tomatoes.
  3. It made to large rounds.
  4. Again the only fat was the PAM on the bottom and PAM on the top plus 1 tbsp grated cheese for both pizzas.
  5. Worked out to be about ½ veggie and 2 bread for 2 slices.
  6. Tasted a heck of a lot better than some of the commercial pizzas.
title: Dick Miale Pizza

directions:
1. Juice the oranges, and pour into glasses.
  2. Top with mineral water, seltzer or club soda.
title: Orange Tangerine Mimosa

directions:
1. Place steak on large piece of aluminum foil.
  2. Layer vegetables in order given.
  3. Add salt and pepper.
  4. Wrap in foil, sealing ends securely.
  5. Bake at 350f for 1 hour.
  6. Microwave: place in plastic wrap.
  7. Cook on high for 10 minutes.
title: Packaged Steak Supper

directions:
1. Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl.
  2. Stuff into poultry or transfer to a lightly oiled casserole.
  3. Bake in 350°F oven for 15 minutes if not used as a stuffing.
  4. Stuff 2 Cornish hens or 3 pound chicken.
title: Pecan Corn Bread Stuffing

directions:
1. Combine in a large saucepan; bring to a boil and stir constantly.
  2. Allow to cool and ferment before bottling in a crock pot or stone jug, (it should only take a few days).
title: Bayou Beer

directions:
1. Mix flour, salt, pepper and ½ to 1 bottle of beer (depending on how thin or thick you would like the batter).
  2. Remember, always add more flour if batter is too thin.
  3. Dip pieces of haddock in batter and place directly in a pan of hot oil on the barbecue or place haddock directly on the barbecue.
  4. Cook each piece for 5 minutes and turn when golden, then cook other side for 5 minutes until golden - low to medium heat.
  5. When cooked, drizzle with lemon.
title: Beer-battered Haddock

directions:
1. Mash or purée avocado and banana until smooth.
  2. Serve or, spoon into ice cube trays, cover with plastic wrap and freeze into individual portions for future meals.
  3. When ready to use, just pop out, thaw and serve when room temperature.
  4. For variation try mango, peach, or papaya.
title: Avocado Banana Baby Food

directions:
1. Rinse spinach thoroughly; place in to top of double boiler and heat until wilted.
  2. Drain and chop coarsely.
  3. Melt margarine in skillet; add onion.
  4. Saute over high heat until onion is brown on the edges.
  5. Add seasonings.
  6. Stir to blend.
  7. Add and toss to blend.
title: Spinach with Onions

directions:
1. For each serving, mix yogurt with equal and a dash of nutmeg.
  2. Then add strawberries and stir.
title: Strawberries Romanoff I

directions:
1. Blend all ingredients.
  2. Roll into balls using about 1 teaspoon of dough.
  3. Place on ungreased baking sheets.
  4. Flatten with the bottom of a glass dipped in flour.
  5. Bake at 350°F until the edges begin to brown, about 6 minutes.
  6. Options to sweeten: before baking, make a thumb print in each cookie and fill with chopped nuts or sugarless jam.
title: Sugarless Cookies

directions:
1. Remove the corn from the cob and grind.
  2. Knead it until it forms a firm ball.
  3. Roast over a low charcoal fire or on a wire rack over the burner of the stove.
  4. Serve hot with butter, salt and queso blanco|white cheese.
title: Arepas de Chocolo

directions:
1. Whip berries in a food processor or blender until smooth.
  2. Heat blended blueberries to a boil in a saucepan; turn heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until mixture reaches desired thickness.
title: Tart Blueberry Butter

directions:
1. Quarter the tomatoes.
  2. Place in large kettle.
  3. Push down with hands or back of spoon to render some juice.
  4. Bake at 325 °F until soft pulp remains.
  5. Spoon into blender.
  6. Blend until smooth.
  7. Seal in sterilized jars or freeze.
title: Basic Tomato Sauce

directions:
1. Quarter the tomatoes.
  2. Place in large kettle.
  3. Push down with hands or back of spoon to render some juice.
  4. Bake at 325°F until soft pulp remains.
  5. Spoon into blender.
  6. Blend until smooth.
  7. Seal in sterilized jars or freeze.
title: Finsand's Tomato Sauce

directions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor and beat until batter is smooth.
  2. Let batter stand, covered, for 4 hours before using.
  3. Have vegetables well drained and patted dry if they have been washed.
  4. Dip in batter and fry in deep fat, 360°F, until golden.
title: Beer Fritter Batter

directions:
1. Cut each pound of smoked sausage into 4 pieces.
  2. Pour the beer in the bottom of the crock pot and pile in the sausage.
  3. Cook on high for 2 hours, then switch to low until ready to serve.
  4. Those who like a strong beer taste will want the pieces that actually bathed in the beer.
  5. The pieces toward the top of the crock pot will have a more delicate beery tang.
title: Beer-steamed Sausages

directions:
1. Wash eggplant and parsnip.
  2. Slice eggplant across the width in ½ inch segments.
  3. Discard stem.
  4. Slice parsnip across the width in ⅜ inch segments.
  5. Discard stem.
  6. Arrange eggplant slices on nonstick baking pan or dish.
  7. Arrange parsnip slices evenly across top of eggplant slices.
  8. Add no oil (fat-free).
  9. Add no sugars (diabetic free).
  10. Add no salt (hypertension free).
  11. Add modest amounts of whatever leafy spice you feel might improve flavor, if desired.
  12. Bake in 350°F oven for 45 minutes or until product is of desired texture (adding a small amount of distilled water and covering dish while cooking might help).
  13. Serves undetermined number of masochists for an undetermined number of days or weeks.
title: Eggplant-Parsnip Delight

directions:
1. In a large bowl, beat the eggs with the cream, chopped chives, salt and pepper.
  2. Melt the butter in a large pan over high heat.
  3. Fry the bacon strips until well done.
  4. Remove the bacon strips and drain on paper towels.
  5. In the same pan, pour in the eggs and stir fry over medium heat.
  6. Let it cook until the sides are done, then transfer to a large plate.
  7. Top with the cooked bacon strips.
  8. Serve with warm toasts and fruit juice for breakfast.
title: Chives Omelette with Bacon

directions:
1. I fill this jar with roughly equal amounts of fresh Greek oregano (a very strong, hot variety...beware as some fresh oregano is insipid), mint (for this, i like the yerba buena variety ...a coarse, strong spearmint), and winter savory (stronger flavored than summer savory).
  2. I generally try to bruise the leaves a bit. I pour the vinegar over the herbs, put a layer of waxed paper and a couple of layers of plastic wrap over the mouth of the bottle (to help retard the inevitable corrosion of the metal cap) and then screw on the jar lid.
  3. I place the jar either on a sunny windowsill or on the deck for a few weeks, and then strain the vinegar through a coffee filter and return it to the original vinegar bottle (which usually has a more corrosion-resistant lid). I don't like to leave any herbs in the vinegar, and don't like to add any for decoration, either, because they tend to add a funky taste that i don"t care for if they sit long enough
title: Homemade Greek Balsamic Vinegar

directions:
1. Mix flour and water, add onions and potato.
  2. Add a bit more water if needed to form thick pancake batter.
  3. Fry till golden brown with some darker spots in non-stick pan with a ½ second spray of PAM.
  4. Serve with applesauce.
title: Latkes I

directions:
1. Get a pound of dried fruit (I used apricots).
  2. Put in a heavy saucepan with enough water to cover.
  3. Simmer for two hours.
  4. If there is a lot of liquid left, but the fruit is plump and tender and breaking up, turn up the heat and evaporate the water away until there"s just a tad, like maybe ½ cup.
  5. Pour this into a blender and puree for about a minute.
  6. Comes out just a bit stiffer than baby food.
  7. Really really rich and tasty, sweet and tart.
  8. Perfect for my cream of wheat in the morning and toast.
title: The Easiest Fruit Spread Ever

directions:
1. PLACE milk, yogurt, carnation Instant Breakfast, blueberries and banana in blender; cover.
  2. Blend until smooth. NOTE: For added variety, blend in any flavor of fat free yogurt or unsweetened Berries.
  3. For a frostier drink, omit yogurt and blend in 1 cup (about 2 large scoops) of your favorite fat free frozen yogurt.
title: Blue Monkey Smoothie

directions:
1. In an 8" skillet, pour egg substitute|egg beaters, or substitute.
  2. Cover tightly; cook over low heat 10 min or until just set.
  3. Remove from heat; let stand, covered for 10 min.
  4. Remove from skillet and cool completely.
  5. Chop and use in your favorite egg salad recipe or sprinkle over salads or casseroles.
title: Mock Hard-cooked Eggs

directions:
1. spread open the fish
  2. sprinkle with seasonning salt, let stand for 10 minutes.
  3. in a small bowl mix mayonnaise|mayo and minced garlic
  4. spread on seasoned fish baked at 350 until brown
title: Baked Salmon

directions: 1. Combine in a blender or process with a hand blender and enjoy!
title: Blueberry Fool

directions:
1. Heat butter and cinnamon in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add apples, walnuts, onion and celery; sauté until vegetables are tender crisp.
  2. Stir in rice and salt; heat thoroughly.
title: Apple-Cinnamon Rice

directions:
1. Place rice cakes on baking sheet.
  2. Spread French Onion Cheese evenly on each rice cake;
  3. top with tomato slices, mozzarella Cheese, and crumbled Bacon.
  4. Broil at 400 degrees 3 to 5 minutes.
  5. Serve immediately.
title: Bacon and Tomato Rice Cakes

directions:
1. Blend soup and milk in large bowl.
  2. Combine with rice, Peas and Tuna.
  3. Turn into greased 2-quart baking dish.
  4. Top with onions.
  5. Bake at 350 degrees 20 to 25 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
title: Cheesy Tuna and Rice Bake

directions: 1. Process the fruit in a juicer and serve.
title: Fruit Nectar

directions: 1. Process the fruit in a juicer and serve.
title: Fruit Punch

directions:
1. Peel and grate in long thin shreads, the carrots and add finely diced celery.
  2. Melt butter in saucepan and add the vegetables. Stir.
  3. Cover and simmer over very low heat for 20 minutes, without browning the vegetables.
  4. Add milk (or use 1⁄2 milk, 1⁄2 cream); bring to a boil.
  5. Heat oysters in enamelled cast iron pan over medium heat; do not boil.
  6. Pour into milk and serve.
  7. Use salt and pepper to taste.
  8. The soup should be served as soon as ready, otherwise it tend to curdle.
  9. The milk and vegetables can be prepared ahead of time and the oysters heated and served at the last minute.
title: Christmas oyster soup

directions: 1. Process apples and ginger through a juicer and serve.
title: Gingered Apple Cider

directions:
1. Hard boil the eggs; place in cold water to cool off, cracking the shells to make them easier to peel. When cooled, peel and rinse.
  2. Bring water to a boil, add salt and cook macaroni as per package directions.
  3. Place the Raisins in a heat-proof bowl and ladle about 1/2 cup of the boiling water over them; leave them to soak and plump.
  4. When macaroni is cooked, drain, cover with cold water to halt the cooking process, drain again, and continue until macaroni is cool. Set aside to drain thoroughly.
  5. Put Granulated sugar|Sugar in the water in which you will cook the Peas, and cook in the microwave or on the stovetop until tender but not mushy.
  6. Drain the Peas and the Raisins.
  7. Scrub and trim the carrots and celery and shred finely.
  8. Immediately combine with the drained macaroni, Mayonnaise, black pepper and paprika.
  9. Stir gently to coat all ingredients with Mayonnaise.
  10. Add Peas and Raisins and fold to combine.
  11. Slice the hard boiled eggs and distribute on top the salad. Sprinkle with paprika to garnish.
  12. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
title: Hawaiian Salad

directions:
1. Cut fruit into good-sized pieces, except avocado, which is cut in small pieces.
  2. Blend banana, orange and Raisins until smooth.
  3. Mix well with fruit and sprinkle with fresh shredded coconut.
title: He-Man Belly Buster Fruit Salad

directions:
1. Prepare popcorn and place in a large bowl.
  2. Add peanuts and stir to mix.
  3. In a 2-cup microwave-safe measuring cup, combine butter, honey and cinnamon.
  4. Microwave on high until butter is melted, about 30 seconds to 1 minute.
  5. Drizzle butter mixture slowly over popcorn, stirring with a large spoon.
  6. Taste and salt lightly if necessary.
  7. Serve immediately while still warm.
title: Honeyed Popcorn and Peanuts

directions:
1. Put lamb on baking dish.
  2. Put salt and pepper on it.
  3. Then mix oil with herbs and splash it on lamb.
  4. Put it in pre-heated oven and bake it for 5 hours (3.5 for medium) on 250°C.
  5. Then after about 3 hours put in quarters sliced potatoes.
  6. When finished splash beer on meat and leave it for another about 20 – 30 minutes.
  7. Serve hot with potatoes.
title: Lamb Macedonian-style

directions:
1. In a heavy-based skillet, gently fry the onion until it turns opaque.
  2. Add the garlic and cook, stirring for 1 minute. Remove from pan and set aside.
  3. Cook bacon until it just turns a gentle brown. Don't over cook.
  4. Return all ingredients to pan & heat through.
title: Savory Tomatoes

directions:
1. Heat the oil in a large pan and toss the onion, garlic, celery, carrots, parsnips and potato in it over a low heat.
  2. Add the juice and water, marjoram, oregano, salt and pepper to taste.
  3. Increase the heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
  4. Add the drained chickpeas and the cabbage, if you are using it, and cook for a further 10 minutes.
title: Chunky Vegetable Stew with Chickpeas

directions:
1. Heat large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot.
  2. Add sausage and onion.
  3. Cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes or until sausage is browned and onion is tender.
  4. Stir in tomatoes and peas.
  5. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover and simmer 5 to 7 minutes until peas are thoroughly cooked.
  6. Stir in rice, cook 2 to 3 minutes or until mixture is thoroughly heated.
title: Creole Rice I

directions:
1. Peel parsnips and boil in salted water until tender.
  2. Cut into thick slices and place in baking dish.
  3. Cover with the honey, water, and butter.
  4. Bake 10 minutes.
  5. Turn parsnips over and bake 10 minutes more.
  6. Place under broiler to brown.
title: Honey Parsnips

directions: 1. Blend the honey and cinnamon thoroughly.
title: Cinnamon Paste

directions:
1. Use an unwaxed garden cucumber; wash, but don't peel.
  2. Slice it into food processor bowl.
  3. Add garlic.
  4. Process with pulse motion just until coarsely chopped.
  5. Empty mixture into filter-lined coffee cone to drain, for one hour or more.
  6. Season to taste.
title: Easy Garlic Relish

directions:
1. Spread the 2 vegan bread slices with the hummus.
  2. Slice the tomato and place on one vegan bread slice.
  3. Spread the torn-up basil over the tomato slices.
  4. Grind some pepper over that.
  5. Cover with the other vegan bread slice.
  6. Eat!
title: Basil and Hummus Sandwich

directions:
1. Combine chickpeas and berries in blender.
  2. Add some diced carrots, if desired.
  3. Chill and serve with blue corn chips for a tasty snack or dessert; also good with celery or carrot sticks.
title: Dessert Hummus

directions: 1. Combine rice, eggs, Ham, mustard, Onion, Mayonnaise and Cheese; mix well. Season to taste. Turn into buttered shallow casserole. Bake at 350 degrees 30 minutes or until heated through.
title: Ham and Chicken Imperial

directions:
1. Into large pot of boiling water, cook corn 5 minutes until tender.
  2. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients.
  3. In microwave, cook on high until butter is melted (1 - 1 ½ minutes).
  4. Serve corn brushed with herb butter.
title: Herbed corn on the cob

directions:
1. Grate the potatoes.
  2. Heat a frying pan.
  3. Take ½ to ⅓ of the grated potatoes and put in the frying pan.
  4. Spread it out, it should be thin as a lace.
  5. Fry until it's golden brown, turn and fry the other side.
  6. Serve with unsweetened (or sweetened with a low calories brand as Sweet 'n' Low). Lingonberry jam could be eaten alone or with some meat.
title: Raarakor

directions:
1. Place water in a teflon skillet with the garlic.
  2. Simmer 5 minutes.
  3. Remove the garlic.
  4. Add mushrooms and lemon juice.
  5. Cook, stirring frequently, for 3 – 5 minutes or until mushrooms are cooked to your taste.
title: Sautéed Mushrooms II

directions:
1. Place the crushed pineapple and juice in the blender.
  2. Add the frozen fruit a little at a time, blending between each addition.
  3. Scoop ½ cup servings into dessert dishes and freeze for 15 to 30 minutes.
  4. (If frozen for longer period of time, remove from freezer a few minutes before serving to soften).
title: Strawberry frozen fruit dessert

directions:
1. Thread shrimp on skewers.
  2. To broil in oven:
  3. place on broiler rack coated with cooking spray.
  4. Brush Shrimp with oil reserved from tomatoes.
  5. Broil 4 to 5 inches from heat 4 minutes.
  6. To cook on outdoor grill:
  7. brush shrimp with reserved oil from tomatoes.
  8. Cook skewered shrimp over hot coals 4 minutes.
  9. Turn and brush with additional oil.
  10. Grill 4 to 5 minutes or until done.
  11. In large bowl, combine rice, corn, tomatoes, cheese, basil and salt.
  12. Spoon into individual bowls.
  13. Top rice with shrimp.
title: Summertime Shrimp and Rice Bowls

directions:
1. Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat until hot.
  2. Add Onion, carrot, walnuts, marjoram, thyme and rosemary; cook and stir until vegetables are crisp-tender.
  3. Stir in rice and parsley; heat thoroughly.
  4. Serve immediately.
title: Herbed Walnut Rice

directions:
1. Remove giblet packet from turkey; rinse turkey with cool water.
  2. Drain; set aside.
  3. Saute' onion, celery, pecans and raisins in butter in large skillet over medium-high heat until vegetables are tender-crisp.
  4. Add ½ teaspoon cinnamon and salt; cook 1 minute.
  5. Combine vegetables with rice in large bowl.
  6. Stir in ¼ cup honey.
  7. Spoon rice into cavity of turkey.
  8. Use wooden picks, soaked in water, to enclose filling.
  9. Place turkey breast side up in roasting pan on rack coated with cooking spray.
  10. Roast at 325°F for 2 to 2½ hours or until internal temperature registers 180 to 185°F.
  11. Combine remaining ½ cup honey and remaining ¼ teaspoon cinnamon in small bowl to use as glaze.
  12. Glaze turkey occasionally during last hour of roasting.
  13. Cover with foil to prevent excess browning, if desired.
  14. Let stand 10 to 15 minutes.
  15. Remove stuffing before carving.
title: Honey Pecan Rice-stuffed Turkey

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 °F.
  2. Wash and pierce potatoes.
  3. Bake on baking sheet approximately one hour or until tender.
  4. Cut off top of potatoes, scoop out inside and put in bowl.
  5. Add butter, milk, salt, and pepper as you would for mashed potatoes.
  6. Mash together.
  7. Put stuffing back into skins and top with grated cheddar cheese.
  8. Return to oven to warm and melt cheese.
title: Gluten-free Twice-baked Potatoes

directions:
1. In medium saucepan, melt butter or margarine on low heat.
  2. Stir in flour until it forms a paste.
  3. Bring to medium-high heat.
  4. Add cheese.
  5. Stir constantly until melted.
  6. Cook 8 ounces of gluten free macaroni until just done.
  7. Do not overcook as the noodles will receive further cooking in the oven.
  8. Place cooked macaroni into greased 2-quart casserole dish.
  9. Add ham.
  10. Pour over cheese sauce.
  11. Stir all together gently.
  12. Bake in 350°F oven for 30 minutes.
title: Gluten-free Macaroni and Cheese

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 °F.
  2. Place layers in a greased oven-proof dish in this order:
  3. onion
  4. bacon
  5. potato
  6. repeat
  7. Top layer should be potato.
  8. Beat two eggs, add seasoning.
  9. Add milk and pour over the layers.
  10. Bake in oven at 375 °F until the top browns.
title: Gluten-free Bacon Potato Onion Pie

directions:
1. Combine and mix well.
  2. Store the mixture in small airtight jars in a dark cool location.
title: Herbs de Provence Mixture

directions:
1. Filet out the middle portion from back to front.
  2. Marinate for one day in a mixture of salt and 5% vinegar until the surface of the fish is 'cooked'.
  3. Freeze overnight and then slice as thin as possible.
  4. Serve with Glutinous rice|Japanese rice prepared on the same way as in previous recipe and form the sushi on the way described above.
  5. Don't forget to put you knife in water from time to time in order to prevent rice stickying to your knife when you slice them.
title: Home-boy Beginner Sushi

directions:
1. Take six eggs and beat well in a bowl.
  2. Add two tablespoons of cold water and the salt, pepper, parsley, grated onion and fine butter, shaved in little pieces.
  3. Mix well with a wooden spoon.
  4. Melt some butter in a skillet and add at once the beaten eggs, etc., inclining the skillet to the handle for an instant and then shaking the omelet into the centre and turn up the right edge, then the left and fry briskly five minutes and serve.
title: Herb Omelet

directions:
1. To 1 teacupful of boiled lentils take 3 well-beaten eggs, and pepper and salt to taste.
  2. Add 1 dessert spoonful of water to each egg, and mix the lentils and eggs smooth.
  3. Fry the mixture as an omelet in boiling butter.
title: Lentil Omelet

directions:
1. eat butter in skillet.
  2. dd Chicken and cook 12 to 15 minutes or until done.
  3. emove Chicken.
  4. repare stuffing in skillet according to pkg. directions except let 2 minutes.
  5. op with Chicken.
  6. ix soup and milk.
  7. our over Chicken.
  8. prinkle with Cheese.
  9. over and heat through.
title: Chicken and Stuffing Skillet

directions:
1. Remove giblets and neck from Turkey; wash, and set aside.
  2. Wash Turkey thoroughly inside and out.
  3. Pat dry with towels.
  4. Remove any excess fat.
  5. Prepare your choice of dressing.
  6. Preheat oven to 325 °F.
  7. Spoon some of dressing into neck cavity of Turkey.
  8. Bring skin of neck over back; fasten with poultry pin.
  9. Spoon remaining dressing into body cavity; do not pack.
  10. Insert 4 or 5 poultry pins at regular intervals.
  11. Lace cavity closed with twine, bootlace fashion and then tie.
  12. Bend wing tips under body, or fasten to body with poultry pins.
  13. Tie ends of legs together.
  14. Insert meat thermometer in inside of thigh at thickest part.
  15. Place Turkey on rack in shallow roasting pan.
  16. Brush with some butter; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
  17. Roast uncovered and brushing occasionally with remaining butter and pan drippings; about 4 ½ hours, or until meat thermometer registers 185 °F.
  18. Leg joint should move freely.
  19. When Turkey begins to turn golden, cover with a square of butter- soaked cheesecloth or a loose tent of foil, to prevent burning.
  20. While Turkey roasts, cook giblets and neck.
  21. Place Turkey on heated serving platter.
  22. Remove cheesecloth or foil, twine, and poultry pins.
  23. Let stand 20 to 30 minutes before carving.
title: Golden roast turkey

directions:
1. In a medium saucepan, stir together cornstarch|corn starch and ¼ cup of eggnog.
  2. Stir until smooth.
  3. Add remaining eggnog and rice.
  4. Cook on medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened and beginning to boil over (about 10 minutes).
  5. Pour into serving dishes.
  6. Garnish with nutmeg.
title: Eggnog Rice Pudding

directions:
1. Cut off a strip of fat from the outside rim of the ham, leaving a portion of the fat intact.
  2. Cut the strip of fat into small cubes.
  3. Using a sharp knife, cut the fat remaining on the ham at intervals down to the meat.
  4. Put the cubed fat into a skillet, preferably of black cast iron, and cook, stirring, until the fat is rendered.
  5. Scoop out and discard the rendered pieces of fat.
  6. Add the ham slice to the skillet and fry until nicely browned on one side.
  7. Turn the slice and continue frying until brown and cooked through.
  8. I remove the ham slice.
  9. Pour the coffee into the skillet and cook, stirring, about 1 minute.
  10. Cut the ham slice into 2 to 4 pieces and serve the gravy on the side, to be poured over grits and/or spooned over the ham pieces.
title: Fried Country Ham with Red-eye Gravy

directions:
1. Break matzohs in to pieces, soak in water and drain.
  2. Combine eggs, salt, honey, oil, cinnamon and horseradish and add to matzoh.
  3. Mix in nuts, apples and raisins.
  4. Place in greased 8 inch square baking dish and bake at 350 °F for 35 minutes.
title: Apple Matzoh Kugel

directions:
1. In three quart pot saute the chopped onions and carrots in the oil and water mixture for 10 minutes over medium heat.
  2. Add 6 cups water and seasonings.
  3. Bring to a boil.
  4. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
  5. Purée in blender, return mixture to pot, and reheat before serving.
title: Carrot Cream Soup

directions:
1. Mix all together.
  2. (use regular tablespoon to measure matzo meal|matzoh meal, not measuring spoon), 1 pour into greased casserole and bake at 400 °F for at least 1 hour.
  3. I like to bake longer because i like it really crusty.
title: Grandma's Potato Kugel

directions:
1. Grind all the fruits together along with the nuts.
  2. Add enough wind to make a moist paste.
  3. Refrigerate until serving i usually double this recipe as my family enjoys this spread on matzoh in the morning or as a snack during the day.
title: Sephardic for Charoses

directions:
1. Thaw strawberries completely; then purée. Allow the purée to come to room temperature.
  2. Beat together butter and honey. Beat or mix with the strawberry purée until light and fluffy. Cover and chill.
  3. To serve, scoop 2.5 oz. (¼ cup) into a serving bowl. Serve with toast or English muffin|English muffins. Reserve the fruit-based butter in the refrigerator.
title: Strawberry Honey Butter

directions:
1. Lightly coat 10¾ x 7-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
  2. In large saucepan, combine water and salt.
  3. Bring to a boil.
  4. Add cornmeal in slow stream, whisking constantly to keep lumps from forming.
  5. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring continuously with wooden spoon, until thickened, about 18 minutes.
  6. Add freshly ground pepper to taste.
  7. Spread cornmeal into prepared baking pan.
  8. Set aside until cool and firm, at least 30 minutes or overnight.
  9. Invert cornmeal cake onto work surface, and cut into 6 squares.
  10. Coat nonstick skillet with cooking spray, and heat over medium-high heat.
  11. Cook cornmeal cakes, in batches if necessary, until golden brown, 2 to 4 minutes per side.
  12. Serve topped with Shiitake Mushroom Gravy.
title: Grilled Cornmeal Cakes

directions:
1. Using small end of melon baller, scoop balls of flesh from cantaloupe halves, leaving about ¼-inch-thick shell.
  2. In medium bowl, combine melon balls, strawberries, blueberries and kirsch and toss gently.
  3. Cut thin slice from outside bottom of each cantaloupe shell so it sits securely.
  4. Divide fruit mixture among shells.
  5. Serve right away or cover and chill up to 1 hour.
title: Melon-Berry Cups

directions:
1. Divide into several 1 cup servings and freeze to be used as needed.
  2. (Any time we buy bananas and 1 or 2 get beyond our preference, I just peel the banana, cut it in 3-4 pieces and place in a container in the freezer.)
  3. (Any ripe fruit or fruit salad that may have lost some visual appeal also place in container in freezer.
  4. I use 1 container as a fruit catchall.
  5. If my son doesn't finish an Apple and it gets slightly brown or if I make a huge summer fruit salad and the next day it doesn't look very pretty I freeze it or make fruit pops or smoothies today.)
  6. Tupperware popsicle molds or small paper cups and popsicle sticks
  7. The day you wish to make these, take your blender out, a small container of yogurt and the ripe frozen fruit from the freezer.
  8. Break the yogurt into 2-4 pieces with a knife - be careful. Place in blender.
  9. Add some pineapple juice and blend. (Add enough liquid to your own preference.)
  10. Place 4-6 chunks of frozen banana or less banana with some other fruit.
  11. I've even added applesauce. Add more pineapple juice if necessary.
  12. Spin it together.
  13. Fill up popsicle molds first.
  14. Serve the rest as a nutritious smoothie.
title: Frozen Fruit-Yogurt Pops (or Smoothie)

directions:
1. Cut mangoes around stones to make halves; half again to make quarters (if mangoes are large, can slice again to make eighths); peel; set aside.
  2. Peel around stone and scrape flesh from around stones with a spoon; mash and reserve separately.
  3. Bend asparagus at bottom to break at natural breaking point.
  4. Blanch asparagus in salted boiling water 30 seconds, rinse in cold water and drain.
  5. Meanwhile mix cornstarch, ¼ cup water, lemon juice and mango mash in bowl.
  6. Melt butter in medium-low frying pan and lay asparagus in single layer.
  7. Roll asparagus to cover evenly in butter
  8. Add mango slices on top of asparagus and cover 1 minute until steam escapes from lid.
  9. Uncover, add cornstarch mixture and heat to thicken sauce, 30 seconds
title: Sauteed Asparagus with Mangoes

directions:
1. Mix all ingredients together and cook over low heat until mango is soft, approximately 20 minutes.
  2. Stir occasionally. Serve hot or cold.
title: Spiced Mango Sauce

directions:
1. Salt roast and cook in covered electric fry pan with enough water to cover bottom for about 1½-2 hours.
  2. Add vegetables around roast for last 30 minutes.
  3. For last 15 minutes, place mango slices on top of roast.
  4. Slice roast and serve with vegetables and mango slices.
title: Mango Pork Pot Roast

directions:
1. Blend all ingredients till smooth.
  2. Use on bread and vegetables, but note that it does not melt well.
title: Vegan Butter

directions:
1. Cook onion and celery in margarine in medium-size skillet, covered, over medium heat until tender, 8–10 minutes.
  2. Scrape into bowl.
  3. Soak matzohs in water to cover 3–5 minutes.
  4. Drain; squeeze dry.
  5. Add to bowl.
  6. Add chestnuts, mushrooms, thyme, rosemary, sage, parsley, salt, pepper and eggs.
  7. Stuff 12 – 14 pound turkey meat|turkey; roast as you ordinarily would.
  8. Or bake stuffing in greased shallow 2-quart oven-proof casserole in preheated moderate oven (350 °F) for 45 minutes.
title: Passover Stuffing with Chestnuts and Mushroom

directions:
1. Place liver, water and garlic in glass bowl in microwave and cook on high for about 10 minutes.
  2. Remove from microwave and drain juice. (Save this juice for mixing with Kibble 'cuz it's Yummy.)
  3. Remove garlic cloves.
  4. Dice the liver into bite-size pieces and place on paper towel.
  5. Microwave for a further 10 minutes. (Times will vary with different micros, but ours is a powerful one and these times work well on "high" temp.)
  6. Store in airtight container in fridge.
title: Valentine Kisses for Baby

directions:
1. In a 2- to 2½-quart pitcher, combine above ingredients * serve, or cover and chill at least 2 hours or up to 8 hours.
  2. Add ice cubes just before serving.
  3. Makes about 1½ quarts; about 4 servings.
title: Herb-infused Spa Water

directions:
1. Use a collins glass (these are called "(iced) tea glasses" in the south).
  2. Fill half-way with bourbon.
  3. Add ice.
  4. Fill rest of the way with lemonade (the more tart the better).
  5. Do not stir.
  6. Garnish with an orange slice or a cherry if you're a girl, or gay or something.
  7. Add a plastic sword (with or without the garnish) because plastic swords are cool, and can be used later to poke people who annoy you.
  8. Drink. Repeat. Often.
title: Delicious

directions:
1. Mix corn meal and salt in bowl.
  2. Pour boiling water in center (like well) and knead to a stiff dough with a spatula or big spoon.
  3. Divide it into about 10 balls and roll each out to a circular disc shape (about ⅛ inch thick, and 4 inches in diameter).
  4. Cook breads in either on a skillet with oil or ghee until brown on both sides on low-medium heat.
  5. Serve hot with Chutney.
title: Makki ki Roti

directions:
1. Mash the bananas and mix well with the salt, granulated sugar|sugar, and ufa.
  2. Fry spoonfuls of this mixture in very hot oil.
title: Zitumbuwa

directions:
1. Use a wooden spoon to stir nsima.
  2. Heat the water in the saucepan until luke warm.
  3. Mix a little of the ufa with the water, stirring well to make sure there are no lumps.
  4. Bring to a boil, stirring well, then lower the heat and let boil gently for a few minutes.
  5. The mixture should look like a thin transparent porridge.
  6. Sprinkle the remaining ufa over, a little at a time, stirring continuously to avoid lumps from forming, until the desired consistency is reached.
  7. Keep stirring until the nsima is smooth and well cooked.
  8. A little butter or margarine may be stirred in at this stage.
  9. Serve in a dish accompanied by a relish such as pumpkin leaves or tabasco sauce.
title: Nsima

directions:
1. Saute onions in oil until tender.
  2. Add remaining ingredients, cover and simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes or until greens are tender.
  3. Serve with nsima or rice.
title: Basic Vegetable Ndiwo

directions:
1. Chop finely the cabbage, about 3 cups chopped.
  2. Add water to cover and cook until tender.
  3. Drain off all but 1 cup of the water.
  4. Add 3 cups milk and 1 cup cream.
  5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  6. Serve hot.
title: Cabbage Soup

directions:
1. Buy a skinned leg of goat at a butcher shop or market place.
  2. Cut the meat away from the bone.
  3. Dust the meat with a mixture of 2 cups flour.
  4. 1 tsp salt and dash of pepper.
  5. In a large pan, melt ½ cup margarine.
  6. Put the meat in a pan and sprinkle with a tsp of sage or marjoram.
  7. Bake at 350°F oven for 2 hours, spooning pan juices over the meat every 15 – 20 minutes.
  8. For a clear gravy, add hot water to pan juices; for heavy gravy, add 3 tbsp flour or corn flour|ufa to ½ cup water or milk to make a paste to add to the gravy.
title: Roast Goat

directions:
1. Dry peanuts in the oven until the skin can be rubbed off and the nuts are a deep biscuit in colour.
  2. Crush with a rolling pin, or mince, to a very fine meal.
  3. Strain the stock and simmer with the nut meal for ½ hour or more.
  4. Season to taste.
  5. Before serving, stir in milk, or even better, ½ small tin unsweetened sweetened condensed milk|condensed milk, add a little butter and serve.
title: Peanut Soup

directions:
1. boil Potato peeled and made in small pieces
