  2. cut tomato, cucumber, Onion into small pieces
  3. mix with Potato pieces, add slices of boiled eggs and add salt and pepper to taste.
  4. add a little lemon and serve as such or cold
title: Shahi Salad

directions:
1. Peel and cut plantains, either into thin slices, or slice each plantain in half and cut each half lengthwise.
  2. Heat the oil in a pan or skillet on the stove top.
  3. Add plantains (in a single layer) and fry until golden.
  4. Serve with African Hot Sauce or salt as a snack, an appetizer, or a side dish.
  5. Can also be served sprinkled with granulated sugar|sugar as a snack or dessert.
title: Matoke I

directions:
1. Place in a large dish.
  2. Blend together the oil, lemon juice, garlic, paprika and seasonings in a small bowl.
  3. Pour over the .
  4. Cover loosely with clear film and leave in a cool place to marinate for up to 2 hours.
  5. Thread the cubes onto skewers, alternating with pieces of tomato and Onion.
  6. Grill the kebabs for 7 to 10 minutes, basting frequently with the remaining marinade and turning occasionally.
title: Swordfish Kebabs

directions:
1. In a medium-sized saucepan, boil the Onion and tomatoes with the ground peanuts, adding salt to taste and water as needed.
  2. After a few minutes, add chopped greens. Stirring occasionally, continue cooking until the peanuts are soft and the mixture has become a fairly thick buttery sauce (15 – 20 minutes).
  3. Serve hot or cold.
title: SIMPLE IFISASHI

directions:
1. Sauté onion in oil until it starts to brown.
  2. Add tomatoes and sauté another few minutes.
  3. Add dried kapenta and cook 5 to 7 minutes over a hot fire. water may be added if you prefer a wetter gravy.
title: Kapenta Stew

directions:
1. Fry chicken pieces in hot oil in a heavy stewing pan until well browned.
  2. Drain chicken and set aside.
  3. In same oil, sauté onion until golden brown.
  4. Add water and salt and bring to a boil.
  5. Return chicken pieces to pan and simmer 20 minutes.
  6. Add nut meal|ground nuts or peanut butter and continue cooking until chicken is tender.
title: Zambian Chicken Stew

directions:
1. Measure ¼ lb drip grind coffee in a 2-quart glass or enamel saucepan.
  2. Stir in 1 egg, slightly beaten and enough water to mix thoroughly (about ½ cup).
  3. Pour 1 quart rapidly boiling water over the coffee and stir up.
  4. Bring slowly to a boil, stirring occasionally.
  5. Remove from heat, cover, and allow to stand for 3 to 4 minutes.
  6. Strain through fine sieve or cheese cloth into hot serving pot.
  7. Pour in small demitasse cups.
  8. Serve black.
title: Demitasse Dakar

directions:
1. In a bowl, combine all the ingredients, cover and refrigerate for 2 – 4 hours
  2. At serving time, taste and adjust the seasoning, then serve immediately
title: Salatet Zabady bil Ajur

directions:
1. Mince beef and onions twice (till smooth consistency),soak bread in water and add to meat together w/ the seasoning.
  2. Mix well and shape into rounds 2 – 3 inch in diameter.
  3. Grill or fry on skewers or in a double grill until cooked.
title: Koftah

directions:
1. Mix Mayonnaise and soup powder with and bananas.
  2. Arrange lettuce leaves in cocktail shells or glasses.
  3. Spoon mixture onto lettuce leaves.
  4. Sprinkle with paprika and decorate with lemon slices.
title: QUICK TUNA STARTER

directions: 1. Heat the 80 ml water in a covered container (pot) until warm. Add a little sorghum / pearl millet meal to the warm water and stir continuously to avoid lumps, until boiling point. Let the thin porridge boil for 10 - 15min. Add some more sorghum/pearl millet meal, a bit at a time, while continuing to stir until the porridge becomes thick. Simmer under low heat for 10 - 15min for sorghum and 20 - 25min for pearl millet. Serve hot with meat, green vegetables or stew for lunch or supper.
title: Ugali (Stiff Porridge)

directions:
1. Peel and slice the plantains. Depending on the desired result, the plantains can be sliced into thin rounds, cut into coarse dice, or cut lengthwise in strips. While the plantains are being cut up, heat the oil to 350 - 375 °F in a heavy skillet.
  2. When the oil is hot, add the plantain pieces a few at a time. Cook until the edges are brown and crispy. Turn and cook on the other side. Remove and drain on absorbent paper. Cook the remainder of the plantains in the same manner.
  3. Serve warm. Depending on whether you wish your plantains to be snack, an accompaniment to vegetables, or a dessert, you may sprinkle them with salt, red chile powder|chile powder, or powdered sugar.
title: Fried Plantain

directions:
1. Chop the avocado into cubes.
  2. Place peanuts and spices in food processor and grind into a fine mixture.
  3. Sprinkle mixture over avocado with finely chopped chives.
  4. Chill and serve.
title: Peanut with Avocado Dressing

directions:
1. Wash the seeds well, rubbing to remove any pulp.
  2. Stir salt into the wet seeds.
  3. Heat on the stove a dry empty pot or large skillet - preferably cast iron.
  4. Add the salted seeds.
  5. Cook for 6 or 8 minutes over moderate heat, stirring continuously.
  6. Seeds are ready when they have cracked open.
  7. They are meant to be savored one at a time, rather than in handfuls.
title: Dithotse

directions:
1. Combine the rice, water, turmeric and salt in a 2 - 3 litre dish. Cover with clingwrap, pierce, and cook on High for 10 mins. Stir in the Raisins and cook on High for another 5 mins.
  2. Tip into a sieve and rinse in cold running water. Return the rice to a clean dish, stir in the butter and honey and reheat on High for 5 mins, stirring once.
title: Yellow Rice with Raisins and Honey

directions:
1. Heat a cup of water to boiling in a medium-size saucepan.
  2. Meanwhile, in a bowl or measuring cup, gradually add ¾ cup of the cornmeal to the milk, stirring briskly to make a smooth paste.
  3. Add the mixture to the boiling water, continuing to stir constantly.
  4. Cook for 4 or 5 minutes while adding the remaining cornmeal.
  5. When the mixture begins to pull away from the sides of the pot and stick together, remove from heat.
  6. Dump bidia into a bowl.
  7. Then, with damp hands, shape it into a smooth ball, flipping it so that the rounded sides of the bowl help to smooth it.
  8. Serve immediately.
  9. To eat in the traditional manner, tear off a small chunk and make an indentation in it with your thumb.
  10. Use this hollow as a “bowl” to scoop up sauces and stews.
  11. Variations : for a less conventional, but delicious porridge, dump half a cup of yellow cornmeal into a cup or more of boiling water.
  12. It will form lumps, but if you stir and mash vigorously with a strong wire whisk, the lumps will disappear.
  13. Add more cornmeal as necessary until you have a consistency similar to cream of wheat.
  14. Cook for 3 or 4 minutes, stirring constantly.
  15. Serve hot.
title: Bidia

directions:
1. Soak rice in water for 4 hrs, then drain it and grind it to make fine powder.
  2. Heat the powder for 5 mts. While heating stir it. Keep it for cooling.
  3. Mix salt with water sprinkle this to the powdered rice just to make the powder wet. For making puttu special utensil is used named puttukutty or micro puttu. Put a handful of grated coconut in the puttukutty and then put rice powder till half then add another handful of grated coconut.
  4. This is done till the top. Close the lid steam it for 2 mts in cooker. Serve it with Potato curry or ghee.
title: Rice Puttu

directions:
1. In a heavy stewing pan, sauté chicken pieces in hot oil until nicely browned.
  2. Add onion, tomatoes, potatoes, salt, pepper, and enough water to just cover.
  3. Cover pan and simmer until chicken is cooked, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
title: Ugandan Chicken Stew

directions:
1. Combine Onion and tomatoes and toss with curry powder. In a heavy stewing pan, sauté mixture in a small amount of oil until onions are yellow.
  2. Add nuts and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to simmer, stirring constantly until simmering stage is reached. Continue cooking, uncovered, until nuts are well cooked.
  3. Season with salt to taste. At this point, if sauce is not reduced and slightly thickened, increase heat and reduce liquid until proper consistency. Mix in cooked spinach.
title: GROUNDNUT SAUCE

directions:
1. In a stewing pan, add enough water to meat to barely cover. Season with salt, bring to a boil, and simmer until tender, about 1 hour. remove meat and drain, reserving stock.
  2. Sauté onions in butter or oil until golden brown. Add tomatoes and continue sautéing 5 minutes. Add meat and brown. Stir in curry powder; continue cooking until flavors have blended. Add enough of reserved stock to make stew of desired consistency.
title: Bunyoro Stew

directions:
1. Place thinly sliced onions in a bowl and wash it 2 – 3 times in hot water and add salt.
  2. Mix in the half of the seeds from the pomegranate with sliced onions.
  3. Crush and strain the other half of the seeds to make juice and add to onion mixture.
  4. Serve the salad decorated with onion cups filled with pomegranate seeds.
title: Anor va Piyozli Gazak

directions:
1. Add the lukewarm water and flour, ½ cup at a time.
  2. If necessary, beat in is as much of the remaining ½ cup of flour as you need to make a dough that does not stick to your fingers.
  3. Gather the dough into a large, compact ball.
  4. Divide dough into 150 – 200 g (5 – 7 oz) pieces and roll into balls.
  5. Flatten into round bread, 2 – 3 cm (¾ – 1 inch) at edges and 5 mm (<sup><small>3</small></sup>/<small>16</small> inch) in the center.
  6. Make a pattern in the center with a chekish.
  7. Sprinkle water on the underside and bake in a tandoor.
title: Obi-non

directions:
1. Dilute yeast in warm milk.
  2. Mix in little sifted flour and oil.
  3. Add the rest of the flour and salted water as necessary.
  4. Knead dough and let stand covered in warm place.
  5. Divide dough into 150 – 200g (5 – 7 oz) pieces and roll into balls.
  6. Flatten into round bread, 2 cm (¾ in) at edges and 1 cm (⅖ in) in the center.
  7. Make a pattern in the center with a chekish.
  8. Sprinkle water on the underside and bake in a tandoor or an oven.
title: Sutli Non

directions:
1. Combine 1 cup flour, salt and yeast in a large bowl.
  2. Heat milk to hot (125°F to 130°F) in saucepan, then stir into flour.
  3. Add enough flour to make moderately stiff dough, two and a half to three cups.
  4. Knead 10 minutes.
  5. Let rise, covered in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 2 hours.
  6. Punch risen dough down and divide into 6 balls.
  7. On 3 lightly greased baking sheets, flatten balls with hands into round pizza shapes 7 or 8 inches in diameter and ¼ inch thick in center, with 1 inch wide raised edges about 1 inch thick.
  8. Using ice pick or head of brad, cover flat center of bread with decorative holes in concentric circles.
  9. Cover loaves in cloth and let stand 10 minutes.
  10. Brush loaves with beaten egg.
  11. Bake at 400°F until browned, 15 to 20 minutes.
title: Oi Naani

directions:
1. Mix Sosoma with 1 cup of cold water.
  2. Add this mixture to the boiling water and stir gently for 5 to 10 minutes.
  3. Allow it to cool for several minutes and then add Granulated sugar|Sugar or salt if it is available.
title: Ugandan Porridge

directions:
1. Cook the Peas in enough water to cover until tender, about 1½ hours. Peel bananas and lay them whole on top of the Peas without mixing. Continue to cook for about 10 minutes until bananas are soft, adding a bit of water if necessary to prevent Peas from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
  2. Meanwhile, heat the palm oil in a skillet or pot large enough to hold the Peas and bananas. Brown the onions. Then with a slotted spoon, remove bananas and Peas from the first pot and add to the onions. Sprinkle in the salt and continue to cook over medium heat, stirring gently but constantly, until oil has been absorbed. Serve hot.
  3. Serves 6 - 8.
title: Bananas and Green Split Peas

directions: 1. Heat the 80 ml water in a covered container (pot) until warm. Add a little sorghum / pearl millet meal to the warm water and stir continuously to avoid lumps, until boiling point. Let the thin porridge boil for 10 - 15min. Add some more sorghum/pearl millet meal, a bit at a time, while continuing to stir until the porridge becomes thick. Simmer under low heat for 10 - 15min for sorghum and 20 - 25min for pearl millet. Serve hot with meat, green vegetables or stew for lunch or supper.
title: Sadza/Bogobe/Pap/Ugali (Stiff Porridge)

directions: 1. Peel the plantains or green bananas and place in a steamer or a saucepan with a rack in the bottom. Add water, leaving the bananas above the level of the water. Add salt and pepper. Bring contents to boiling point; reduce heat and steam bananas until soft. Lift bananas from the liquid and mash well. Place in top of double saucepan over simmering water until ready to serve with Chicken stew.
title: Plantains with Chicken Stew

directions:
1. Place chicken in soup kettle, add water and bring to a boil.
  2. Add salt and vegetables.
  3. Simmer 1–2 hours or until chicken is tender.
  4. If desired, a pinch of saffron or mace may be added to give it a distinct flavor.
  5. When ready to serve, you may add cooked noodles or rice.
  6. Chicken can be used plain, creamed or in salad.
title: Kurja Juha

directions: 1. In Eastern Africa, milk is consumed fresh, as soured milk or buttermilk, or made into curdled milk (similar to what is called cottage cheese in the United States). butter is also made and is used to make ghee (a sort of clarified butter) which is used as an oil for frying.
title: Maziwa, Maziwa Mabichi, and Mtindi (milk, curdled milk, buttermilk)

directions:
1. Place the bones in a large stockpot, add the cold water, and bring to a boil over high heat.
  2. Let boil 5 minutes, and skim off as much of the foam and fat that has risen to the surface as possible.
  3. Reduce the heat and add the carrot, Onion, and herb bundle.
  4. Simmer partly covered over low heat, skimming occasionally, 2 to 2-1/2 hours.
  5. Strain the broth, and let cool, if possible, over a bowl of ice.
  6. Refrigerate overnight, and remove the fat that has congealed on the surface.
  7. This broth will keep 3 to 4 days refrigerated or up to 6 months in the freezer.
  8. Remember that this broth is unsalted.
title: Caldo de Huesos

directions:
1. Clean casings well and soak in cold water. Place the head in pot of salted water and cook until meat falls from the bones. Cook the Veal lung separately.
  2. Remove all meat from head and put through food chopper with cooked lung. Add salt, pepper, spices and cooked rice.
  3. Mix and set aside to cool. When cool, add blood and mix well. Remove casings from water, fill with meat and blood mixture, tie ends and bring together to form a ring.
  4. Drop sausages in boiling water and simmer for about 10 minutes (do not boil). Remove from water and cool.
  5. Store in refrigerator. When ready to use, place in skillet with a little fat and either bake or pan fry for from 35 to 45 minutes covered.
  6. Prick with toothpick several times.
  7. The remaining water could be used as blood soup named godla. Add cooked rice.
title: Krvavica

directions:
1. In a bowl, beat eggs until yellow and thick. Then add the salt, and oil.
  2. Next, add the flourand milk alternately until well blended and smooth.
  3. Fill the greased cupcake pans or the greased pyrex dishes (approximately these dishes hold about 1/2 to 3/4 cups of batter(dough).
  4. Fill the pans with 2/3 cup of batter.
  5. Bake in a preheated 220 degree C. oven for 30 minutes, now turn the oven off and with a sharp knife or fork prick the popover and allow them to sit in hot oven for another 10 minutes.
  6. I like to remove themfrom the pans immediately so moisture does not ruin them. Put them in a napkin-lined basket.
  7. Serve warm with butter and Jelly or Jam.
title: Luncheon Popovers

directions:
1. All ingredients should be room temperature.
  2. Add ingredients (except the raisins) according to the bread machine directions.
  3. Bake on full cycle; add raisins after the first 20 minutes.
title: Ethiopian Honey Bread II

directions:
1. Pre-heat the oven to about 350 degrees.
  2. Peel each plantain that you are going to bake.
  3. Place in the oven, and bake until it is as brown as you would like it.
  4. Remove, and either serve like that, or cut them before serving.
title: Boli

directions:
1. Take the husks off the corn|maize, and rinse them if desired.
  2. Place the corn|maize in a pot and add enough water to cover it.
  3. Add about 2 teaspoons of salt.
  4. Cook the corn|maize until it is soft.
  5. Drain the corn|maize.
title: Boiled Maize

directions:
1. Add Diced potatoes, bell peppers in fresh garlic, lemon in a bowl.
  2. Stir in the bowl.
  3. Add a little salt to taste.
  4. Chill and serve with olive oil dressing .
title: Ethiopian Potato Salad

directions:
1. Mix the above ingredients together.
  2. If the mixture is too runny, thicken with a bit of flour and mix again.
  3. Drop one spoonful at a time into hot oil (375°F) and fry until golden.
title: Frituras de Maiz Tierno

directions:
1. In general, okra is used much more as a condiment than as a sauce in itself.
  2. okra is in fact added to a sauce so that it isn't too runny, but sticks together well enough to stick to the boule.
  3. okra may be used for sauce preparation as much with vegetables as with meat, be it fresh or dried.
  4. When using fresh okra, we cut it into very small pieces, then we add it to the vegetables into boiling water.
  5. We wait until the two (okra, vegetables) are well-cooked before adding any condiments (salt, Peanut butter, Maggi soy sauce or bouillon cubes, piment (hot spice), etc.).
  6. Then one must leave the sauce on the fire for a few minutes before serving.
  7. When using dried okra, we grind it into powder and put a certain quantity (in general, a tablespoon per litre of water for making sauce) in at the same time as the other condiments.
  8. In rare cases, okra is prepared alone as a sauce in itself (for example, during the time between sowing the fields and harvest).
  9. In this case, the sauce is composed of water, salt and okra (fresh or dried), cooked together. The quantity of okra must be sufficient enough for the sauce to be a sauce and not simply water.
title: Daraba

directions:
1. Cut the fish into pieces, after having washed and wiped it dry.
  2. Spread small pieces of garlic as deep as possible into the flesh of fish.
  3. Dip the pieces of fish in the flour.
  4. Heat the oil in a cast iron pan and place the fish in it once the oil is very hot.
  5. When the pieces are golden brown, add the tomatoes, sliced along the middle, add salt, and the other spices, and cover the pan.
  6. Let it simmer at low temperature for about 40 minutes. Check to see when it is ready, and add a few spoonfuls of water if necessary.
  7. Serve very hot, fresh off the fire.
title: Broiled Fish

directions:
1. If you are using peanuts (instead of Peanut butter), make your own homemade Peanut paste:
  2. Remove the peanuts' shells, roast the peanuts on a baking sheet in a hot oven, or in a large skillet on the stove, stirring often, then remove the skins.
  3. Place the peanuts in a saucepan, add a few tablespoons of water to partially cover them and bring to a slow boil, stirring often.
  4. Reduce heat.
  5. Crush peanuts with a potato-masher.
  6. In a large pot bring two cups of water to a boil. Add greens.
  7. Cover and cook on high heat for ten minutes, stirring often.
  8. Reduce heat.
  9. Remove most of the liquid from the pot and save half of it.
  10. Add tomatoes and Onion to the greens, stir and simmer for ten minutes or more.
  11. In a bowl combine the Peanut butter with enough of the liquid from the cooking pot to allow it to be mixed until smooth.
  12. Add Peanut butter mixture to greens.
  13. Season to taste.
  14. Simmer on very low heat until greens are tender to your liking.
title: Greens in Peanut Sauce

directions:
1. Heat most of the oil in a large skillet.
  2. Peel plantains.
  3. Cut plantains into disks of equal thickness.
  4. Fry the plantains in the hot oil for several minutes, until they are golden brown.
  5. Remove them from the oil and place them on absorbent paper.
  6. Heat the rest of the oil in a deep pot.
  7. Fry the peppers and onion over high heat for a few minutes, stirring often.
  8. Add the fried plantains to the peppers and onion.
  9. Add a spoonful of water, cover and simmer at a low heat for a few minutes.
  10. Salt to taste.
  11. Serve hot, alone or as a side dish.
title: Plantains in Palm Oil

directions:
1. Put all the ingredients in a big pot with about 1½ cups of water, season with salt and pepper, add spices if you will be using them.
  2. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until the chicken is tender, about 1½ hours.
  3. You can serve this as is with couscous or bread.
  4. You can gently wipe off the sauce on the chicken, butter it and brown it in a very hot oven.
  5. The sauce can be passed through a sieve or a food mill for a more refined texture or it can be puréed in a blender.
title: Djej bil Qara

directions:
1. Peel the plantains and cut into 1 inch thick slices.
  2. In a deep frying pan heat the oil and fry the plantains till golden brown.
  3. Flatten the plantains using the bottom of a flat-bottomed glass bottle.
  4. Fry the plantains again for 30 seconds on each side.
  5. Mix the water, a pinch of salt and the mashed garlic.
  6. Stir and pour over the plantains. Serve immediately.
title: Tostones

directions:
1. Deep fry the plantains until golden brown.
  2. Sprinkle a little salt if you so desire.
  3. Serve immediately.
title: Fritos Maduros

directions:
1. Boil the codfish until it is tender. Change the water if necessary to get rid of the salt.
  2. Flake the Cod very finely. Chop the Onion and herbs in the food processor.
  3. Mix all the ingredients except the oil. In a shallow frying pan heat the oil.
  4. Pour the mixture one spoonful at a time making small cakes.
  5. Fry the cakes till golden brown on both sides. Serve immediately.
title: Bacalaitos

directions:
1. Heat up 3 spoons of oil, add the salt and water.
  2. Bring to a boil and then add the rice, stirring regularly to avoid excessive sticking.
  3. When all the water has evaporated cover with a tight fitting lid and allow to simmer at very low heat. #Wait 15 minutes and remove lid, stir, add the remaining oil and cover again.
  4. In 5 minutes the rice should be firm but tender inside.
  5. If necessary, cover and leave another 5 minutes on very low heat.
title: Arroz blanco

directions:
1. Put the water to boil.
  2. Add curry and half the oil.
  3. Stir until the curry dissolves.
  4. Add the rice and stir regularly to avoid sticking.
  5. When all the water has evaporated add the carrots, Onion and salt to taste and cover with a tight fitting lid and simmer on very low heat.
  6. Wait 15 minutes and uncover, stir, add the remaining oil and cover again.
  7. Wait another 5 minutes.
  8. Try the rice, it should be firm but tender inside.
  9. If necessary, cover and leave another 5 minutes on very low heat.
title: Rice and curry

directions:
1. Make a brine from the salt and water.
  2. Soak the chiles for an hour in the brine.
  3. Heat a good quantity of oil.
  4. When it's very hot, deep fry the chiles until they are crisp.
  5. Drain, salt and serve.
title: Sri Lanka Fried Chiles

directions:
1. Boil water in a large pot, with the meat, salt, Onion, and turnip for 1 hour.
  2. Then drain the broth and add the potatoes.
  3. When the potatoes are cooked, add the ground corn little by little, adding water is it is too thick.
  4. Let it boil for 15 minutes, stirring until it thickens. It should have a creamy consistancy.
title: Lagua de Choclo

directions:
1. Put the Cauliflower heads in a large pot with plenty of boiling salt and water. Let them cook until they are soft. Drain and let cool.
  2. Cut the Cauliflower into bite size pieces and add salt, pepper, vinegar, and oil. This is a delicious dish to accompany a meat dish.
  3. So that the Cauliflower doesn't emit a bad odor while cooking, add a little cloth bag with bread crumbs. Change the bag for with each cooking. Also add a couple tablespoons of milk.
title: Ensalada de Coliflor

directions:
1. Wash the radishes, chop into strips without peeling.
  2. Add oil and vinegar to taste and serve.
title: Ensalada de Rabanos

directions:
1. Peel plantains and cut into ½ inch slices.
  2. Fry in hot oil until they turn golden.
  3. Put on a board and flatten the slices with a rolling pin.
  4. Sprinkle some salt on them and put them back in the pan, frying until crispy.
  5. Drain and serve.
title: Fried Plantains

directions:
1. Cook 3 lbs potatoes in boiling salted water.
  2. Remove the skins and mash.
  3. Season to taste. butter may be added but do not add liquid.
title: Foo-foo

directions:
1. Sauté sorghum in oil, stirring to separate grains.
  2. Lower heat, add stock and peanuts, and seasoning to taste.
  3. Cover tightly and simmer for 20 minutes.
title: Sorghum and Peanuts

directions:
1. If using canned fruits: drain and save the liquid.
  2. Peel and remove seeds from the fresh fruit as necessary, cut fruit into bite-sized pieces.
  3. Combine all fruit in a glass bowl.
  4. Add the lemon juice (or mint leaves), some granulated sugar|sugar water (water which has been boiled, mixed with granulated sugar|sugar, and allowed to cool—or use some of the liquid from the canned fruits).
  5. Stir gently.
  6. There should only be enough liquid to coat the fruit; it does not have to be covered in liquid.
  7. Cover the fruit salad and allow it to stand for a half hour before serving.
  8. The fruit salad may be refrigerated after it has stood for an hour.
  9. It should be eaten the same day it is made.
  10. It does not keep well overnight.
  11. Top with grated coconut or chopped peanuts immediately before serving.
title: Somali Fruit Salad

directions:
1. Add salt to the spinach to taste and cook until it's well done.
  2. spinach turns a dark green, shrivles and is limp to the touch when it's done. Don't over cook or it may become rubbery or slimy.
  3. Meanwhile, saute the onions until they are tender.
  4. Then, combine the tomatoes and onions and then add to the spinach.
  5. Keep stirring until it's well combined and then add the grounded peanuts or the Peanut butter and stir to mix well.
  6. Allow to cool slightly before serving.
title: Kisamvu Na Karanga

directions:
1. Put tamarind residue in a nonmetallic bowl, add 1/2 cup boiling water, and let soak for 30 minutes. Mash the residue and extract as much tamarind essence as possible, squeezing it hard, into a bowl. Discard the fibrous residue.
  2. Put tamarind juice|tamarind water in a nonmetallic pan along with cornstarch, mix well and bring to a boil. Cook for 2 minutes. Turn off heat and stir in ginger shreds.
title: GINGER-TAMARIND SAUCE

directions:
1. Fry the chicken in hot oil until golden.
  2. Remove pieces and cook onions in the same pot.
  3. When they, too, are golden brown, return chicken pieces to the pot and add tomatoes, celery, salt and chile pepper|hot pepper.
  4. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is tender.
title: Chicken with Tomato Sauce

directions:
1. Cook the Peas in enough water to cover until tender, about 1 1/2 hours.
  2. Peel bananas and lay them whole on top of the Peas without mixing.
  3. Continue to cook for 10 minutes until bananas are soft, adding a bit of water if necessary to prevent Peas from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
  4. Meanwhile, heat the palm oil in a skillet or pot large enough to hold the Peas and bananas. Brown the onions. Then with a slotted spoon, remove bananas and Peas from the first pot and add to the onions.
  5. Sprinkle in the salt and continue to cook over medium heat, stirring gently but constantly, until oil has been absorbed. Serve hot.
title: Bananas with Green Split Peas

directions:
1. Blanch, peel and then fry the almonds in oil until golden brown, place on paper towels to drain.
  2. In a pan, melt the butter, add pitted dates and stir well over low heat; dates should not stick to the sides of the pan.
  3. Remove from stove top; add the cardamom and leave to cool.
  4. Take small piece of date dough, place an almond in the center and roll into a finger shape.
  5. Repeat using all of the date dough.
  6. Roll each date finger in the coconut and arrange on a serving dish.
title: Tumr bel Nargine

directions:
1. Peel the plantain and cut off and discard both ends.
  2. Cut into sections, rub with the lime and cook in the boiling salted water for about 30 minutes, until tender.
title: Boiled Plantain

directions:
1. Stroke eggplant, cut off stem and peel it into stripes.
  2. Cut crosswise into 2 parts, then cut each part lengthwise into ¼-inch-thick pieces.
  3. Suck eggplant pieces in warm salted water for about ½ hour.
  4. Put a super heavy plate on the pieces to keep them submerged.
  5. Drain eggplant piece
  6. Brush pieces heavily with olive oil, and arrange them in a cookie sheet in one layer.
  7. Broil them in the oven, turning once.
  8. About 10 minutes.
  9. Mix together yogurt, garlic, salt, your cumin and coriander.
  10. On a flat big platter, arrange eggplant pieces in a single layer (pieces may overlap a little).
  11. Spoon yogurt mixture all over the eggplant.
  12. Sprinkle with chile, and garnish with parsley and tomato.
  13. Serve with warm bread and huge eggplant.
  14. If the amount is more than you can consume in one sitting, refrigerate eggplant pieces and yogurt in two separate containers.
  15. Combine and garnish just before serving.
title: Browned Eggplant with Yogurt

directions:
1. In large mixer bowl soften yeast in warm water.
  2. Add 2 cups flour, shortening and salt.
  3. Beat at low speed of electric mixer for 1/2 minute, scraping bowl.
  4. Beat 3 minutes at high speed.
  5. Stir in as much remaining flour as you can mix in with a spoon.
  6. Turn onto lightly floured work surface.
  7. Knead in enough remaining flour to make a moderately soft dough that is smoooth and elastic.(5 minutes)
  8. Cover, let rest in a warm place about 15 minutes.
  9. Divide into 12 equal partions.
  10. Roll each between floured hands into a very smooth ball.
  11. Cover with a damp cloth, let rest 10 minutes.
  12. Using fingers, gently flatten balls.
  13. Cover, let rest 10 minutes.(keep dough pieces covered until ready to use.)
  14. On well floured surface lightly roll one piece of dough at a time into a circle 7 inches in diameter, turning dough over once.
  15. Do not stretch,puncture or crease dough(Work with enough flour so dough does not stick).
  16. Place on baking sheet. Bake rounds, 2 at a time, in a 450 F oven about 3 minutes or until dough is puffed and softly set.
  17. Turn over with a spatula, bake about 2 more mintes, or until dough is light brown.
  18. Repeat with remaining dough, baking one batch before rolling the next batch.
  19. To serve, slice bread crosswise, fill pocket with desired filling Makes 12 rounds.
title: Saudi Arabian Pita Bread

directions:
1. Finely dice cucumbers into small bowl.
  2. Mince or press garlic, add to cucumbers.
  3. Add yogurt and dried mint.
  4. Mix thoroughly.
  5. Allow to sit for at least 30 minutes or refrigerate overnight for flavors to blend.
  6. Serve with bread, meats, or rice
title: Cucumber and Yogurt Salad

directions:
1. Peel the cucumber and smash it together with garlic and Onion.
  2. Mix in yogurt. S
  3. salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Put in the fridge overnight.
title: Cool as a cucumber soup

directions:
1. Grate cucumber or mash avocados.
  2. Add other ingredients and blend well.
  3. Make this in a blender if you have one.
  4. Garnish with dill (if using cucumber) or lime (if using avocado).
title: Yogurt Soup

directions:
1. Sauté butter, onion and ginger.
  2. Stir in flour.
  3. Add squash and cook 5 minutes.
  4. Gradually add chicken stock and milk.
  5. Add salt to taste.
  6. Simmer for at least 5 more minutes.
title: Squash Soup

directions:
1. Smoke whole eggplants in covered barbecue, or bake at 350°F for 20 – 30 minutes, until tender.
  2. Add lemon half to water in shallow dish.
  3. Place eggplants in water, turn to coat thoroughly, and let stand until cool.
  4. Peel eggplants and remove seeds.
  5. Cut flesh into ¼" cubes.
  6. Melt butter in skillet.
  7. Add flour and cook and stir until light brown.
  8. Stir in milk.
  9. Add cheeses, eggplant, dash nutmeg and season to taste with salt.
  10. Cook over very low heat 5 minutes.
title: Hunkar Begendi I

directions:
1. Wash and soak the peas for about 5 hours.
  2. Boil the peas until they get medium soft.
  3. Add the lard or browned fat.
  4. When the peas are soft add the milk and salt.
  5. Heat and squeeze all the ingredients into an even mash.
  6. Serve with smoked meat, boiled pork legs or slightly salted, boiled pork ribs.
title: A Mash of Peas

directions:
1. Wash and brush the potatoes thoroughly.
  2. butter a pan and place the potatoes in the oven dish.
  3. Sprinkle the potatoes with salt, bake in the oven.
  4. During baking you may brush the potatoes with melted butter.
  5. Serve hot with butter, with salted herring, chive or spring onion dressing or with buttermilk.
title: Potatoes Baked in their Jackets

directions: 1. Mix all ingredients together and let marinate for at least one hour.
title: Cucumber Salad I

directions:
1. Melt butter and sauté all ingredients in a medium-sized pan for 5 minutes over medium heat.
  2. Add 2 cups of water.
  3. Stir, cover and cook over low flame until done (about 10 minutes).
  4. Makes 2-3 servings.
title: Rice-a-roni

directions:
1. Smash these together to make garlic butter, and then store it in your fridge for when you need it.
  2. When that time comes, slice part of a loaf of French bread at an oblique angle, to maximize surface area.
  3. Spread garlic butter on each slice.
  4. Heat up a skillet, then place bread slices, butter side down, on the skillet.
  5. When it looks right turn it over for just long enough to barely toast the other side.
title: Skillet Garlic Bread

directions:
1. Put veggies in Dutch-ovenable bowl with the veggies that take longest on the bottom (potatoes or corn).
  2. Layer veggies. Put oil, spices and cut up oil and garlic over the top.
  3. Flip veggies halfway through.
  4. After done cooking, the oil, onions, garlic and spices make a good dressing, especially mixed with a little flour.
title: Roasted Veggies

directions:
1. Combine ingredients in a medium sized bowl.
  2. Allow mixture to stand for one hour before using.
  3. Dip raw vegetables, chicken, fish or cut into bite-sized pieces and fry in two inches of hot oil until golden brown.
  4. Best if used cold.
title: Tempura Batter

directions:
1. Melt butter in skillet and sauté onions and cabbage.
  2. Add about ½ cup water and cover.
  3. Let steam for 10 minutes.
  4. Add remaining ingredients and season to taste.
  5. Simmer another 10 minutes.
  6. Serve hot.
title: Mustard Cabbage

directions:
1. Mix 1 lb. ground Beef with 1/2 lb. ground Bacon or Pork.
  2. Season to taste (salt, pepper, Cayenne, crushed garlic) and add 3 beaten eggs.
  3. After chilling for at least one hour, shape into egg-size balls.
  4. Roll them in flour, then in beaten egg, then in bread crumbs.
  5. Deep fry or pan fry until golden. Drain.
  6. Arrange in shallow oven dish and add tomato sauce.
  7. Heat thoroughly in medium oven.
  8. Serve very hot, with rice.
title: Seasoned Meat Balls

directions:
1. Rinse the filet with cool water. Rub with lime halves. Split the filet down the middle, going the entire length of the filet. Be careful to split it open and not cut it into two pieces.
  2. Lay the filet open on counter. Place the onions, minced garlic and 3 strips of Bacon along the entire length. Sprinkle with seasoned salt and pepper. Fold the filet back the way it was before splitting. Wrap the filet with the remaining strips of Bacon, using toothpicks if necessary to keep in place. Let the filet marinade like this for 2 to 4 hours in refrigerator.
  3. Remove the filet from pan and sauté in large skillet, just enough to give a little color. Remove from skillet and place in baking dish. Bake in moderate oven, 350 degrees, for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until tender. Remove toothpicks, slice diagonally in thin slices and serve hot.
title: Surprise Filet

directions:
1. Place the greens in the bottom of a large pot.
  2. Put the potatoes over the greens.
  3. Add 1-2 cups of broth sufficient to fill the pot to a depth of one inch.
  4. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and cover.
  5. Let cook for 30–40 minutes or until potatoes are steamed tender.
  6. Add water as necessary to prevent the pot from becoming completely dry.
  7. When the potatoes and greens are fully cooked, mash them together with a potato masher.
  8. Serve with scrambled eggs.
title: Morogo with Potatoes

directions:
1. Remove brown skin (before or after partial cooking).
  2. Put into cold salted water and boil until tender.
  3. Remove second skin, and puree the seeds.
  4. Return them to a pan of water over low heat.
  5. Add: 1 tablespoon butter, 1/2 c. cream or evaporated milk.
  6. Season to taste with salt, pepper and nutmeg.
title: Pureed Breadfruit Nuts

directions:
1. Cut chicken into little pieces, put it into the pan with water and start boiling.
  2. Meanwhile prepare the vegetables: peel the potatoes, onion and carrots.
  3. Then cut the potatoes, carrots and when the chicken is ready put them into the broth.
  4. At the same time chop onion and start frying it with butter on the frying pan till it becomes more yellow.
  5. Put it into the chicken bouillon too.
  6. After that take eggs, open them and mix well in the bowl.
  7. Now pour egg mixture slowly into the soup, stirring it at the same time.
  8. At the end you can add chopped parsley, salt and pepper.
title: Egg soup

directions:
1. Boil potatoes, eggs, carrots before preparing your salad.
  2. When the vegetables are ready you can start cooking.
  3. First of all slice ham, then chop boiled potatoes, carrots, eggs.
  4. Cut also cucumbers, apple and put everything in one bowl and mix it up thoroughly.
  5. After that add sour cream with mayonnaise, salt and pepper.
  6. Mix the salad again.
  7. Then chop fennel to put on the top.
title: Olivye

directions:
1. Fry nuts in the frying pan and then chop them into fine pieces.
  2. Mix with granulated sugar|sugar.
title: Pahlava

directions:
1. Boil the finely chopped spinach in salt water.
  2. Brown the butter and flour, then add the spinach purée.
  3. Dilute with milk and half the spinach water.
  4. Boil for another 5 – 10 minutes and season with pepper.
  5. Serve with bread cubes fried in butter.
title: Spinach Soup Bulgarian-style

directions:
1. Boil the whole Chicken and peppercorns in salt water, bone the meat.
  2. Fry the finely chopped carrots, celery and Onion in butter and some water until soft, stir in the flour, blend in the Chicken pieces after about 5min and boil for another 10min.
  3. Thicken with beaten egg and milk under constant stirring.
  4. Sprinkle with finely chopped parsley before serving.
title: Chicken soup with vegetables

directions:
1. Cook the chickpeas in a pot of water for about one hour.
  2. Add the lentils and cook for about 20 minutes. Drain and rinse the chickpeas and lentils under cool water. You can remove the skins if you want, but an Algerian usually won't give up that extra bit of fiber.
  3. Sauté the onions, garlic and tomato paste in olive oil for about 10–15 minutes. This will mellow the flavor of the tomato paste.
  4. Add the chickpeas, lentils, spices and about 1 tablespoons of salt or more to taste.
  5. Cover with water, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes.
  6. Some cooks like to gently mash the chick peaks. Serve with Kesra or Khobz.
title: Djouaz el Hummus, Algerian Chick Pea Soup

directions:
1. Mix the finely chopped onions, parsley and crumbled Cheese, and divide into 5 (earthware) bowls.
  2. Add equal parts of butter, salt and 1 spoonful water to each, and bake.
  3. When almost ready, break an egg on top of each and add some water if necessary.
  4. Cover with lids and bake until a crust is formed.
title: Baked Eggs with Spring Onions

directions:
1. Place the crumbled Cheese into a butter-lined saucepan.
  2. Top with the finely cut peppers, grated or sliced tomatoes and butter.
  3. Cover with a lid and stew for some 15min.
  4. Beat the eggs in a cupful of water, pour over the dish, cover and cook until a yellow crust is formed. #Serve with paprika.
title: Vegetarian dish, Bansko region

directions:
1. Pound the thin fillets, salt and baste with tomato paste and pepper.
  2. Stew the Mushrooms, diced Cheese, finely chopped parsley and garlic in butter and some water.
  3. Place some of the stuffing on each fillet, roll up, tie with a string and grill.
  4. Serve with French fries and lettuce.
title: Pork spindle fillet

directions:
1. Cut the Cheese into medium-thick slices and place on sheets of butter-lined foil.
  2. Place cubes of butter a top each Cheese piece, sprinkle with paprika and wrap.
  3. Place in a tray and bake in a moderate oven.
  4. Serve wrapped in the foil
title: Cheese baked in foil

directions:
1. Make a hole in the flour and place 1/2 tsp salt, the diluted yeast and 1/2 a cupful of water in it. Knead a medium soft dough (add some more water if necessary) and let stand for about on hour.
  2. Roll into sheets, ~3-4mm thick cut into squares and add crumbled Cheese to each.
  3. Fold in two, seal the edges and drop into salt boiling water.
  4. Boil for ~5min.
  5. Arrange the ears is a dish and pour over melted butter.
  6. Serve hot.
title: Ears

directions:
1. Season the Lamb with salt, pepper and cumin. Cut the onions and tomatoes into quarters. Alternate the Lamb with the vegetables on skewers; grill or broil for 5 minutes on each side. Serve with rice.
  2. Yield: 4 to 6 servings.
title: Shashlik with Vegetables

directions:
1. Bring the water to a boil.
  2. Add the elubo slowly, stirring as you add it.
  3. Keep adding it until it is thick (you may not need all of the elubo depending on how thick you want it).
  4. Once it is all added, continue to mix until it is smooth and consistent in texture.
title: Amala

directions:
1. Slice the yams into pieces that are about 1 inch (2.5 centimeters) in width.
  2. Peel the skins off the yams.
  3. Rinse the yams.
  4. Place the yams in a pot and add enough water to cover it.
  5. Add about 2 teaspoons of salt.
  6. Cook the yams for about 30 minutes, checking every 10 minutes or so to see if the yams are soft enough (a fork should be able to go through with ease).
  7. Drain the yams.
title: Isu (yam - boiled plain)

directions:
1. Pick and wash the rice.
  2. Place in a good size pot and cover with cold water.
  3. Place on heat and allow to boil for 5minutes, remove form heat and wash away excess starch with cold water.
  4. Barely cover rice with cold water, add some salt and a little butter.
  5. Cover pot and cook 20 minutes until cooked and all the moisture is absorbed.
  6. Fluff with a fork to senarate grains and serve hot.
title: Boiled Rice

directions:
1. oil one round small Casserole pan.
  2. Rolls the dough into 2 thin round flat pieces (1mm).
  3. Make one smaller than the other. Place larger dough in pan.
  4. (Some of the dough should overlap the pan by 2 cm all around).
  5. Place filling and pull excess dough over the top to enclose the filling.
  6. Place smaller dough on top to completely encase the filling.
  7. Cook on med. heat for 20 minutes, slowly adding small amounts of butter from the sides of the Klin. Carefully flip over the Klin and continue to cook for 20 minutes adding butter.
title: Rhodopean klin

directions:
1. Melt the butter in a large skillet, or use 2 smaller ones.
  2. Add the garlic and lemon or sumac.
  3. Slide in the eggs, previously broken into a bowl, and continue to fry gently.
  4. Rub some of the dried mint in the palm of your hand, letting it sprinkle over the eggs.
  5. When the whites are set, remove the pan from the heat, sprinkle lightly with salt, and serve.
title: Beid bi Tom

directions:
1. Place the crumbled Cheese into a butter-lined saucepan.
  2. Top with the finely cut peppers, grated or sliced tomatoes and butter.
  3. Cover with a lid and stew for some 15min.
  4. Beat the eggs in a cupful of water, pour over the dish, cover and cook until a yellow crust is formed. Serve with paprika.
title: Vegetarian dish from Bansko

directions:
1. Remove the crust from the bread. Soak the slices in honey for at least a half hour.
  2. Lightly grease a small deep baking dish.
  3. Using a spatula, pile the slices of bread evenly, one on top of another, in the baking dish.
  4. Bake in a 300 degrees oven for 45 minutes.
  5. Cool and chill in the refrigerator.
  6. Slice and top with heavy cream.
  7. Enjoy!
title: Palace Bread

directions:
1. Cut Cauliflower into large flowerettes, cook briefly in butter.
  2. In the same pan brown slightly a piece of cut up Veal.
  3. add one or two finely minced garlic cloves, a small can of tomato paste and water to desired consistency.
  4. Cook for about 15 minutes. Serve over rice.
title: Cauliflower Jordan

directions:
1. Wash,peal and grate bananas
  2. Add flour and salt to grated bananas and mix well.
  3. Beat mixture with fork while adding water until smooth.
  4. Sweeten to taste and add nutmeg and vanilla.
  5. Pour mixture into boiling water, stirring constantly to prevent lumping, stir until mixture thickens.
  6. Continue cooking, and milk, and let it simmer over low heat .
  7. Cook for about 30 mins.
  8. Add Granulated sugar|Sugar to taste and spices.
title: Banana Porridge

directions:
1. Mix cornmeal in 1/2pt. water.
  2. Bring remainder of water and milk to boil and stir in cornmeal and salt.
  3. Cook for about 10-12 mins.
  4. Sweeten to taste and add nutmeg and vanilla.
  5. Serve hot. Ideal for children.
title: Cornmeal Porridge

directions:
1. Peel plantain by making 2 incisions on opposite sides of the plantain skin and then peel.
  2. Slice the plantains into 2 in the middle (width not length - like breaking a banana in 2).
  3. Cut up both pieces of plantains into 1/4 inch slices longways.
  4. Heat skillet filled with just enough oil to cover the 1/4 inch slices.
  5. Fry plantain slices until golden brown on each side.
  6. Each slice needs about 45 seconds to a minute to cook.
  7. Be careful not to burn.
  8. Place cooked plantain in a dish layered with napkins so as to drain/soak up the oil.
  9. Sprinkle with cinnamon or nutmeg to taste.
title: Fried Ripe Plantains

directions:
1. Take 1 whole roast bread fruit and cut out the 'heart' (uneatable portion in the middle with seed).
  2. Cut breadfruit into pegs.
  3. Pour oil in skillet and heat.
  4. Fry pegs till golden brown each side.
  5. Serve with calloo or ackee.
title: Fried Breadfruit

directions:
1. Put whole breadfruit on grill.
  2. Cook on all sides till brownish black.
  3. Use skewer to check if cooked.
  4. Take breadfruit off grill and use a pot holder to hold and peel off skin.
  5. Cut in half.
  6. Cut out the 'heart'(uneatable portion in the middle with seed).
  7. Cut breadfruit into pegs.
  8. Serve with calloo or ackee.
title: Roast Breadfruit

directions:
1. Heat oil on med-high until just starts to smoke.
  2. Fry the plantains first until just brown on edges.
  3. Season fish with salt and pepper and dredge the fish in cornstarch|corn starch/meal before dipping in batter.
  4. Fry until deep golden brown.
  5. Serve with lime wedges, your favorite chile paste/sauce.
title: Honduran Fish and Chips

directions:
1. ut the banana in half. Don't peel yet.
  2. ut each 1/2 lengthwise. You now have quartered the plantain into four equal, narrow, relatively flat pieces.
  3. ow peel the plantain, more by pulling it off with your knife than peeling per se.
  4. eat 1/4" corn or soybean oil in a pan.
  5. ut the plantain in the oil when the oil has reached a medium-high temperature. If oil smokes, turn it down.
  6. urn the plantain when the natural sugars in the fruit begin to carmelize (just starting to turn brown) - about 6 minutes
  7. ry the other side - about 5 minutes
  8. lace fried plantains on paper towels to remove extra oil
title: Honduran Fried Plantains

directions:
1. Peel, wash and grate cassava.
  2. Squeeze out as much of the juice as possible, using either a matapee or by wringing in a towel.
  3. Leave in lumps and allow to dry slightly in open air.
  4. Pound, sift, and add salt.
  5. Heat a griddle and a metal hoop of the size of cake required.
  6. Put cassava meal to a depth of about ⅛ - ¼ inch in the hoop.
  7. Cook until set, using moderate heat.
  8. Remove the hoop, level the surface and press firmly.
  9. Turn onto the other side and cook.
title: Cassava Bread

directions:
1. Bring 2½ cups water to a rolling boil.
  2. Add 1½ cups corn flour slowly while stirring it vigorously with a wire whisk until all the lumps are out and it starts to become thick.
  3. Pour the pâte into a greased bowl and let cool before sticking your fingers in it.
title: Pâte Blanche

directions:
1. Put roasted unsalted peanuts in the blender until you get Peanut butter.
  2. Let sit at room temperature for a day or until the solids settle to the bottom and the oil rises to the top.
  3. Drain off the oil to use for frying or cooking. Take the Peanut solids and roll into stick shapes and fry in oil.
title: Klui-Klui

directions:
1. Mix eggs and milk.
  2. Dip meat into mix.
  3. Let sit for 1 minute and dip into flour.
  4. Brown both sides in hot oil.
  5. Cover and cook over low heat for at least 1 hour until well done.
title: Chicken Fried Steak Guinea

directions:
1. Wash and clean Chicken. Put the Chicken and the Onion in pot. Cover with water and bring to boil. Reduce heat.
  2. Simmer for 2–3 hours until tender. Reserve soup. Remove bones from Chicken. Cut into pieces and sprinkle with salt.
  3. Wash rice. Add 10 cups of soup from above. Cook over low heat for 1 hour, or until tender.
  4. Add Chicken meat to pot. Then add salt, pepper and cinnamon as desired.
title: Chicken Mohallabiyya

directions:
1. Wash the dried Lentils and soak them for two hours. Drain.
  2. Bring the water, salt, and oil to a boil in a saucepan.
  3. Add the rice and the soaked Lentils.
  4. Cover the saucepan tightly and reduce heat to low.
  5. Come back in twenty minutes, not before.
title: Rice with lentils

directions:
1. Put Peanut paste, water, salt, and Cayenne in saucepan.
  2. Simmer for 10 minutes.
  3. Sauté Onion in oil until yellow; add to sauce.
  4. Stir and simmer for another 10 minutes.
  5. Serve hot.
title: Peanut sauce 2

directions:
1. Grind lamb and onion in a mincer, salt and pepper.
  2. Fry mince meat in butter, stirring constantly, then put on a working surface and beat with a knife, add chopped greens and stir carefully.
  3. Fill with minced meat peeled and blanched eggplants.
  4. Put then in a deep pan, cover with tomatoes.
  5. Pour over broth or some water and stew for 25–30 minutes.
title: Badymzhan Dolmasy

directions:
1. Slice lamb into pieces 25-30 g each, season to taste and sear.
  2. Chop onion finely and sauté until pale, add it to meat.
  3. Then add lemon acid, a little broth to meat and stew covered until done.
  4. Make stiff dough from flour, egg, salt and water and rollout a sheet 1 mm thick.
  5. Cut our rhombuses and put in boiling water, cook until they float to the surface.
  6. Put in a colander and let water drain.
  7. Dress with butter and sprinkle with cheese.
  8. Serving, garnish lamb slices with rhombuses.
  9. Serve matsoni (caucasian sour milk) with garlic and cinnamon.
title: Kaurma Hingal

directions:
1. Grind lamb and onion in a mincer, add salt, pepper and stir through.
  2. Shape small balls and fry on average heat in butter until done.
title: Rissoles in Eastern Style

directions:
1. Drop a rennet bag into the to cause turning.
  2. Then rennet bag is taken out and the turned milk is boiled on slow fire until curds and whey are completely separated.
  3. The ready product has an orange colour.
  4. It is strained, dried up in a small bag in the wind, then in the sun.
title: Irimshik

directions:
1. Mutton is cut in pieces 40-50 g each, washed, put in a pan, covered with cold water and put on fire. After water begins to boil scum is removed and the meat is boiled for 1-1,5 hours on slow fire. While meat is boiling dough is made. eggs are put in screened flour, salted water is poured in and all this is thoroughly mixed. The dough is left for 30–40 minutes, then thinly rolled, slightly dried up and cut in thin strips. 20 minutes before readiness the thinly cut noodles, slightly lied Onion and carrot are put in the broth and boiled to readiness.
  2. Before serving the table the noodle soup is poured out in soup-plates or kese, at wish seasoned with katyk and strewed with greens.
title: Kespe with Meat

directions:
1. Slice boiled meat, potatoes, carrots and cucumbers; sprinkle with salt and pepper; mix it all together and add 40 g sour cream. Serve on a plate, decorating with Peas, slices of meat and greens or pickled vegetables.
  2. Serves four.
title: Kazakhstan Salad

directions:
1. It is made of whey which remains after making curds. Whey is boiled away in a cauldron on slow fire untill a thick viscous mass in obtained. It is cooled, flat cakes of various shape are made and dried.
  2. Sarysu can also be consumed fresh, without drying. To taste is resembles chocolate therefore it is sometimes called in the people"Kasakh chocolate".
title: Sarysu

directions:
1. This dish is made just before serving the table. In millet butter is put which has no time to soak the cereals|grain; therefore it crunches.
  2. millet can be poured on with hot water and alowed to swell; only then butter is put in it. In ais case the dish's taste does somewhat change. If millet waked in hot broth from kazy ans left for 20–25 minutes the dish is called kazy maisok.
title: Kurgak Maisok

directions:
1. The cleaned fish is cut in pieces, salted and peppered, dipped in melted butter and rolled in dried and finely ground breadcrumbs.
  2. It is fried in heated oil being continuously turned over.
  3. The ready fish is laid out in a flat plate, next to it fried potatoes and lemon sections are put; all this is strewed with cut dill.
  4. According to this recipe other kinds of fish can be fried.
title: Fried Sazan

directions:
1. Dough is made like for Taba-Nan.
  2. The ready dough is rolled in a layer about 1 cm thick and spread out on the inner surface of a cauldron which is beforehand well heated and oiled.
  3. The dough must closely adjoin the cauldron's walls or it can fall of during baking.
  4. Then dough is pierced along the whole surface, the cauldron is turned over the charcoals and the bread begins to be baked.
  5. 25 minutes later kazanzhappai is ready; it is taken off the cauldron's walls, cut in pieces of various shape, buttered or smeared with sour cream to taste.
  6. Kazanzhappai can also be baked in the oven at 200°C.
  7. In this case a cast iron frying-pan is put on the cauldron.
title: Kazanzhappai

directions:
1. Washed millet is put in boiling salted milk and boiled during 1 – 2 minutes; then the fire is lessened and boiling continued for 15 – 20 minutes.
  2. Before the end of boiling salt and granulated sugar|sugar are added; before serving the table butter is put in the soup.
title: Sut Kozhe

directions:
1. Boil plantains. when soft, pound them in a large mortar.
  2. Dip pestle in cold water in between pounding to prevent sticking. when smooth, mix with butter, salt and pepper. keep warm.
  3. I like this with almost any meat as a substitute for rice or potatoes.
title: Foo Foo

directions:
1. Brown the Chicken in a little butter in a heavy frying pan.
  2. Add peeled, washed and chopped vegetables to frying pan.
  3. Cover with coconut cream.
  4. Add a little salt, chopped onions and any seasoning to taste.
  5. Cover and cook slowly until vegetables are tender, about half an hour.
title: Chicken and Vegetables

directions:
1. Prepare the paste: Divide it into two pieces and then each piece divide into 10 equal pieces.
  2. Make a "kora" of each piece.
  3. "Kora" is a thin peace of paste made by rolling tin.
  4. Spread some oil on each "kora" and put one "kora" on another until you use 10 for one big "kora" and the other ten for another big kora.
  5. One "kora" should be bigger than another. Take the smaller one and put it at the bottom of a saucepan. Spread the filling.
  6. Put the other "kora" (the bigger one) on the filling and place it nicely.
  7. Pour some oil on top.
  8. Put the saucepan in the oven.
  9. Bake it on temperature of 250 °C for half an hour.
  10. Filling: chop the vegetable and fry it on oil for a while.
title: Zelnik

directions:
1. Chop meat and fresh vegetable and put it in pottery saucepan. Add spices, stir and then add cooking oil and water. Don’t put too much water, just enough so that turlitava is soft after cooking.
  2. Put the saucepan in oven and cook it at 200°C for an hour and a half. During that time, stir two-three times. When the meal is ready, it has golden-red crust.
title: Turlitava

directions:
1. Soak the yeast in one cup of luke warm water, one spoon flour and little bit sugar and leave it for 15 minutes to rise. When the yeast is ready, add it into flour and prepare the dough adding a luke warm water as needed.
  2. Divide the dough into 4 equal pieces.
  3. Use rolling tin to make each of these pieces thin and flat. (preferable round)
  4. Chop the meat in small pieces.
  5. Put the meat on top of each piece of dough and spread it equally.
  6. Put the pepper on the meat also.
  7. Put the pastrmajlii pieces (prepared like pizza) in the oven.
  8. Bake it on temperature of 250°C.
  9. Serve it hot.
title: Pastrmajlija

directions:
1. Wash the tomato and carefully with the knife take off the top of each tomato.
  2. Take off the core, also. Leave the tomato to dry.
  3. Mince the veal in the meantime. Fry chopped onion and add minced meat, salt and pepper.
  4. When the meat is fried, add chopped parsley, beaten eggs and some cooked rice.
  5. Fill the tomato with this mixture and put it in a saucepan. Bake for about 25 minutes.
  6. Serve on top of cooked rise in a plate with tomato juice or ketchup.
title: Tomatoes filled with Meat

directions:
1. Toast the pepper, peel it and chop it.
  2. Toast the tomato, then peel it and knead it. Add the kneaded tomato to the pepper and mix them.
  3. Add toasted egg plant also after you have peeled it and chopped it.
  4. Add ground garlic and salt.
  5. Pour the pindzur with the heated oil, stir and put the pindzur in a bowl where you usually put salad.
title: Pindzhur

directions:
1. Place chicken in pot; cover with water (at least 6 cups).
  2. Bring to boil removing scum from top; add salt and cook until tender. About 1 hour.
  3. Meanwhile, melt butter in frying pan and saute finely chopped Onion and celery until light gold colour, stirring to prevent burning.
  4. When chicken is completely cooked, measure 5 cups of broth into frying pan and bring to boil.
  5. Add rice and 1 tsp. salt, cover and cook slowly until water is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
  6. Place in a warm serving dish. While rice is boiling, remove Chicken pieces from pot and drain well. Brown Chicken in melted butter and 1 tsp. paprika.
  7. Place Chicken pieces over rice.
  8. Sprinkle dish with chopped parsley, salt and black pepper.
title: Chicken and Rice with Paprika

directions:
1. Sauté the plantain slices in very hot frying oil.
  2. Use enough oil to cover the slices.
  3. Remove the plantain slices when they are golden and soak off the excess oil.
  4. Sauté your choice of ham and sausages lightly, remove and add to the plantains.
  5. Add the sweet peas and the beaten eggs.
  6. Use an omelet frying pan if possible.
  7. Add ⅓ cup frying oil.
  8. Place the ingredients in the pan and cook over medium heat for several minutes.
  9. The sweet smell of the frying plantains will be replaced by a typical omelet smell when the mixture is ready to be turned over.
  10. Do so carefully.
  11. Let cook for another two to three minutes.
  12. Serve immediately.
title: Tortilla de Plátanos

directions:
1. Fry in a deep pan over medium to medium-high heat until the pieces begin to turn crisp. It's best to fry a few pieces at a time.
  2. Remove the pieces. Set over a firm surface and press down on each piece with a hard instrument such as a roller until it becomes flattened thin and elongated. (Unless, of course, you avail yourself of a Tostonera - a gadget that will press the plantain piece into the shape of a Toston)
  3. Return to the frying pan and continue to fry until they look quite crisp. Remove excess frying oil by setting over paper towels.
  4. Use as a side dish to substitute for French fries. Warning: your diners may not want to go back to French fries in the future!Use as a side dish to substitute for French fries.
title: Tostones de Plátano

directions:
1. In a large stew pot combine everything except the Chicken. Stir until all is well mixed. Bring to a slow boil then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about twenty minutes, stirring occasionally.
  2. Add Chicken, cover, and simmer for another half hour or more, stirring occasionally, until Chicken is thoroughly cooked.
  3. Serve with Baton de cassava|manioc / Chikwangue, or Fufu, or rice.
title: Chicken in Cumin Sauce

directions:
1. Heat a couple spoonfuls of oil in a deep pot. Add the Chicken and fry it on both sides until it is browned and nearly done. Remove the Chicken and set aside. (It might be best to fry part of the Chicken and remove it, and then repeat the process two or three times.
  2. Chicken cooks best if the Chicken pieces do not touch each other while frying.)
  3. Fry the onions and garlic in the same pot. Stir in tomato paste. Reduce heat and simmer for a few minutes. Return Chicken to pot.
  4. Stir in Peanut butter (if using peanuts, first shell and roast them, then grind or mash them into a paste, adding water if needed). Be sure to use a very low heat or Peanut butter will scorch. Stir in enough water to make tomato paste and Peanut butter into a smooth sauce. Add spices to taste. Stir. Simmer on low heat until Chicken is done.
title: Chicken in Peanut-Tomato Sauce

directions:
1. Fry the Chicken and any optional ingredients in hot oil in a large skillet or dutch oven until the Chicken is browned but not done.
  2. Reduce heat and add the spices. Add two cups of the moambé / nyembwe sauce or canned palm soup base and one cup water. Simmer over low heat until everything is cooked and tender (maybe an hour), stirring often. Stir before serving. The red palm oil tends to separate from the sauce; some people remove some or most of this red oil before serving.
title: Poulet Moambé / Poulet Nyembwe

directions:
1. Wash and drain sauerkraut thoroughly; melt butter in frying pan and add sauerkraut.
  2. Fry for 10 minutes; add paprika and Cheese, stir well with a fork.
  3. Allow to cool and add eggs. Mix well.
title: SAUERKRAUT

directions:
1. Wash and peel cucumbers.
  2. Chop thinly.
  3. Put into a mixing bowl.
  4. Put yogurt, mint leaves and garlic in the mixing bowl.
  5. Sprinkle salt to taste
  6. Mix well.
  7. Serve cold.
title: Tarator I

directions:
1. Mix meat, kneed thoroughly and leave in a cool place to sit for several hours.
  2. Chop onion finely, heat oil, add onion and cook slowly until it is soft and beginning to color.
  3. Peel garlic and chop finely.
  4. Add onion and garlic to meat, season with salt and pepper.
  5. Work all into a meat mixture, leave for a short while in a cool place, then shape into smaller kjebapchinja.
  6. Grill at first on very hot grill.
  7. Brush with oil while grilling.
  8. Serve with spring onions, tomatoes, small hot peppers.
title: Kjebapchinja

directions:
1. Marinate diced meat (1 in. x 1 in.) in garlic and oil mixture for 1/2 hour.
  2. Remove and put meat on skewers.
  3. Sprinkle on salt and pepper.
  4. Place over charcoal or in broiler.
title: Shishlik

directions:
1. Mix meat with cumin, salt, pepper, and water.
  2. Knead well for 5 minutes.
  3. Add chopped Onion and chopped parsley.
  4. Form a big ball and keep in refrigerator for 12 hours.
  5. Before cooking, wet your fingers and form 3 in. x 1 in. stick-like hamburgers.
  6. Grill for 5–8 minutes.
  7. Turn from side to side until brown.
  8. Serve with fresh vegetable salad.
title: Kebob (small hamburgers)

directions:
1. Cut into uniform ¼ to ½ inch dices. Place in a heavy skillet over moderate heat. Stir occasionally with a long handled fork.
  2. When fat is all rendered and spirguciai are uniformly crisp and light brown, pour off melted fat through a strainer.
  3. Spirguciai may also be fried in a moderate oven. Stir occasionally and watch carefully, when nearly done to avoid scorching.
title: Spirguciai

directions:
1. Wash cucumbers, cut off both ends.
  2. Mash garlic and place on the bottom of a glass jar or crock.
  3. Fill jar with the cucumbers.
  4. Bring water and salt to a boil and then allow to cool to room temperature.
  5. Pour over pickles in the jar or crock and place a dish on top with a weight to hold the pickles down.
title: Rogieties

directions:
1. Slice/shred cabbage.
  2. Mix/toss all the other ingredients in by hand.
title: Lithuanian Sauerkraut

directions:
1. Boil potatoes, then peel and mash.
  2. Add farina, flour, salt and egg.
  3. Work dough well.
  4. Divide into 5 dumplings.
  5. Place into boiling water, cook for 20 minutes.
title: Bramborove Knedliky

directions:
1. Add just enough oil to lightly cover the bottom of a shallow frying pan. Keep the oil handy to add more as needed.
  2. Warm the oil over medium-high heat. Add the ground garlic and stir-fry for around a minute.
  3. Add the filets. Place the slices of Onion and peppers on top of the filets. Let the filets cook no more than four minutes. Lower the heat to medium. Cover the frying pan and allow to cook another two or three minutes.
  4. Remove the cover carefully. There may be condensed water or steam in the underside of the cover. Brush the onions and peppers off the filets and into the sides of the frying pan. Carefully turn the filets over. Place the Onion and pepper slices on top of the filets again. If necessary, add some more oil, again just barely enough to coat the bottom of the frying pan.
  5. If your filets are very thick, they may need another four minutes, covered. For thinner filets, let them cook uncovered until any liquid evaporates. Remove the filets and serve them covered with the onions and peppers, garnished with a slice of lime or lemon.
  6. A nice gravy for the filets is obtained by slowly mixing one teaspoonful of cornstarch and a pinch of salt into one-third cup of warm milk or cream, and then gradually adding the mixture to the frying pan which still contains the remnants of the cooking oil and garlic, stirring continuously to avoid lumping. If necessary, add oil, butter or margarine. As the mixture approaches its boiling point or becomes bubbly, it gradually turns golden. Cook until it meets your standards for consistency and color.
  7. Serve with stewed vegetables.
  8. A nice salad to accompany this dish, if the ingredients are available in your area, would consist of slices of ripe avocado, with oranges and grapefruit in chunks, on a bed of fresh lettuce, bathed in lime juice.
title: Chillo al Ajillo

directions:
1. Slice lamb (a slice is about 30 g) and stew in lamb fat for 15 minutes.
  2. Add finely chopped onion and go on stewing until lamb is soft.
  3. Pour over broth with spices (tarragon, saffron, mint, dill, coriander, extract of ginger, pepper, salt).
title: Buglama

directions:
1. Brown bacon; brown onions in butter.
  2. Add to grated potatoes.
  3. Stir in salt, pepper and milk.
  4. Add beaten eggs in last, stir well.
  5. Set oven at 350°F.
  6. Grease one large pan (10 x 13 inches) or two small (8 x 8 inches) pans.
  7. Bake for 1¼ to 1½ hour.
  8. Cannot be frozen; reheat in microwave or refry.
title: Kugeli I

directions:
1. Peel potatoes.
  2. Grate potatoes and onion fine.
  3. Dice bacon and fry until crisp.
  4. Pour fat and bacon over potatoes.
  5. Add hot milk then add eggs, one at a time and beat after each addition.
  6. Add pepper and salt and flour; mix well.
  7. Pour into greased heavy skillet or pan.
  8. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes.
  9. Reduce heat to 375°F and bake 45 minutes longer.
  10. Cut into squares.
  11. Serve hot with sour cream.
  12. Bake until it is golden brown and crisp.
title: Kugelis II

directions:
1. Slice cheese finely and sink them in hot milk.
  2. Cook on low heat, not bringing to boil, until it is viscid.
  3. Blend cheese mass with chopped mint and shape into a flat cake.
  4. Gadazelili is served with milk in which cheese was cooked.
title: Gadazelili

directions:
1. Peel and grate raw potatoes, mince Onion and mix the 2 together.
  2. Fry Bacon until crisp; pour bacon grease|bacon fat over potatoes and crumble Bacon into mixture.
  3. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well; add salt and milk.
  4. Pour mixture in a greased 13 x 9 inch pan.
  5. Bake at 400 °F, 15 minutes.
  6. Top should be brown and crispy.
  7. Serve with sour cream. Serves 12.
  8. May sprinkle with Baco Bits.
title: Kugla

directions:
1. Crumble saltines into fine crumbs.
  2. Melt butter in saucepan.
  3. Add onions to soften and turn clear.
  4. Heat 2 cups milk (skim off fat) or use low-fat milk.
  5. In a large bowl combine crumbs, milk and butter/butter mixture.
  6. Mix well. Beat in eggs.
  7. In a large flat Corningware dish. Pour batter.
  8. Bake covered in 350°F oven for 45 minutes. Then uncovered for 5 minutes.
title: Lithuanian Cracker Stuffing

directions:
1. Brown, fry salt pork until crunchy.
  2. Drain.
  3. Grate potatoes and add to salt pork.
  4. Mix in farina and eggs.
  5. Pour into lightly greased pan.
  6. Bake at 400°F for 1 hour or until nicely browned and crusty.
title: Lithuanian Kugel II

directions:
1. Fill in the chicken with cooked rice with corn, salt and lightly fried chopped onion.
  2. Sew up and bake in the oven pouring butter over regularly.
title: Stuffed Chicken

directions:
1. Peel and grate potatoes.
  2. Mix in other ingredients.
  3. Melt fat or heat 1 tablespoon cooking oil in frying pan.
  4. Drop spoonfuls of mixture onto hot skillet.
  5. Brown each side to a golden brown.
  6. Serve with sour cream or applesauce.
title: Bulviniai Blynai I

directions:
1. Grate potato and onion in a bowl.
  2. Cut bacon crosswise into narrow strips.
  3. Fry to crisp.
  4. Pour fat and bacon over potatoes.
  5. Add hot milk and beaten eggs a little at a time.
  6. Add salt and pepper.
  7. Pour into a greased 12x18 inch pan.
  8. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes, then 375°F for 45 minutes or until top browns
title: Lithuanian Potato Pudding

directions:
1. Cut peeled potatoes into 4 to 6 parts, grate carrots coarsely and cook together in a small amount of water.
  2. Cut cabbage into squares.
  3. According to taste, flour and egg may be made into a dough which is then chopped into small pieces and added to the soup when the vegetables are cooked.
  4. Bring to a boil again so that the dumplings will cook.
  5. Add the butter and milk, being careful not to let soup boil.
title: Lithuanian Potato Soup I

directions:
1. For a smooth style salad or spread: toss everything in a food processor; pulse until mixed well; season with salt, pepper, and mayonnaise|mayo (optional) to taste.
  2. For a chunkier style salad: grate beets on the medium side of a grater; grind or finely chop walnuts (or, buy them pre-ground); mince prunes (or grind them with walnuts in a food processor or by hand); mix everything together and season to taste.
title: Beet Salad Georgian-style

directions:
1. Chop tomatoes coarsely and the onions very finely.
  2. Wash and chop the cilantro very finely (including stems).
  3. Cover vegetable mixture with lemon juice and vinegar.
  4. Let stand 30 minutes before serving.
title: Salsa Costa Rica

directions:
1. Traditionally, the potatoes are peeled and grated and the onion chopped fine.
  2. Then, the egg/salt/pepper are mixed in.
  3. Once you have the batter prepared, heat your griddle or frying pan.
  4. Add a generous amount of cooking oil.
  5. Drop by spoons-full or pour pancake mixture on the hot griddle.
  6. Fry until golden on both sides.
  7. Place cooked blynai on paper towels or newspaper briefly to absorb the excess grease.
  8. Serve with a dollop of sour cream and/or applesauce.
title: Bulviu Blynai

directions:
1. Boil or fry a chicken.
  2. Cut it into pieces.
  3. Grind the walnuts.
  4. Take the garlic and pound it together with the salt.
  5. Sprinkle the ground walnut with saffron.
  6. Add the garlic and squeeze the mass so that the excess oil comes out.
  7. Then dilute the mixture with chilled broth.
  8. The sauce should have a thick consistence.
  9. Finally put the chicken pieces with the sauce and serve.
title: Bazhe

directions:
1. Put a layer of finely cut pieces of meat at the bottom of the pot.
  2. Then place a layer of eggplant, stuffed with slightly salted fat tail, garlic and finely chopped onions, parsley and basilic.
  3. Put on top 2 or 3 pieces of peeled tomatoes and 2 potatoes cut in half lengthwise.
  4. Sprinkle that with salt and put into the oven.
  5. Bake first with the pot cover closed and then remove the cover.
  6. Chanakhi will be ready in about 1 ½ hours.
title: Chanakhi

directions:
1. Put the meat through the mincer, add the boiled rice, shopped onion and dill.
  2. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Wash the grapes|grape leaves, cut off hard stems and spread the leaves on the table in pairs.
  4. Put a bit of stuffing on the wide end of the leaves, fold the edges inward and roll into a sausage shape.
  5. Sprinkle with salt and place the tolmas in rows in a shallow casserole.
  6. Pour over butter and the bone stock.
  7. Cover tightly and simmer over low heat for about an hour.
  8. Serve the tolma on a platter.
  9. Sour cream mixed with grated garlic and salt, or cinnamon mixed with powdered sugar.
title: Tolma

directions:
1. Peal the eggplant|aubergine (eggplant) and slice it into 5mm thick discs.
  2. Leave them in salty water for 15 minutes, squeeze the liquid out and dip them in flour.
  3. Fry them in oil until golden brown and soft.
  4. Garnish with chopped parsley leaves and finely chopped garlic.
title: Fried Aubergine

directions:
1. Choose a medium-sized chicken.
  2. Dredge with salt and pepper and skewer diagonally from leg to wing.
  3. Broil over hot charcoals for 20 to 30 minutes, turning and basting regularly with butter until evenly browned.
  4. Remove the chicken from the skewer and serve garnished with lettuce, fresh-salted cucumbers and tomatoes.
title: Broiled Chicken with Tkemali Sauce

directions:
1. Wash and stew the plums until soft.
  2. Remove the seeds and rub through a strainer.
  3. Add plum Liquor until the paste is as thick as sour cream.
  4. Mix in the seasoning, bring to a boil and then cool.
  5. This sauce may also be served with shashlyk and other grilled meats.
title: Tkemali Sauce

directions:
1. Prepare the plov as Turkmenistanian plov (see the recipe in plov).
  2. Mix the honey with an equal amount of hot water and add the raisins.
  3. Pour this sauce over the plov and cook for 10 minutes.
title: Georgian Plov

directions:
1. Julienne the washed cabbage and grate the carrot.
  2. Rub it with salt until soft.
  3. Squeeze excess liquid.
  4. Add julienne apple.
  5. Mix with oil, vinegar and salt (if needed).
  6. Serve with roasts.
title: Cabbage Salad I

directions:
1. Peel the celery roots, wash and cut into ½ inch slices.
  2. Dredge each slice with flour and lightly fry on both sides.
  3. Fry the finely chopped onion in the remaining oil, until yellow.
  4. Add 1 teaspoon flour and let fry some more.
  5. Then add milk and let come to a boil.
  6. Place the fried celery in this sauce, salt and simmer, covered, shaking the pan from time to time.
  7. At the end add the chopped parsley.
  8. In this dish the milk can be replaced with water and added 1-2 tablespoons of tomato sauce.
title: Celery Root or Kohlrabi Casserole

directions:
1. Peel the zucchini, cut into thin slices.
  2. Dry each slice with a cloth, dredge with flour and fry in oil.
  3. When all are fried, arrange on a plate and drizzle lemon juice or a little vinegar mixed with minced garlic and salt over them.
  4. Serve hot or cold.
title: Fried Zucchini

directions:
1. Peel and thinly slice the cucumbers and apples.
  2. Wash, clean and grate the carrots.
  3. Wash and tear the lettuce into small pieces.
  4. Mix all these with salt, lemon juice and oil.
  5. Place in the salad bowl and decorate with walnut and tomato slices.
title: Lettuce Salad I

directions:
1. After cutting off inedible tips of vegetables, wash and slice them into 1-inch squares.
  2. Saute vegetables in half the oil and remove them from the frying pan.
  3. Sauté onion and tomatoes in the remaining oil, and season with parsley, salt, and pepper.
  4. Put everything in a stock pot with a cup of water, cover tightly, and simmer until almost all moisture has cooked away.
title: Mixed Vegetables

directions:
1. Put the flour on the table and add the other ingredients.
  2. Knead well and give round form to the cakes with a small hole in the center, like "mexican tortillas"
title: Tortas Fritas (Uruguay)

directions:
1. Chop ginger finely, and then beat to a powder.
  2. Add pineapples.
  3. Pour boiling water over and allow to cool to lukewarm.
  4. Add yeast which has been dissolved in ½ cup of lukewarm water.
  5. Allow to stand overnight covered.
  6. Add molasses on the following day.
  7. Chill and strain.
  8. Bottle tightly and refrigerate.
title: Liberian Ginger Beer

directions:
1. Cut four plantains in half lengthwise and then crosswise into six uniform pieces.
  2. Saute them quickly in a quarter of an inch of hot oil in a saute pan.
  3. Use green bananas if plantains are not available.
title: Liberian Fried Plantains I

directions:
1. In a 1-quart saucepan: place the mangos.
  2. Add syrup from a can of peaches and cloves.
  3. Simmer for 15 minutes or until mangos are tender.
  4. Spear some of the pieces with a few cloves.
  5. Cool and serve in compote dishes.
title: Stewed Mangos with Cloves

directions:
1. Peel very green plantains and slice very thin.
  2. Fry in deep oil until golden brown and crisp then drain on paper towel.
  3. Sprinkle with salt.
  4. Keep in sealed containers.
title: Plantain Chips I

directions:
1. Peel and slice eggplant in chunks.
  2. Saute eggplant in a oil until light brown.
  3. Add onions, tomato balls, meat, and stir.
  4. Add water, salt and pepper and bring to a boil, then add tomato paste.
  5. Cover the pan and turn the heat to low, simmering for 20 to 30 minutes and stir often until the eggplant is tender and the flavors have blended.
  6. Can be served with rice, or your favourite side dish.
title: Eggplant Stew

directions:
