1. Peel the potato and cut into pieces (approximately 2 cm x 2 cm x .5 cm or smaller in size).
  2. In a skillet, fry the potatoes in the oil until tender, stirring occasionally and covering with the lid in between stirrings.
  3. Uncover and add the onions.
  4. Stir and fry until the onions and potatoes are slightly browned.
  5. Drain away excess oil.
  6. You will need only about 1 tablespoon in which to cook the eggs.
  7. Spread the potatoes and onions evenly on the bottom of the skillet.
  8. Pour the eggs over the potatoes and onions.
  9. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper, to taste.
  10. As the bottom of the eggs get firm, slightly lift the eggs with a spatula.
  11. Tilt the skillet and allow the uncooked egg from the top to run to the bottom of the skillet.
  12. When all of the egg is relatively firm and the bottom is lightly browned, flip the whole omelet to brown the other side.
  13. Once both sides are lightly browned, remove from heat and serve.
title: Potato and Onion Omelet

directions:
1. Boil unpeeled Eggplant until soft.
  2. Cut in half and scoop out pulp. Mash pulp well. Cool. Stir in salt, pepper,and eggs.
  3. When cold, add milk and flour (adding more flour if necessary to make a thick batter). Drop by spoonfuls into hot deep fat. Drain.
  4. Serve hot.
title: Liberian Eggplant Fritters

directions:
1. Cut plantains into about ½ inch slices.
  2. Fry for several minutes in hot oil, until slices begin to turn golden (not too dark), and they are beginning to get tender. They do not need to be really soft at this point.
  3. Take slices out of oil and drain on a paper towel.
  4. Move to a sturdy surface like a cutting board, and smash the slices down with the bottom of a cup (like a juice glass or some such). The point is to make them smash down to about ½ their original height, not to get them really thin.
  5. Throw back into hot oil and fry again, until they get more tender, maybe 1 – 2 minutes on each side.
  6. Take out of oil, drain, sprinkle with salt and server in place of potatoes.
title: Liberian Fried Plantains

directions:
1. Chop 1 pound of Mushrooms into halves or quarters.
  2. Heat 2/3 cup heavy cream. Heat 2T butter in a deep frying pan.
  3. Add 3-4 chopped garlic cloves to the butter.
  4. Add Mushrooms and cook for about 2 minutes, until brown.
  5. Add hot cream, salt, 1 tsp pepper, 2 tsp nutmeg.
  6. Cook for about 5 more minutes, then add 1/2 cup chopped cilantro.
  7. Serve on hot buttered rice or French bread
title: Mushrooms in Cream

directions:
1. Melt butter in saucepan and saute carrots, celery and Onion until tender.
  2. Add cream and heat almost to a boil. (Do not boil.) Add potatoes and stir until blended.
  3. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chopped parsley
title: Mashed Potato Soup

directions:
1. Sauté onions and soup vegetables in margarine.
  2. Boil potatoes and sauteed vegetables in stock until tender.
  3. Pass the soup through a sieve.
  4. Reheat and season with salt and pepper and basil.
  5. Cut bread roll into cubes and fry in the butter until browned.
  6. Serve the soup sprinkled with croutons and 2 tbsp finely chopped chives.
title: Potato Soup I

directions:
1. Blend all the ingredients in a mixie.
  2. Add a little yogurt if the dip is too thick.
  3. Chill in the refrigerator.
  4. Serve with deep fried pieces of pitta bread.
  5. (Take the regular arabic flat bread and cut it in a bit size pieces. Deep fry it and drain on kitchen napkin.)
title: Tangy Dip

directions:
1. Dice the fish into ¼ inch pieces and just cover with water.
  2. Use a stainless steel, plastic or glass container.
  3. Add salt, mix and let stand for at least an hour (this is a good time to squeeze your limes).
  4. Remove the fish from the water and squeeze the moisture from it.
  5. Mix in the onions and peppers.
  6. Put the mixture in a large glass jar or a refrigerator container and pour the lime juice in to cover.
  7. Refrigerate, covered (no metal lids), for at least six hours.
  8. Serve, chilled, in a cocktail dish with saltines or in small pastry cups as a canape.
title: Gatun American Legion

directions:
1. Drain oysters.
  2. Lay an oyster across ½ slice of bacon.
  3. Sprinkle each oyster with seasonings and parsley.
  4. Roll entire strip of bacon around oyster and fasten with toothpicks.
  5. Place oyster on a rack in a shallow baking dish.
  6. Bake in 450°F oven for 10 minutes or until bacon is crisp.
  7. Remove toothpicks and serve.
title: Panama Angels on Horseback

directions: 1. Simmer gently for 1 hour or until meat is tender
title: Tanzanian Chicken Soup

directions:
1. Score the meat deeply with a sharp knife, season well.
  2. Fry briskly in hot butter. Remove from the pan and keep hot.
  3. Fry two rashers of Bacon and the banana cut in four.
  4. Serve the Chicken on a hot dish, with the Bacon on top, and then the browned banana, with Potato crisps round.
  5. Garnish with parsley or watercress.
title: Chicken and Banana

directions:
1. Cut the Steak into slices 1-inch thick. Trim into neat rounds and beat.
  2. Rub with salt and brush with oil. Allow to stand 1 hour.
  3. Fry both sides rapidly in hot fat. Cook 5 to 7 minutes altogether.
  4. Cut bananas in halves lengthwise, then across in two.
  5. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes by the side of the meat.
  6. Serve Steak on rounds of fried bread
title: Fillet of Steak with Bananas

directions:
1. Put the onions in a pan with oil and fry.
  2. Boil potatoes in water until fully cooked. Remove from water and whip potatoes until smooth adding salt to taste.
  3. Mix potatoes and fried onions. (If the mixture is thin add the egg yolks) Form mixture into balls filling center with Cheese. Flatten balls into patties.
  4. Place patties in frying pan and fry until golden.
  5. Serve with a fresh salad of lettuce, tomato, avocado and Peanut sauce.
title: Liapingachos

directions:
1. In deep pan, fry the meat in half the oil.
  2. Add salt, lemon juice, and water.
  3. Reduce heat.
  4. Heat remaining oil in another pan.
  5. Add curry powder while stirring.
  6. Add onions and potatoes (and optional vegetables).
  7. Stir over medium heat until onions are clear.
  8. Add curry-onion-Potato mix to meat.
  9. Simmer until meat and potatoes are done.
title: Tanzanian Meat Stew

directions: 1. Wash, peel and cut potatoes. Boil in salted water until soft enough to mash. Let mashed potatoes cool a little. Take a handful of potatoes and make a small pocket in the center with your fingers. Stuff it with small pieces of mozzarella Cheese and mold to form a patty. Fry over medium heat in 2 tablespoons oil until brown. Turn over and fry other side, adding more oil as needed.
title: Ecuadorian Tortillas

directions:
1. Remove kernels from the ear and grind into a corn meal.
  2. Melt butter in frying pan.
  3. In a mixing bowl combine melted butter, cornmeal, Cheese, salt, flour and eggs. Mix with wooden spoon.
  4. Wash the cornhusks.
  5. Place a spoonful of mixture in the center of each husk. Fold husk over the mixture. Place in a pot and steam for 45 minutes.
title: Humitas

directions:
1. Broil eggplant until softened.
  2. Cool, peel and mash.
  3. Blender may be used.
  4. Crush garlic, eggplant, salt and 1½ carton of yogurt thoroughly.
  5. Place into serving bowl.
  6. Spread remaining yogurt over top and garnish with chopped nuts or chopped parsley.
title: Patlijan (Sempoog) Madzoon Meza

directions:
1. Peel the cassava and plantains; cut into short lengths;.
  2. Boil the cassava and plantain in unsalted water until cooked, about 20 minutes;.
  3. Cool the plantains in their cooking water;.
  4. Drain the cassava; mash in a mortar with a few drops of the cooking water to prevent it from becoming sticky; it should have the consistency of a smooth paste;.
  5. Mash the plantains separately without adding any water until smooth;.
  6. Combine the plantain and cassava; add a few drops of water if necessary to achieve the proper consistency;.
  7. Season with salt; using your hands, form the paste into balls or oval loaves;.
  8. Serve with eggplant sauce or "pépé soup".
title: Foutou

directions:
1. Cook the potatoes
  2. Mash the potatoes, add salt to taste
  3. Add the flour
  4. Mix it till you have a soft texture (if necessary add more flour)
  5. Move the mixture to a flour covered table for forming
  6. Cut the mixture into small strips (more or less the size of a carrot)
  7. Cut the strips into small squares
  8. Run a fork along the outside of each square to add design (optional)
  9. Let them dry for a few minutes, keeping the squares separated so they dont stick
  10. Boil water with salt. Carfully add the ñoquies to the boiling water
  11. Stir slowly and with care
  12. When the ñoquies stop floating, stop the fire and strain them from the pot
  13. Ñoquies are great with tomato salsa and grated Cheese
title: Ñoquis de Papas

directions:
1. In unsalted boiling water, cook a and b, peeled and sliced for about 15 to 20 minutes.
  2. Remove the pan from the heat, and let them cool down in the cooking liquid.
  3. Drain a and grind until smooth and free of any lumps then add b and mash until smooth.
title: Fresh Plantain Fufu

directions:
1. Cut the bananas lengthwise, then into little pieces.
  2. Pour about 5 inches of oil into a saucepan and heat until boiling.
  3. Place half the sliced bananas in the oil.
  4. Fry until reddish-brown. Remove.
  5. Fry the other half. Remove.
  6. Serve immediately.
  7. Best with grilled fish.
title: Aloco I

directions:
1. Tenderize the steaks by pounding on them with a meat tenderizer. Lightly beat the egg(s) with a fork and add salt, garlic powder and chopped parsley. Mix. Pass the meat through the egg mixture, and then through the bread crumbs. You can use either plain bread crumbs, or "Italian" style. Coat well.
  2. Fry in olive oil until done, usually a couple of minutes on each side. You can also bake the milanesas on the oven - for a less fatty alternative. If you fry them, make sure to use a few paper towels to drain the oil.
  3. Fry the eggs.
  4. Put a slice of ham and a slice of cheese on the milanesa. Put them in the microwave or the oven for a few minutes until the cheese melts. Place a fried egg on top and serve.
title: Saddled Breaded Cutlets

directions:
1. Season all the meats except the sausages with salt and pepper.
  2. Fire up your grill so that all the coals give off an even medium temperature. You want all your meats to be well browned and slightly crispy NOT blackened. The meats should be grilled at a slow but reasonable time in order for them to be cooked in their own juices. Place the Chicken, sausages, and Pork before anything else since they take longer to cook. When the meat is cooked to your preference then serve immediately.
  3. Be sure to accompany your meats with a bowl of Chimichurri sauce at the table.
title: Parrillada Argentine

directions:
1. Beat the eggs with a fork; add the flour a little at a time and the salt.
  2. Mix with a spoon until you get a sour-creamlike paste.
  3. Set to boil the soup strained into a clean pot and when it comes to the first boil, pour the paste a little at a time, with the help of a fork.
  4. Cover the pot and let boil for a couple of minutes.
title: Soup with Lazy Noodles

directions:
1. Bake the eggplants, peel them while hot and let drain.
  2. Chop with a wooden or glass chopper and put in a bowl, adding salt, cheese, eggs and flour.
  3. Mix everything well, shape medium sized pancakes and then fry in hot oil on both sides.
  4. Arrange on a platter, sprinkle some grated cheese on top and garnish with a few lettuce leaves.
  5. Serve hot or cold.
title: Eggplant Pancakes

directions:
1. Sift the flour, make a hole in the middle and pour the eggs inside.
  2. Mix them with a little flour, then add the water and salt and make stiff dough.
  3. Divide in three, then work each third a little, make into balls and let rest, covered, for 5–10 minutes.
  4. Take each ball and make a sheet as thin as possible.
  5. Place it on a floured cloth and let dry.
  6. When half dry, cut 1 inch wide strips, place 4-5 strips on top of one another and cut, with a very sharp knife, into very thin strips.
  7. Spread the noodles onto a clean surface and let dry for another 15–20 minutes.
  8. They can be used afterwards.
title: Moldovan Noodles

directions:
1. Set the water to boil.
  2. When the water is boiling, add the salt and a little of the cornmeal.
  3. After a few minutes, when the water is boiling, add the rest of the cornmeal.
  4. Mix it briefly and then let it boil at low temperature for about half an hour.
  5. Then, with a wooden spoon start mixing vigorously.
  6. If the polenta seems soft, add a little bit more corn meal.
  7. Mix continuously. To test if the polenta is done, hold the wooden spoon straight.
  8. Rotate it fast between your palms and then try to pull it out.
  9. If it comes out clean, the polenta is done.
  10. If not, let the polenta boil a little longer.
  11. Then you wet a wooden spoon in water and gather the polenta to the center.
  12. Let it boil a few more minutes and then shake the pot a few times and turn over the hot polenta on a wooden cutting board (not recommended to pour on a plate).
  13. Let it set for a few minutes and then cut it with a clean string.
title: Mamaliga

directions:
1. Drain the cheese well and mix with the butter, garlic and salt.
  2. Choose firm and round tomatoes, cut a slice on top and remove the inside with all the seeds.
  3. Fill with the cheese mixture, and then spread dill on top.
  4. Refrigerate.
title: Moldovan Cheese-stuffed Tomatoes

directions:
1. Cut the onions in quarters.
  2. Place into a small saucepan with one tablespoon of butter, the liver and a few tablespoons of water.
  3. Cover and let boil until all liquid evaporates.
  4. Let cool and then grind the liver and onions.
  5. Mix this paste with the rest of the butter until creamy.
  6. Add salt, then place on a plate, smoothing the top.
  7. Garnish with the pickled peppers and cucumbers.
title: Liver Pâté I

directions:
1. Split the herrings lengthwise on their belly, remove roe and keep in tepid water for 5 – 6 hours.
  2. Then wash in cold water, skin them starting from the head to the tail, remove the backbone with all big bones, cut in pieces about two fingers thick and then arrange them side by side on a long platter, so that to resemble the whole.
  3. Peel the onions, keep them in cold water and then slice very thinly.
  4. Arrange the onion slices around the and on top of them the pitted.
  5. Pour the oil and vinegar dressing.
  6. Serve with potatoes or rye bread.
title: Salted Herring and Onion Salad

directions:
1. Bake the eggplant, let it drain well, and chop with a wooden or glass chopper.
  2. Set in a bowl and mix with the oil poured little by little.
  3. Add finely chopped onion, salt and pepper.
  4. Choose small and firm tomatoes and remove the inside with all the seeds.
  5. Fill with the eggplant mixture, then place all stuffed tomatoes on a platter and decorate them with a sprig of parsley for each tomato.
title: Tomatoes stuffed with Eggplant

directions: 1. The sauce may be prepared with fried or unfried flour.
title: Milk Sauce

directions:
1. Cut Beef into bite-sized cubes. Mix flour, cinnamon and seasoning and roll meat in this mixture. Cook meat, Onion, and pinch of salt over very slow flame.
  2. When the juice is re-absorbed, add garlic and cooking oil and fry lightly. Add water to barely cover and cook over low heat for one hour, adding more hot water, along the side of the pot, whenever the level of the juice is too low.
  3. Serve with the juice, which should be fairly concentrated.
title: Kebab Halla

directions:
1. Simmer the meat, onions, coriander, salt and pepper in water in a covered saucepan over low heat for one hour. Remove the meat and set aside, and keep warm.
  2. Add 2 cups of water and the milk to the stock in which the meat was cooked. Bring to a boil. Stir in rice, cover and cook very gently over low heat until the rice is nearly cooked (about 15 minutes.) Turn off the heat and allow to steam 10 minutes longer.
  3. Place the rice on a large tray. Arrange the pieces of meat on top. Pour the melted butter over the rice and meat. Serve with a vegetable salad.
title: Lamb with Rice

directions:
1. Beat eggs, add sifted flour, cinnamon, and seasoning, and beat again.
  2. Heat oil and fry onion until golden, then stir in beaten eggs and fry on quick flame.
  3. When the underside sets, lift the edge or tilt the pan to let the liquid run underneath.
  4. Turn over and continue frying until both sides are golden and dry.
  5. Omelets are usually served in thick slices.
title: Igga Baladi Omelet

directions:
1. Peel and slice the tomatoes ˝ inch thick. Fry the Onion until it softens, then add the tomatoes and cook for 10–12 minutes.
  2. Shell the eggs, leave whole and slide onto the tomato mixture. Cook for 5 minutes.
  3. To serve, remove the eggs, halve, arrange in a serving dish and cover with the tomato mixture.
title: Hardboiled eggs a la Alexandria

directions:
1. Place washed and picked over Lentils, carrots and chopped onions in water and simmer covered for one hour.
  2. Mix oil, flour, salt and spices in a bowl. Add ¼ cup soup to mixture and stir well.
  3. Pour the mixture into the soup and let simmer until the Lentils are well cooked and the soup is creamy.
  4. Add lemon juice and simmer 5 more minutes. If desired, garnish with lemon slices.
title: Shorba Ads

directions:
1. Strip the kale from the stalks and finely chop and use only the dark-green leafs.
  2. Peel, wash and halve the potatoes. Boil the potatoes until tender.
  3. Meanwhile, pour about 5 cms of water in a second pan, add some salt and bring to a boil. Add the kale, turn down the heat and let it simmer and shrink.
  4. Heat the smoked Sausage au bain marie.
  5. When both the kale and potatoes are done, drain the vegetables. Add the butter and milk to the potatoes and mash them.
  6. Mix in the kale and add salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.
  7. Slice the sausage and put on top of dish.
title: Stamppot Boerenkool met Worst

directions:
1. Make potatoes according to directions, bake for 10 minutes.
  2. Remove from oven and add chopped up sausage poking the pieces down into the potatoes.
  3. Return to oven and bake until done and bubbly.
title: Cold Noodles in Sesame Paste

directions:
1. Peel plantains and cut into ½ inch slices.
  2. Fry in hot oil until golden.
  3. Place on cutting board and smash the slices with a glass bottle or rolling pin.
  4. Sprinkle with salt and return to pan to fry again.
  5. Fry until crispy.
  6. Drain on paper towels and serve immediately. Ketchup is optional!
title: Patacones I

directions:
1. Peel the plantains and cut them in small pieces.
  2. Place them in a Pyrex bowl and cover them with the orange juice, rum, and bee honey.
  3. Sprnkle the cinnamon on top.
  4. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 350°F for approximately 30 minutes.
title: Plantains à l'Orange

directions:
1. For the fruits, slice banana and halve the strawberries.
  2. if you are suing peaches and pineapple, slice them. Halve the figs.
  3. For the sauce, mix the mango pulp and yogurt|yoghurt very well.
  4. To proceed, pour the sauce over the fruits and keep in the refrigerator until you wish to serve.
title: Fruits in Golden Sauce

directions:
1. Julienne the cabbage, rub some salt into it and scald with water.
  2. Drain well and grind.
  3. Then mix with egg, flour, parsley and dill, salt and pepper.
  4. Make pancakes from the mixture.
  5. Dredge with flour or bread crumbs and fry in hot lard.
title: Cabbage Pancakes

directions:
1. Less than full pkg. frozen chopped spinach (thaw and squeeze) 1 cup mozzarella cubed, (about 2 thick slices cubed) 1/2 cup (about) Romano or Parmesan grated Cheese Grease small loaf pan (do not flour).
  2. Mix all of above ingredents together (by hand-do not use mixer), will be lumpy.
  3. Pour into loaf pan. Bake about 30/45 mins. at 350 degrees.
  4. Can be served hot or cold- slice to desired thickness.
title: Spinach Bread

directions:
1. Bake the eggplants, peel while hot and let drain.
  2. Separate into strips.
  3. In a pan, arrange a layer of eggplant, then a layer of peeled and sliced tomatoes.
  4. Sprinkle some of the chopped garlic and some salt.
  5. Then another layer of eggplant, tomatoes, chopped garlic and salt.
  6. Follow this procedure until all eggplants and tomatoes are used up.
  7. Fry the thinly sliced onions in oil.
  8. Put the onions aside and pour the oil onto the eggplants and tomatoes in the pan.
  9. Bake until the garlic softens.
  10. Let cool, arrange on a plate and sprinkle the fried onions on top.
  11. Serve cold.
title: Eggplant with Garlic

directions:
1. Slice the eggplants lengthwise and crosswise to make 8 pieces.
  2. Scald with boiling water and then weigh down with something heavy between 2 wooden cutting boards, for 15 minutes.
  3. Drain well, dredge with flour and then fry each piece in hot oil.
  4. Place in a heat resistant dish and pour the following sauce on them.
  5. Fry the finely chopped garlic in the oil remaining from frying the eggplants.
  6. Mix with the peeled, seeded and chopped tomatoes, sugar and salt.
  7. Bake for 15 – 20 minutes.
  8. Serve cold.
title: Greek-style Eggplants

directions:
1. Wash the potatoes and boil in their jackets.
  2. When done, peel and slice thinly or cube.
  3. Fry the finely chopped onions in lard until yellow.
  4. Add the potatoes, salt, pepper and mix well, crushing the potatoes somewhat.
  5. The more lard you use, the tastier the potatoes.
title: Hungarian Potatoes

directions:
1. Lightly fry the onions in oil, then add the washed rice and lightly fry it.
  2. Add the cut, washed and blanched leeks, salt, pepper, tomato sauce and water.
  3. Set to boil and at the first bubble, cover the pot and bake until done.
title: Leek Pilaf

directions:
1. Pick the spinach leaves, wash in several changes of water. Set to boil in previously boiling water. Boil for just a few minutes until the spinach is wilted.
  2. Drain and leave in the colander until cool. Chop very fine. Then put in a pan with the butter, 2-3 tablespoons of water, milk and salt and simmer until the liquid is reduced.
  3. Serve this dish with fried or scrambled eggs.
title: Mashed spinach with fried eggs

directions:
1. Clean the mushrooms, wash well and cut in pieces.
  2. Lightly fry the thinly sliced onions in oil, add the mushrooms and the peeled, seeded and sliced tomatoes, salt, pepper, dill and parsley.
  3. Simmer until the liquid is reduced.
  4. It may be served warm; however, it is much tastier when cold.
title: Mushroom and Tomato Dish

directions:
1. Clean, wash and cut the mushrooms.
  2. Place in a pan, with the chopped onions and 2 cups of water.
  3. Simmer for approx. 15 minutes.
  4. Drain and measure the mushroom liquid.
  5. You must have 2 cups of liquid.
  6. If there is more, throw out the excess; if there is less, add water.
  7. Put the drained mushrooms in a pan, pour the 2 cups of liquid and add the rice which was previously washed and lightly fried in 3 tablespoons of oil, salt and pepper.
  8. Simmer, covered with a lid wrapped in a soaked and squeezed cloth.
  9. When the rice is almost done, place in the oven, at low heat, until ready.
  10. You may serve this dish warm or cold.
title: Mushroom Pilaf

directions:
1. Clean the mushrooms, wash, cut and boil in salt water (with water only to cover).
  2. When they are done, drain and keep the liquid.
  3. Lightly fry the flour in butter, add the liquid that you kept, the milk and simmer until the sauce is medium thick.
  4. Add the mushrooms and simmer 10 more minutes.
  5. Serve hot with mamaliga.
title: Mushroom White Sauce Stew

directions:
1. Choose large mushrooms, clean, remove stems, wash and drain well.
  2. Finely chop the cleaned and washed stems, mix with salt, pepper and chopped parsley.
  3. Arrange the mushrooms on a baking sheet, fill with the chopped stems, sprinkle with some salt and oil and bake at medium heat.
  4. When they are done, arrange on a platter and drizzle with the pan drippings.
title: Romanian Baked Mushrooms

directions:
1. Put the peas and peeled, seeded and sliced tomatoes in a pan with oil.
  2. salt and simmer, covered, shaking the pan every now and then.
  3. Add 1 – 2 tablespoons of water when needed.
  4. When the peas are done, add the chopped dill and parsley and simmer a few more minutes.
  5. Serve hot or cold.
title: Peas Peasant-style

directions:
1. Peel the potatoes, boil, drain and crush with the potato press, sieve or grind.
  2. Put in a bowl, add flour, salt, pepper and beaten egg, mixing well.
  3. Make pancakes from this mixture.
  4. Dredge with flour and fry in oil or lard.
  5. They may be served with sautes.
title: Romanian Potato Pancakes

directions:
1. Peel the potatoes, wash and cut into sticks.
  2. salt and let sit with the salt for a few minutes.
  3. Then dry with a cloth and fry in hot lard.
  4. Remove from the pan with the slotted spoon, draining the lard well.
  5. Serve hot as side dish for roasts and ground meats.
  6. Drain and strain the remaining lard and keep for future use.
title: French-fried Potatoes I

directions:
1. Peel the potatoes, wash and cut into 1 finger thick slices.
  2. salt and let sit with the salt for 5 minutes.
  3. Put all potatoes in a large pan with the hot oil and lard, mix and cover with a lid.
  4. After a few minutes, raise the lid, quickly wipe it with a dry cloth, gently mix the potatoes and put the wiped lid back on.
  5. Repeat this procedure every 3 minutes until the potatoes are done.
  6. potatoes fried this way are nicely browned, soft inside and do not use much shortening.
title: Economically-fried Potatoes

directions:
1. Clean and wash the vegetables and boil in salt water until done.
  2. Cube the potatoes and kohlrabi first.
  3. Drain and then add to the following sauce: fry ½ tablespoon flour with 2 oz/50 g butter and add hot milk to it.
  4. Simmer for 10 – 15 minutes, then add the remaining 2 oz / 50 g butter, let simmer a few more minutes and serve immediately.
title: Vegetables in Milk Sauce

directions:
1. Remove the peel (grate), wash and boil the zuchini.
  2. Leave in the colander for half an hour to drain well.
  3. Then chop with the wooden chopper.
  4. Put in a bowl and mix with the chopped and lightly fried onion, egg, flour, soaked and squeezed bread, salt, pepper, parsley and dill.
  5. Take tablespoons of this mixture and fry in hot lard on both sides.
  6. Place on a plate and serve with green lettuce or tomato slices arranged around the pancakes.
title: Zucchini Pancakes

directions:
1. Half the papaya and scoop out its seeds; peel the halves.
  2. Cut the flesh into small pieces.
  3. Peel the mangoes. Slice as much of the flesh off the pit as possible, being careful to capture any juices.
  4. Cut the flesh into small pieces.
  5. Add the pieces and their juices to the bowl holding the papaya.
  6. Cut the pineapple into small pieces, again being careful to capture any juices.
  7. Add the pineapple and juices to the other fruits.
  8. Toss well, cover and refrigerate until well chilled.
title: Fruits Salad

directions:
1. Julienne the washed cabbage. Rub it with salt until soft.
  2. Squeeze excess liquid. Mix with oil, vinegar and salt (if needed). Serve with roasts.
title: Romanian Cabbage salad

directions:
1. Wash the Cauliflower, divide in flowerets and boil in salt water.
  2. Drain and place in salad bowl. Pour a dressing made of oil, vinegar and salt on top.
title: Cauliflower salad

directions:
1. Julienne the peeled and washed celery and mix with the peeled and thinly sliced Apples.
  2. Add oil, vinegar and salt.
title: Celery and apple salad

directions:
1. Boil the water with the salt added in a saucepan.
  2. In a separate bowl, stir the milk into the white cornmeal.
  3. Keep stirring until it is smooth.
  4. Then slowly pour the cornmeal mixture into the boiling salted water.
  5. Stir this mixture constantly for a couple of minutes until it starts to thicken.
  6. Turn the heat on the stove to low and continue to cook the ugali for about 10 - 15 minutes.
  7. Stir it every couple of minutes.
  8. Keep cooking and stirring until the ugali is very stiff and thick and pulls away from the sides of the saucepan.
title: Ugali

directions:
1. Wash the peppers, take the cores out and cut into very narrow strips.
  2. Chop the onions and fry in hot oil until soft.
  3. Add the peppers and tomato paste made from 1 lb/500 g tomatoes.
  4. Adjust the salt and let fry at slow heat until most of the liquid is absorbed. Serve cold.
title: Fried peppers salad Romanian style

directions:
1. Peel and thinly slice the cucumbers and Apples. Wash, clean and grate the carrots.
  2. Wash and tear the lettuce into small pieces.
  3. Mix all these with salt, lemon juice and oil.
  4. Place in the salad bowl and decorate with tomato slices.
title: Health salad

directions:
1. Wash the leeks and cut into thin rounds.
  2. salt and add oil and vinegar.
title: Leek Salad I

directions:
1. Wash, boil, peel and let cool the potatoes.
  2. Then slice very thinly and mix with salt, thinly sliced onions, pickle rounds, oil and vinegar.
  3. Place in salad bowl and garnish with rounds of hard boiled egg.
  4. You can also add some tomato slices.
title: Potato Salad II

directions:
1. Roast the peppers, turning on all sides.
  2. Place in a pan, cover with a clean cloth and then a lid and let sit for 20 minutes.
  3. Peel, arrange in salad bowl, add salt, oil and vinegar and garnish with tomato slices.
title: Roasted peppers salad I

directions:
1. Wash and dry the liver, then put it in the oven to bake. When it's ready, let it cool, then grate it on the vegetable grater.
  2. Arrange it nicely in a bowl. Add the very finely chopped onions then the oil, salt, pepper and vinegar.
  3. Mix everything well and then arrange it on a plate and use lettuce and hard boiled egg slices as garnish around the liver.
title: Baked Liver Paste

directions:
1. Slit the fish lengthwise and keep in warm water for 5 – 6 hours.
  2. Then wash, skin and debone the fish.
  3. Remove the head and tail but keep them.
  4. Chop or grind the fish very fine.
  5. Sieve the hard boiled yolk and then mix with butter.
  6. Add the ground fish and make a paste.
  7. Then add the grated apple and mix some more.
  8. Place the paste on a long serving plate and shape it like a fish.
  9. Put the head and tail where they belong.
  10. Sprinkle the finely chopped egg white on top.
  11. Decorate with lettuce leaves placed around the fish paste.
  12. You can also use this paste for sandwiches.
title: Herring Paste with Apples

directions:
1. Wash the fish, skin and debone it.
  2. Then grind or chop very fine.
  3. Place the fish paste in a bowl and mix with the soaked and squeezed bread, gradually adding the oil.
  4. After the oil is used up, add the onion, vinegar, walnuts and mix well.
  5. Place the mixture on a long serving plate, shaping like a fish.
  6. Put the head and tail where they belong.
  7. Keep cold until serving.
title: Herring Paste with Walnuts

directions:
1. Clean, wash and cut the Mushrooms in big pieces. On the bottom of a pot, place 2 teaspoons of butter, the quartered onions, the Mushrooms, the liver cut in big pieces and two tablespoons of water. Cover and boil over slow heat, shaking the pot from time to time.
  2. When there is no liquid left, take off the heat, cool, then grind everything. Place the butter in a bowl and add the ground mixture.
  3. Mix until creamy, add salt, pepper and place on a serving plate, smoothing the top. Garnish with slices of egg. On the yolk, place an olive or piece of pickled pepper and a parsley leaf.
title: Liver Pâté with Mushrooms

directions:
1. Hard boil the eggs, shell and cut them in two lengthwise after they are cool.
  2. Carefully remove the egg yolk|yolks and place them in a bowl.
  3. Mix them with the butter.
  4. Add parsley, salt and pepper and then use the paste to fill the egg whites.
  5. Spread some chopped parsley on top.
  6. Arrange the stuffed eggs on a bed of lettuce on a plate.
title: Stuffed Eggs Romanian-style

directions:
1. Boil the Crayfish in salt water.
  2. When they are boiled and cooled, get the meaty parts, grind or chop them fine and then mix with butter, salt and a teaspoon tomato paste.
  3. Mix until creamy. Refrigerate until serving.
title: Crayfish Butter

directions:
1. Beat the butter with a wooden spoon until creamy.
  2. Add mustard and salt. Mix well. Refrigerate until serving.
title: Mustard Butter

directions:
1. Scald the spinach leaves, drain, sieve, then mix with butter.
  2. Add salt to taste.
title: Green Butter

directions:
1. Sieve the roasted beet.
  2. Mix a teaspoon of beet purée with the butter.
  3. Add salt to taste.
title: Pink Butter

directions:
1. Split the Herring lengthwise on the belly line.
  2. Remove the roe and then keep the Herring in water for 5–6 hours.
  3. Then drain, remove the skin, backbone and all bones.
  4. Finely chop the Herring fillet and mix with butter.
title: Herring butter

directions:
1. The sauce may be prepared with fried or unfried flour.
  2. Boil the anise in a cup of broth and then strain.
title: Anise Sauce

directions: 1. The sauce may be prepared with fried or unfried flour.
title: Egg Sauce

directions:
1. Boil the cauliflower in salt water, drain and set aside. Fry the flour with the butter, add milk, stirring continuously, then add egg yolk|yolks one by one, stirring at all times.
  2. After well cooled, butter a mold, arrange the cauliflower within and pour the egg mixture to which the whipped egg whites have also been added, after cooling.
  3. Salt and bake at medium heat. Serve warm.
title: Almond Snack Mix

directions:
1. Melt the butter in a pan, add flour and let fry until golden. Pour the milk and mix well. Let the paste obtained this way cool.
  2. When cold, add the egg yolk|yolks one by one, the Parmesan and then the whipped egg whites. Pour into a buttered and bread crumbed mold. Bake, and when risen and golden, turn gently onto a plate, serving hot.
  3. If Parmesan is not available, replace with brinza|sheep's cheese.
title: Parmesan Soufflé

directions:
1. Clean and boil each vegetable (whole) separately, in salt water.
  2. When ready, cube the carrots and potatoes.
  3. Serve as side dish for roasts, arranging one row of peas, one of carrots and one of potatoes, around the roast.
  4. Pour the melted butter over the vegetables.
title: Assorted Vegetables with Butter II

directions:
1. Boil potatoes in water till tender.
  2. Drain and mash potatoes.
  3. In a separate pan, saute onions and mushrooms in oil and water over medium-high heat for three minutes.
  4. In a large bowl, mix mashed potatoes, sauteed onions and mushrooms, seasonings and flour together in a large bowl.
  5. Form croquettes.
  6. Heat oil in a large frying pan and fry croquettes over medium-high heat for 8 minutes on each side or until light brown.
  7. Serve with sour cream and chopped greens.
title: Apricot Dumplings

directions: 1. The rice, butter and salt should be mixed together into a bowl and pour some water till covered. Leave for few minutes. Boil some additional water to steam it. Let it cook under pressure of steamer.
title: Ruzz Mbauakhi

directions: 1. Put the rice, butter and salt in a saucepan and let it cook under low temperature until the rice turn into golden colour. Add some water less than rice level. Cook with a low heat until the rice is ready.
title: Fish Zalivnoe

directions:
1. Stir flour over low heat until it becomes yellowish, then strain.
  2. Add flour to the dates and flour.
  3. Stir over low heat until well mixed.
  4. Pour a little milk and mix continously.
  5. Cook over low heat until smooth mixture.
  6. Add cardamom and walnuts, wait few minuets until it cools down, and serve it with Arabic coffee.
title: Tamriyya

directions:
1. In a large bowl stir the salt into the yogurt.
  2. Place the yogurt in the center of a piece of doubled cheese cloth or piece of soft cotton.
  3. Pull corners up and tie tightly.
  4. Suspend from a stationary object over a bowl (to catch liquid).
  5. Let this hang overnight or about 12 hours.
  6. When well drained it will be the consistency of cottage cheese.
  7. Remove from the cloth.
  8. Store covered in the refrigerator until needed.
title: Homemade Labneh

directions:
1. Simmer chicken in water seasoned with salt to taste until tender, about 1 hour.
  2. Remove chicken from cooking water, reserving 1-cup stock.
  3. Cool chicken slightly, then cut into 4 portions.
  4. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in large skillet.
  5. Add chicken pieces and saute until lightly browned.
  6. Remove chicken pieces and keep warm.
  7. Melt the remaining butter in a saucepan.
  8. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, until lightly browned.
  9. Add stock and bring to a boil, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
  10. Add vinegar, garlic, walnuts and salt and pepper to taste.
  11. Stir and cook until warm.
  12. Spoon sauce over chicken pieces.
title: Pulë me Arra

directions:
1. Clean lamb entrails very well.
  2. Put intensive lamb in a bowl, and mix with salt, pepper and marjoram.
  3. Then pour a little oil.
  4. Cut intestines lamb, lungs, livers, glands, grease into small square forms.
  5. Put in a bowl and mix with salt and pepper just like intensive lambs.
  6. Spit in a rod the entrails, then heart, and repeat this ordering, till in the end.
  7. With one of the intensive lambs cover completely all those.
  8. Tie the intestines lamb in a such manner that it can't burst during the baking.
  9. Dot during the bake with a mixture of oil-butter-lemon-juice.
title: Roasted Lamb Entrails on a Spit

directions:
1. Skin and cut up cucumbers. Cut into bite size pieces.
  2. Put in large bowl.
  3. Crush garlic.
  4. Add to cucumbers.
  5. Pour in buttermilk.
  6. Mix thoroughly (more garlic may be added, if you wish).
  7. salt to taste.
  8. Keep refrigerated.
  9. Serve cold.
title: Albanian Tera Ta

directions:
1. Mix the yogurt with the garlic and salt.
  2. Powder dried mint with your hands and add to yogurt.
  3. Mix.
title: Albanian Yogurt Sauce

directions:
1. The vegetables must all be chopped up finely.
  2. Wash the rice thoroughly.
  3. Combine all ingredients, except the potatoes.
  4. Cook slowly for twenty minutes, then add the potatoes and let everything continue to cook slowly about an hour.
title: Uruguayan Rice

directions:
1. Boil the eggs for about 10 minutes (hard-boiled eggs).
  2. Make white sauce: put the milk and butter to boil, when it has boiled add cornstarch dissolved in cold milk, allowed to thicken and when it is ready remove from heat and add pepper and nutmeg.
  3. In an oiled roasting pan place the peeled eggs and cut in half horizontally, covered with white sauce and sprinkle with grated cheese.
  4. Set the oven to broil.
  5. Serve with white rice or mashed potatoes.
title: Huevos al Horno

directions:
1. Wash and cut zucchinis in half lengthwise and hollow out.
  2. Place the butter in a saucepan, add the onion, zucchini pulp and sauté for a short while.
  3. Then add the cornstarch, milk, and salt, stir and cook a little longer, until well mixed.
  4. Stuff the zucchinis, sprinkle with grated cheese.
  5. Baked until the zucchinis are golden and tender.
title: Zapallitos Rellenos

directions:
1. Put water and salt in a small pot or deep pan and bring to shallow boil.
  2. Add 1 spoon of oil.
  3. Add flour while stirring the mixture quickly with wide/flat wooden spoon.
  4. Remove the mix and keep stirring about in a large bowl until it softens (becomes aseeda)
  5. Add some of the boiled water to the aseeda and let it gently cook for 10 minutes.
  6. Again beat the mixture for it softens and and becomes a thick, the consistency of soft play dough. Shape into a small mound in a bowl. Create a small crater with a spoon on top.
  7. Pour melted butter as a shallow moat around mound, and honey or date syrup on top in crater. Eat with fingers, pulling portions of cooked buttery mound and dipping in honey.
title: Libyan Aseeda

directions:
1. Use sharp knife to slice potatoes in wedges.
  2. Use a large pan to heat the spices in the oil on medium heat but do not burn. Add Onion and garlic and cook 2 minutes.
  3. Cook potatoes for 2 additional minutes. Add the water and cook potatoes until tender on medium heat.
title: Curried Potatoes Trinidad

directions:
1. Beat the egg, add the milk, sugar and a little salt.
  2. Moisten the bread slices and fry on both sides in hot lard.
  3. Serve with Green Beans with Butter.
title: French Toast I

directions:
1. Sift the flour, make a hole in the middle and pour the eggs inside. Mix them with a little flour, then add the water and salt and make a stiff dough.
  2. Divide in three, then work each third a little, make into balls and let rest, covered, for 5–10 minutes. Take each ball and make a sheet as thin as possible.
  3. Place it on a floured cloth and let dry. When half dry, cut 1 inch wide strips, place 4-5 strips on top of one another and cut, with a very sharp knife, into very thin strips.
  4. Sprad the noodles onto a clean surface and let dry for another 15–20 minutes. They can be used afterwards.
title: Romanian Noodles

directions:
1. Set the pot with water to boil.
  2. When the water is hot, add salt.
  3. Sprinkle a little of the cornmeal.
  4. When it starts boiling, place a wooden spoon in the pot and start to gradually add the cornmeal (rain-like).
  5. Keep mixing with the wooden spoon.
  6. When the polenta seems sufficiently dense, stop adding cornmeal.
  7. Keep mixing, pressing the polenta towards the edges of the pot.
  8. When the polenta is cooked through, take the wooden spoon out and clean it with another wet spoon.
  9. Start gathering the polenta towards the center of the pot and let it boil for a few more minutes.
  10. After it has made a few more steamy bubbles, grab the pot with oven mitts, shake it a few times and pour the polenta on a wooden cutting board.
  11. The quick polenta is softer than boiled polenta and is served with fried eggs, cheese and sour cream, etc.
title: Quick Polenta

directions:
1. n a large bowl (large enough to hold at least twice the volume of rice, about 6 cups) cover rice with cold water by 2 to 3 inches. Soak rice 8 to 24 hours. Alternatively, soak rice in warm water (about 110F) 2 hours. The longer soak allows more flavor to develop.
  2. Drain rice and transfer to a Southeast Asian rice steaamer basket or lined sieve (see note). Set steamer basket or sieve over several inches of boiling water in a large pot or deep kettle. It is important that the rice NOT TOUCH boiling water. Cover rice with a lid and steam, checking water level occasionally to make sure pot or kettle doesn't boil dry and adding more boiling water if necessary, 25 minutes, or until rice is shiny and tender.
  3. ransfer rice to a basket or bowl, breaking it up into smaller lumps, and immediately cover with a lid or clean kitchen towel. (rice dries out if exposed to air as it cools, so keep covered until serving.)
title: Khao Neeo (Sticky Rice)

directions:
1. Break the eggs into a bowl, beat until foamy, mix the milk and salt and then pour in the hot buttered pan.
  2. Fry at low temperature, and after the bottom has started to brown a little, turn onto the other side and let it brown too.
  3. When it is ready, roll like a jelly roll and place onto the plate.
  4. It can be served as is, with Tomato Sauce Romanian-style|Tomato Sauce or Sour Cream Sauce.
title: Omelette

directions:
1. Beat the eggs until foamy, mix with the milk and salt and pour into the hot butter or lard in the pan. Keep stirring lightly with the fork.
  2. Do not overfry. Serve immediately.
title: Scrambled eggs

directions:
1. Cut the bacon to make some indentations in it. Fry well on all sides.
  2. When it starts to become crispy, pour the beaten eggs with the salt, mix with the fork and serve immediately.
title: Scrambled Eggs, Transylvania-style

directions:
1. Wash, dry the eggplant, cube it, salt it and let it sit for 20 – 30 minutes.
  2. Then wash it and drain well.
  3. Fry in hot oil until soft.
  4. Pour the beaten eggs on top.
  5. Fry until the eggs are done (do not overfry).
  6. Serve immediately.
title: Scrambled Eggs with Eggplant

directions:
1. Beat the eggs, mix with the milk and salt. Fry the cubed Ham in a little lard.
  2. Pour the beaten eggs in the pan, over the Ham.
  3. Mix gently with the fork until the eggs are done.
  4. You may replace the Ham with bologna. Serve immediately.
title: Scrambled eggs with ham

directions:
1. Clean and wash the, then split lengthwise and cut in 1 1/2" wide pieces; salt and let sit for a half hour.
  2. In the meantime, start frying the chopped Onion until half done. Add the washed and dried rice and let fry until it starts turning yellow.
  3. Then pour water to cover the rice and let it boil for 5–6 minutes. Place the rice-Onion mixture in a baking dish, add salt and pepper and then the pieces on top.
  4. Make a sauce out of a teaspoon of flour mixed with two tablespoons of vinegar, pour over the and place in the oven.
  5. Add some water every now and then, as needed. Serve warm or cold.
title: Carp on Rice

directions:
1. Clean, wash and cut the fish, salt it and let it sit for 10 – 15 minutes.
  2. Then dry each piece with a clean cloth, dredge with flour and fry in hot oil, on both sides.
  3. Serve warm, garnished with lemon slices.
title: Fried Perch

directions:
1. Wash the tomatoes, dry, core and remove the seeds. Reserve the tops to use as lids
  2. Mix the fish with two finely chopped raw or fried onions, a tablespoon of lard, rice, chopped parsley and dill, pepper and salt.
  3. Mix everything well and use this mixture to fill the tomatoes.
  4. Arrange in a pan then place in the oven to bake until done.
  5. Serve with sour cream.
title: Tomatoes stuffed with Fish

directions:
1. Boil the udder with the vegetables and a little salt.
  2. When it is soft, remove, let cool off, then cut into medium thick slices (as for schnitzel).
  3. salt, pepper, dredge with egg beaten with milk, drain well, dredge with flour, again with egg and finally bread crumbs.
  4. Fry in hot lard like schnitzel. Serve hot with boiled vegetables or lettuce.
title: Breaded Udder

directions:
1. Wash and dry the liver, cut into finger thick slices, dredge with flour, shake well and fry in hot oil.
  2. Do not salt until after frying, just before serving.
  3. Serve with assorted vegetables.
title: Fried Liver

directions:
1. Cut fresh-salted or fresh cucumbers in rings and pour over with honey.
  2. Serve with pancakes or rye bread.
title: Cucumbers with Honey

directions:
1. Cut the meat in bite sizes, fry a little in lard, add the chopped onion, let it fry a little, add a little water and then let it boil covered at slow heat.
  2. Add a little water from time to time until the meat is tender.
  3. Add the tomato paste or peeled and seeded tomatoes (in small chunks), salt and pepper.
  4. Cover the pot and let boil at slow heat until the liquid evaporates almost entirely.
  5. Serve with polenta meal|polenta.
title: Romanian Beef Stew

directions:
1. Cut the pork into pieces, pound, add the salt and pepper, sprinkle with minced garlic, dip in slightly whipped egg, dredge with flour and roast until done.
  2. Lay slices of cheese on the pork pieces and roast in oven.
title: DAINTY PORK

directions:
1. Prepare the bone stock, pour it in a jug or a cast-iron pot and keep it in oven for 20 to 30 minutes.
  2. Dice the peeled potatoes, slice the onion in half rings, brown and transfer to the jug with meat.
  3. Add some pepper and cook in oven until done.
title: Potato Gravy with Meat in a Jug

directions:
1. Wash the pumpkin with the skin and seeds removed, cut into chunks and boil.
  2. Boil and mash the potatoes.
  3. Mash the pumpkin and combine with the potatoes.
  4. Add the milk or sour cream, salt and stew.
  5. Serve with milk.
title: Mashed Pumpkin with Potatoes

directions:
1. Boil the peeled potatoes in salted water, put through a ricer and mash thoroughly.
  2. Separately boil pearl or fine-ground barley kaša.
  3. Combine the potatoes with hot milk and kaša.
  4. Then mix and place in oven for 30 to 40 minutes.
  5. Serve the kaša with butter.
title: Kaša in the Viciebsk Manner

directions:
1. Klocki are flour dishes. Their obvious ingredients are butter, eggs and sometimes milk.
  2. Originally the klocki were made from a rather thick dough cut into pieces, rolled into small balls and then boiled. Very popular were klocki with stuffing. In our times different cereals and Potato are used for making klocki.
  3. There are ordinary and boiled klocki. The main thing in their cooking is thorough grating and beating of all their ingredients. Klocki are boiled in salted water in a saucepan with a tightly closed lid over a slow fire which gives them the opportunity to rise up and not to fall apart
title: Klocki

directions:
1. Clean, wash and bone the fish (river-perch, ruff, etc.)
  2. Put in a saucepan and cover with water.
  3. To the boiling stock add the carrot, onions, diced potatoes, pepper, celery, bring to a boil, add the salt and boil until done over a slow fire.
title: Yushka

directions:
1. Dissolve the honey together with honeycombs in cooled boiled water, then pour in a wooden barrel.
  2. Separately dissolve the yeast in warm water, combine with the dissolved honey and mix well.
  3. Season in cool place for 6 to 8 days.
title: Miaducha Myadukha

directions:
1. Prepare omelette mixture from eggs and milk, add the flour and mix finely.
  2. Warm up butter in the skillet, pour in the omelette mixture and bake in oven for 5 – 7 minutes.
  3. Take out the omelette from the oven, place it on a board, cover with a layer of fried potatoes seasoned with greens, salt and raw eggs.
  4. Then shape the omelette into a roll, transfer to a griddle, dust with grated cheese, sprinkle with butter and place in oven for 2–3 minutes.
  5. Cut the roll into pieces, 1.5 to 2 cm thick, pour over with butter and dust with minced greens.
title: Egg Roll with Potatoes

directions:
1. Boil, peel and shred the beetroots.
  2. Peel and shred the onion.
  3. Peel and chop fine the egg.
  4. Mix the ingredients thoroughly and season with sour cream or mayonnaise.
  5. Heap the salad in a dish and decorate.
title: Country Salad

directions:
1. Cut the tomatoes into rings.
  2. Peel and chop fine the garlic cloves.
  3. Sprinkle the tomato rings with minced garlic, salt and pepper.
  4. Shred the cheese and place over the tomatoes, season with mayonnaise and greens.
title: Tomato Salad with Cheese

directions:
1. Dress the fish, heat the fillet over slow fire, add the bay leaf, pepper and onion, then cool it and slice.
  2. Boil hard the egg.
  3. Slice the boiled beetroots and cheese, shred the onion.
  4. Add the salt and mix the ingredients.
  5. Season the salad with mayonnaise and heap in a salad bowl.
  6. Decorate with beetroot slices, minced egg and greens.
title: Barysauski Salad

directions:
1. Heat water in saucepan. While water is being heated, mix half of the cornmeal with milk in jug until it forms a smooth paste. You will need to mix vigorously.
  2. Carefully add the mixture to the boiling water and stir. Gradually add the remaining cornmeal and allow to cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, stirring constantly. Mixture will get heavier and form a mash.
  3. Remove it from saucepan and put into large bowl. You may shape it into a large ball by hand before serving. Make sure hands are slightly wet so that the mixture does not stick to them.
  4. Serve with meat or stew.
title: Cornmeal Porridge II

directions: 1. Drop unpeeled plantains in boiling water. Cook for 15 – 20 minutes until a test plantain is tender when pierced with a fork. Peel before serving.
title: Boiled Plantain II

directions:
1. Wash the intestines, scrape them, turn inside out, wash a few more times, rub with salt and wash again. Then cut in small pieces.
  2. Cut the heart, liver, lungs and kidneys (washed and with fatty insides removed) the same way. Set everything to boil with a finely chopped Onion, salt, pepper and water.
  3. When it comes to a boil, remove foam and add the rice which was slightly fried in lard. After a few minutes of boiling, put in the oven to bake until the rice is done.
title: Bulgarian Pilaf with Lamb Organs

directions:
1. Fry the lamb pieces in butter.
  2. When golden brown, add a few tablespoons of water and simmer, covered, until the meat is almost done (if necessary, add some more water).
  3. Make a paste from yogurt and flour, adding the yogurt a little at a time and stirring.
  4. Pour this paste over the lamb pieces.
  5. Add the dill and salt and let simmer a little longer until the meat is done.
  6. Serve with polenta.
title: Lamb in Yogurt Sauce

directions:
1. Cut the meat in pieces and fry with a tablespoon of lard.
  2. When golden brown, add finely chopped onion, water and salt.
  3. Cover the pan and let simmer for 5 minutes.
  4. In the meantime, slightly fry the rice with a tablespoon of lard.
  5. Place over the meat, add chopped dill and cover with a lid that was covered in a soaked and squeezed cloth.
  6. Bake in the oven until the rice is cooked.
title: Lamb Pilaf

directions:
1. Cut the meat and set in a pan adding water to cover.
  2. Add one whole onion and salt.
  3. Remove foam and simmer until done.
  4. Throw away the onion.
  5. Separately, slightly fry the flour in lard.
  6. Add the meat boiling liquid, stirring quickly and then pour over the meat pieces.
  7. Let boil for a few minutes longer.
  8. The stew is tastier if you add a cup of milk to the sauce.
title: Lamb White Sauce Stew

directions:
1. Fry the lamb pieces in lard until yellow.
  2. Add the finely chopped onion and flour.
  3. When the onion starts to turn yellow, add 3 – 4 tablespoons of water, juice from 4 – 5 tomatoes, salt and tarragon.
  4. The quantity of tarragon is to taste.
  5. Cover and simmer.
  6. When the meat is almost done, set into the oven for 15 – 20 minutes.
  7. You may prepare this with raw onion.
  8. In this case, add it with the water.
title: Lamb with Tarragon

directions:
1. Cut the meat and set in a pan adding water to cover.
  2. Add one whole onion and salt.
  3. Remove foam and simmer until done.
  4. Throw away the onion.
  5. Separately, slightly fry the flour in lard.
  6. Add the meat boiling liquid, stirring quickly and then pour over the meat pieces.
  7. The stew is tastier if you add a cup of milk to the sauce.
title: Chicken White Sauce Stew

directions:
1. Cut the eggplants in quarters, lengthwise, and then halve each quarter.
  2. Salt and let sit for at least a half hour.
  3. Then slightly squeeze each piece, dredge with flour and fry in oil.
  4. Sauté the chicken pieces, covered, in a tablespoon of oil.
  5. Add the grated onion and 2 – 3 tablespoons of water.
  6. Arrange the eggplant pieces over the chicken, add the parsley, cover and let boil, at low heat, for 10 – 15 minutes.
  7. Then move the pan to the oven and let it bake until ready.
title: Chicken with Eggplant

directions:
1. Fry the chicken pieces in lard until yellow.
  2. Add the finely chopped onion and flour.
  3. When the onion starts to turn yellow, add 3 – 4 tablespoons of water, juice from 4 – 5 tomatoes, salt and tarragon.
  4. The quantity of tarragon is to taste.
  5. Cover and simmer.
  6. When the meat is almost done, set into the oven for 15 – 20 minutes.
  7. You may prepare this with raw onion.
  8. In this case, add it with the water.
title: Chicken with Tarragon

directions:
1. Cut the meat and set in a pan adding water to cover.
  2. Add one whole onion and salt.
  3. Remove foam and simmer until done.
  4. Throw away the onion.
  5. Separately, slightly fry the flour in lard.
  6. Add the meat boiling liquid, stirring quickly and then pour over the meat pieces.
  7. The stew is tastier if you add a cup of milk to the sauce.
title: Hen White Sauce Stew

directions:
1. Cut the eggplants in quarters, lengthwise, and then halve each quarter.
  2. Salt and let sit for at least a half hour.
  3. Then slightly squeeze each piece, dredge with flour and fry in oil.
  4. Sauté the hen pieces, covered, in a tablespoon of oil.
  5. Add the grated onion and 2 – 3 tablespoons of water.
  6. Arrange the eggplant pieces over the hen, add the parsley, cover and let boil, at low heat, for until tender.
  7. Then move the pan to the oven and let it bake until ready.
title: Hen with Eggplant

directions:
1. Fry the hen pieces in lard until yellow.
  2. Add the finely chopped onion and flour.
  3. When the onion starts to turn yellow, add 3 – 4 tablespoons of water, juice from 4 – 5 tomatoes, salt and tarragon.
  4. The quantity of tarragon is to taste.
  5. Cover and simmer.
  6. When the meat is almost done, set into the oven at least 20 minutes, until tender.
  7. You may prepare this with raw onion.
  8. In this case, add it with the water.
title: Hen with Tarragon

directions:
1. Skin the bologna slices and fry them on both sides in hot lard.
  2. Serve with boiled or fried potatoes.
  3. Pour the lard used for frying the bologna over the potatoes.
title: Fried Bologna

directions:
1. Rub the entire piece of meat with salt and then, after making some slits in the meat, place garlic cloves and pieces of bacon in them.
  2. Fry the meat on all sides in hot lard, add broth or water, pepper, cover and let boil, at slow temperature until the liquid is gone and the meat is tender.
  3. If necessary, while it boils add some more warm broth or water.
  4. Slice the meat in one inch thick slices, place on a platter and serve with mashed potatoes, vegetable saute, lettuce or pickles.
title: Smothered Roast Beef I

directions:
1. Use the cleaver to cut the backbones, salt and place the whole meat piece in the roasting pan that was greased with a little lard.
  2. Add 2-3 tablespoons of water. Leave in the oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, basting every now and then with the liquid in the pan.
  3. When ready, slice and serve with French fries or mashed potatoes or sauted cabbage.
  4. It may also be served cold, sliced thinly.
title: Refried -Beans

directions:
1. Pound the chops with the pounder, salt, pepper, dredge with the beaten egg, then flour, then egg and finally breadcrumbs.
  2. Fry in hot lard, at low heat.
  3. Serve with French fries, with some salad or pickles.
title: Breaded Pork Chops

directions:
1. Wash and dry the meat, salt and let sit for a half hour.
  2. Grease a roasting pan with lard, arrange the meat in, pour 2 - 3 tablespoons of water and place in the oven, first at low temperature, then increase the heat.
  3. When it is roasted, place on a platter.
  4. Pour a few tablespoons of water in the roasting pan, add a few chopped garlic cloves and set it on top of the range where it should be allowed to come to a boil.
  5. Strain the liquid and pour it over the roast.
  6. Serve with French fries and salad to taste.
title: Lamb Roast

directions:
1. Wash and remove excess fat.
  2. Debone the meat.
  3. Rub it with salt and let sit for 30 minutes.
  4. Then interlard with pieces of bacon and garlic cloves.
  5. Roll the meat and tie with string.
  6. Place in the roasting pan which was greased with lard, add 2 – 3 tablespoons of water, a tablespoon of lard, wine or vinegar and set in the oven at high heat until it starts to brown.
  7. Then reduce heat to medium.
  8. Every now and then, baste with the liquid in the pan.
  9. When the meat is cooked, take out of the pan, remove the strings and cut into medium thick slices.
  10. Add 2 – 3 tablespoons of water to the sauce in the pan, let boil for a couple of minutes and then pour over the meat.
  11. Serve with mashed potatoes and sautéed carrots.
  12. This roast is also excellent cold.
title: Baked Mutton Leg

directions:
1. Salt the chicken, let sit for 15 – 20 minutes, then place in the roasting pan, add the lard and 2 – 3 tablespoons water and set in the oven.
  2. During roasting, baste with the pan drippings.
  3. Serve with French fries and green lettuce or cucumber salad.
title: Romanian Baked Chicken

directions:
1. Section the chicken, salt.
  2. Lightly pound with the wooden hammer, salt and pepper.
  3. Dredge each chicken piece with the eggs beaten with a teaspoon of oil, flour.
  4. Fry on both sides in hot lard.
  5. Serve with French fries, sautéed vegetables or a salad.
title: Breaded Chicken

directions:
1. Salt the chicken and place in a pan with melted lard.
  2. Fry on all sides, add 4 – 5 tablespoons of water or chicken broth, cover and simmer.
  3. Occasionally turn the chicken and if the liquid is too reduced, add 1 – 2 tablespoons of water.
  4. At the end, you may add a little crushed garlic.
  5. Serve with french fries and green lettuce or cucumber salad.
title: Smothered Chicken

directions:
1. Clean, wash and salt the duck.
  2. Introduce 2 smallish apples in its cavity.
  3. Place in the roasting pan with a tablespoon of lard and a few tablespoons of water.
  4. Set in the oven at high temperature and keep basting with the pan drippings.
  5. When the duck starts to brown, place the washed and dried apples around it and reduce the heat.
  6. As they bake, remove the apples from the pan, letting the duck in until done.
  7. When it is done, remove from the pan, slice, arrange on a platter with the apples around the meat.
  8. Put two tablespoons of water in the pan and let boil on top of the range.
  9. Stir.
  10. Strain this sauce and pour over the meat.
title: Duck Roast with Baked Apples

directions:
1. Clean, wash and salt the goose.
  2. Place in the roasting pan with a tablespoon of lard and a few tablespoons of water.
  3. Set in the oven at low temperature.
  4. At the beginning, keep the heat low and then increase it and keep basting with the pan drippings.
  5. Roast for 1½ hours.
  6. When the goose starts to brown, reduce the heat.
  7. When it is done, serve either with baked apples like the Duck Roast with Baked Apples|duck, or with French fries and a salad, pickles or sautéed cabbage.
title: Goose Roast

directions:
1. Salt the hen, let sit for 15 – 20 minutes, then place in the roasting pan, add the lard and 2 – 3 tablespoons water and set in the oven.
  2. During roasting, baste with the pan drippings.
  3. Serve with French fries and green lettuce or cucumber salad.
title: Hen Roast

directions:
1. Salt the hen and place in a pan with melted lard.
  2. Fry on all sides, add 4 – 5 tablespoons of water or chicken broth, cover and simmer.
  3. Occasionally turn the hen and if the liquid is too reduced, add 1 – 2 tablespoons of water.
  4. At the end, you may add a little crushed garlic.
  5. Serve with french fries and green lettuce or cucumber salad.
title: Smothered Hen

directions:
1. Wash and salt the partridges.
  2. Put in a bowl, cover and let sit for 15 – 20 minutes.
  3. Then fry with the butter or lard, add wine, cover and simmer until done.
  4. Occasionally turn them and add a tablespoon of wine.
title: Partridge Roast

directions:
1. Wash and salt the partridges.
  2. Let them sit until you prepare the following stuffing.
  3. Chop the gizzards and saute in a tablespoon of lard, with the finely chopped onion.
  4. Remove from heat, add the cubed bacon, bread, salt, pepper, parsley and mix everything well with an egg.
  5. Stuff the partridges with this stuffing and then fry in a pan with a tablespoon of butter, until golden-brown.
  6. Add 2 – 3 tablespoons of water, cover and simmer at low heat until done.
  7. Keep turning them and add a little water from time to time, as needed.
title: Stuffed Partridges

directions:
1. Remove feathers, singe, wash several times and keep in cold water for half an hour.
  2. Then remove, dry, rub with some salt and interlard the breast and legs with pieces of bacon.
  3. Then let sit for 20 – 30 minutes.
  4. Set in a roasting pan with 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 – 3 tablespoons of water.
  5. Turn several times while roasting, basting with the liquid in the pan.
  6. Serve with fried small whole potatoes, sautéed cauliflower or baked small apples.
title: Pheasant Roast

directions:
1. Place a tablespoon of lard in a Dutch oven and let it get hot.
  2. Place the previously salted quails inside and cover.
  3. Turn the quails every 2 – 3 minutes.
  4. After they are golden brown, add 2 tablespoons of water and simmer at very low heat, for 10 – 15 minutes.
  5. When ready, pour a little melted butter or lard over them.
  6. Serve hot.
title: Fried Quails Hunter-style

directions:
1. Wash the quails, salt and wrap with thin slices of fresh bacon.
  2. Place in a pan, add a teaspoon of lard and the wine and roast, at medium heat, turning them a few times and basting with the pan drippings.
title: Roasted Quails

directions:
1. After taking the meat out of the marinade, wash with cold water, rub with salt and let sit for approximately 1 hour.
  2. Then dry and interlard with pieces of bacon and garlic cloves.
  3. Grease a pan with lard, set the meat inside, pour ½ cup water, add a little salt and a tablespoon of vinegar or better yet ½ cup wine.
  4. Place 1 tablespoon lard over the meat and roast at medium heat, taking care to baste every 10 – 15 minutes with the pan drippings.
  5. When ready, slice, arrange on the platter and pour the pan dripping over the meat.
  6. If there is too little sauce, after the meat is removed, add 2 tablespoons of water and let come to a boil on top of the range.
  7. The sauce may be served separately in a gravy boat.
  8. Serve the meat with beet salad.
title: Roast Rabbit

directions:
1. Keep the wild goose in the marinade at least 12 hours.
  2. Then wash, dry, salt, interlard with pieces of bacon and set in a pan with lard.
  3. Fry on all sides, add 2 – 3 tablespoons of wine and let simmer, covered, for 45 minutes.
  4. Add 1 tablespoon of wine every now and then and turn the roast.
  5. Then set the roast into the oven, uncovered, until done.
  6. Serve with beet or red cabbage salad.
title: Wild Goose Roast

directions: 1. Prepare the same way as Vanilla Cream I|Vanilla Cream, adding 2 tablespoons of grated chocolate or cacao at the same time with the vanilla and milk.
title: Chocolate Cream

directions:
1. Into a saucepan of boiling milk, add the peel and juice of ½ big lemon, cover with a lid and let it sit on the table for 15 minutes.
  2. Whisk the eggs with sugar and flour and pour in the milk little by little, mixing constantly with a spoon.
  3. Place on medium heat and continue stirring to prevent sticking and the formation of lumps remove from heat and beat some time.
  4. If the cream curdles, pour the mixture into a cold bowl, add a cold cream and beat until the lumps disappear.
title: Romanian Lemon Cream
Spring Rolls With Pork and Shrimp - Cantonese

directions:
1. Wrap a piece of bacon around a scallops|scallop and secure with a tooth pick.
  2. Place the wrapped scallops on a baking sheet and broil for about 10 minutes per side or until bacon is fully cooked.
title: Scallops wrapped in Bacon

directions:
1. Spray a 10" skillet with cooking spray.
  2. Place over med heat and add the vegetables.
  3. Cook, stirring, until crisp tender-about 5 minutes.
  4. Meanwhile whisk together the eggs, milk, parsley, salt and pepper.
  5. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet over the vegetables.
  6. Sprinkle with the cheese.
  7. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook about 10 minutes until the center is set.
  8. Remove from the heat, cut into wedges and serve immediately.
title: Eggplant Rollups

directions:
1. Heat the oil in a heavy saucepan.
  2. Slice the peeled plantains into ¼-inch rounds.
  3. Fry the slices a few at a time until they are golden and crisp on the outside but still soft on the inside.
  4. If fried too long, the inside will toughen, so try a couple to get the best timing.
  5. Remove them from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels or newspaper.
title: Sierra Leonean Fried Plantains

directions:
1. Peel potatoes and boil in salted water until soft ( 30 mins - 40 mins )
  2. Drain and mash potatoes, add can of cream style corn and 1/2 of the Cheese, season with salt and black pepper- mix well
  3. butter ovenproof dish and place mixture into the dish
  4. top with remaining Cheese and bake in preheated oven for about 1/2 hour , or until golden brown on top.
title: Potato-Corn Pie

directions:
1. Sauté onion in oil until soft
  2. Add rice, salt, saffron and water( or stock)
  3. Bring to the boil, then reduce heat to simmering, cover pot tightly with lid and boil rice for about 20 mins. undisturbed
title: Saffron Rice

directions:
1. Chop lamb heart and lungs finely and combine with finely chopped onion, pepper, salt and rice.
  2. Stuff lamb bowels with the mincemeat and pour in some water (150 g).
  3. Tie the bowels and put in boiling water, cook for 50–60 minutes, having pierced the bowels with a fork during the cooking.
title: Assip

directions:
1. Slice lamb (with bones), rub with salt and pepper and put in a pan with fat.
  2. Fry until light brown.
  3. Then add sliced onion, tomatoes to the meat and pour in water.
  4. Bring to boil and cook for 10 minutes.
title: Shorpo

directions:
1. Mix flour, water, egg and salt in a bowl to make dough.
  2. Knead and set aside.
  3. Boil potatoes.
  4. Mash potatoes and add some of the onions.
  5. Roll dough on cutting board.
  6. Take small ball of dough and roll out to form small circle - about the size that fits will in your palm.
  7. Put small spoonful of potato mixture in the center of the circle - press sides together around potato.
  8. Drop each vereniki into boiling water for 7 to 10 minutes.
  9. Drain water and serve vereniki with sautéed onions and melted butter.
title: Potato Vereniki

directions:
1. Wash and soak the rice.
  2. Heat the oil in a kazan (large, heavy pot) until hot; add the meat, cooking until brown on all sides.
  3. Add the carrots, onions, and peppers, and cook until tender.
  4. Add 5 cups of water and then all the rice so that the water covers the rice completely.
  5. Push the cloves of garlic under the surface of the rice.
  6. Cover and lower the heat a little.
  7. Cover and cook until rice is done, about 30 minutes.
  8. There are many variations of plov so feel free to experiment with raisins, dried apricots or other vegetables.
title: Plov (Osh-style)

directions:
1. Begin by cleaning the vegetables and putting them all into a steam pot filled with cold water.
  2. You should cut all the vegetables into cubes, or another shape if you prefer, apart from the onions, which you should leave whole (together with the skin).
  3. As well as the vegetables you put the beef on the bone into the pot, together with all the spices (i.e. The salt and the pepper|black peppercorns).
  4. Then let it cook on the highest temperature.
  5. When the steam pot starts hissing, switch to the middle heat and let it cook for a further three quarters of an hour.
  6. Then put it aside and wait until the pressure in the steam pot falls down.
  7. The soup is served with thin noodles, and can also be decorated with fresh parsley leaves.
title: Hovadzia Polievka

directions:
1. Put in pot with water to cover
  2. Add teasp salt, cook till boiling
  3. Cook 10-15 minutes pour off water
  4. Let cool cut up very finely
  5. Add new water, boil again for 2 1/2 hours
  6. add chopped Onion & celery, salt & pepper.
  7. When tender make basic cream sauce with milk & flour & butter till thick
  8. Serve poured over mashed potatoes or toast.
title: Creamed Gizzards

directions:
1. The by-products of the pig are used to make different dishes.
  2. One such traditional meal, Zabijacka (meaning 'killing') is eaten on the day that the pig is slaughtered, symbolizing that the pig is of good quality.
title: Zabijacka

directions:
1. Melt ½ lb butter in pot fry 2 chopped onions.
  2. Add 1 small head of cabbage chopped.
  3. Fry till browned add salt and pepper and garlic powder.
  4. Make a double batch of noodles mix into fried cabbage cook on low till hot.
title: Haluski Kapusta

directions:
1. Put into blender
  2. Process till ground up finely
  3. You can add vinegar but the prepared horseradish usually has enough
  4. Put into clean jar
  5. Let set in frig for a week before using.
title: Chren

directions:
1. Place in large flat bowl with cooking liquid.
  2. Add 2 tbsp vinegar, salt and pepper.
  3. 1 onion thinly sliced.
  4. Mix together let set in frig a few hours (can be made ahead and put in canning jar)
  5. Use within a week.
title: Pickled Beets

directions:
1. Mix together adding water or flour to make nice firm dough.
  2. If using machine to roll roll to hand roll out, not too thin.
  3. Cut into circles.
  4. Place 1 teaspoon - 1 tbsp filling into center.
  5. Wet edges with water.
  6. Fold over pinch or fold and pinch or use fork to make nice edge.
  7. Place on well floured wax paper.
  8. Let dry 2 hours.
  9. Cook in boiling water.
  10. Serve with melted butter and fried onion.
title: Piroghis

directions:
1. Mix above together well
  2. Make a well in center
  3. In bowl mix 2 yeast cakes to 1/2 cup water stir cover wait 10 minutes
  4. Then mix in 2 eggs, 1 cup evaporated milk
  5. Gradually pour into well of flour mixture, knead together
  6. Put into greased bowl cover put in frig for 1 hr or overnight roll out in Granulated sugar|Sugar / use any good filling bake 350 F for 20 minutes
  7. For filling suggestions see my Grammy's bread dough page.
title: Kalacha Dough

directions:
1. Wash Mushrooms well and cut up small. Cook in 2 qts. of water for 1/2 hour, then add sauerkraut and cook for another 15 minutes. Melt in saucepan 2 tablespoons shortening, add flour, brown lightly and stir constantly while you pour in your milk and cook until smooth. Add to the Mushrooms and sauerkraut. Fry Onion in the tablespoon of butter, when lightly brown pour into soup. Cook altogether for a minute and salt to taste. Sprinkle paprika over all.
  2. Makes 6 servings.
title: Slovak Christmas Soup

directions:
1. Set the water to boil with the butter.
  2. When it starts bubbling, immediately remove from heat and quickly add the flour, then the 8 eggs one by one and vanilla, all without stopping the stirring.
  3. Let cool and then either with your hands or a teaspoon, shape into balls and place them on a baking sheet leaving lots of distance among them.
  4. Bake for 15-20 minutes.
title: Round Biscuits

directions:
1. Knead a dough from the cream, flour, butter and salt.
  2. Roll into a sheet and cut according to your need:
  3. you can make small crescents filled with rahat-lokum, marmalade or preserves; so, replace the salt with a little granulated sugar|sugar;
  4. you can make biscuits, spread with marmalade or stuck two by two; in this case, replace the salt with a little granulated sugar|sugar;
  5. you can make small tartlets to be filled with Peas, carrots, spinach sautés, beef salad, etc.
title: Dough for Various Uses

directions:
1. Knead a medium stiff dough out of 7 oz / 200 g flour, 1 yolk, lemon juice, salt and water.
  2. Gather it into a ball and cover.
  3. In the meantime, mix 8 oz / 250 g butter or margarine with 4 oz / 100 g flour, knead quickly and set aside.
  4. Roll the dough with water into a pencil thin sheet.
  5. Lay the flattened, square butter dough in the middle of the water dough.
  6. The butter dough should be three times smaller than the water dough.
  7. Cover the small square with the larger one, envelope style, and place the dough on a plate.
  8. Refrigerate for 45 minutes.
  9. Sprinkle the pastry board with flour and then roll the dough into a squarish sheet.
  10. Fold three times lengthwise and three times crosswise.
  11. Refrigerate for 20 – 30 minutes.
  12. Repeat this procedure four times.
  13. Finally, roll into a square, cut into 4 finger thick strips and then cut each strip into squares.
  14. Place the desired filling (cheese, meat, etc.) in one corner and cover with the opposite corner.
  15. Bake at high heat.
title: French Dough I

directions:
1. Make a dough out of 8 oz / 250 g flour and the cubed butter.
  2. Knead quickly with a wooden spoon and roll into a slightly less than 1 inch thick square.
  3. Place on a floured plate and refrigerate.
  4. Prepare a dough from the remaining 8 oz / 250 g flour, water, lemon juice and salt, kneading well with your hands.
  5. Gather into a ball, cover and let rest for 20 – 30 minutes.
  6. Then roll this second dough into a sheet that is twice as wide and slightly longer than the sheet made from the butter dough.
  7. Place the butter dough sheet in the middle of the water dough sheet.
  8. Then cover the butter sheet with the corners of the water sheet, envelope style.
  9. Press down on the edges.
  10. Sprinkle flour on the pastry board, roll the dough into a ½ inch thick sheet, fold fourfold and refrigerate for 30 – 40 minutes.
  11. Repeat this folding-refrigerating procedure three times.
  12. Then roll into a ½ inch thick sheet and cut either into circles or squares.
  13. Put the desired filling (cheese, meat, etc.) in the middle of the dough pieces, wash with egg and bake for 10 – 15 minutes.
title: French Dough II

directions:
1. Set the honey to boil with the grated chocolate; when it starts boiling, add walnuts, stirring continuously.
  2. Let boil for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool a little.
  3. When you can touch it without discomfort, put the mixture on a cacao dusted board.
  4. With your hands, shape into a thick Sausage.
  5. Roll it into the cacao powder and let cool.
  6. When it is cold, cut slices with a very sharp knife. Arrange on a platter.
title: Mazurka Salami-style

directions:
1. Wash the oranges and lemon.
  2. Slice each fruit in 16 sections lengthwise and then halve each section.
  3. You will now have 32 pieces of each fruit.
  4. Weigh the fruit and add three times as much water.
  5. Leave them like this for 24 hours.
  6. Then set to boil and keep on heat for 1 hour since the moment it starts boiling.
  7. Remove from heat and add the lemon juice, refrigerating for another 24 hours.
  8. Weigh the oranges again together with the water they boiled in and add as much granulated sugar|sugar.
  9. The granulated sugar|sugar should be added after the oranges and water have been heated.
  10. Boil for 40 – 50 minutes.
  11. Pour in warmed jars while still warm.
  12. Tie the jars with cellophane after the marmelade is cold.
title: Orange Marmelade

directions:
1. Boil potatoes in their skins.
  2. Peel potatoes and force the pulp through a sieve.
  3. Let it cool.
  4. Mix into the sieved pulp the eggs butter parsley and salt and pepper to taste.
  5. butter small tartlet shell or barquettes or any little molds and fill them with the potato mixture.
  6. Bake them in a 375°F oven for 10 minutes.
  7. Turn out of the molds to serve.
  8. These make an excellent garnish for a roast.
title: Burgonyakereg

directions:
1. Mix the flour, eggs and salt together.
  2. Knead to make a stiff dough.
  3. You may add a little water if the dough is too stiff.
  4. Grate on the medium side of a grater.
  5. Rivilchas or tarhonya should be the size of dried peas.
