  6. Let the tarhonya dry for ½ hour and then add to boiling water ½ cup at a time and cook till done.
  7. Drain and serve in hot beef soup, hot chicken soup or tomato soup.
title: Rivilchas or Tarhonya for Soup

directions:
1. In a small mixing bowl mix eggs with the water and salt.
  2. Beat well.
  3. Put the flour in a large mixing bowl and add the egg mixture a little at a time.
  4. Blend the dough with your hands in a rubbing motion as though you were washing your hands with the palms open.
  5. The mix should become uneven little pieces of dough the size of dried peas.
  6. Break up any that look large.
  7. The mix should be somewhat uniform.
  8. Spread out a tablecloth on a table and spread the tarhonya on it in a thin layer so that all the pieces are exposed to the air.
  9. Let dry until very hard, this will take 3 or 4 days.
  10. While the mix is drying, roll your fingers through to mix it up so all sides are exposed to air.
  11. When you are sure that the mix has dried hard, store in a container.
title: Bulk Dried Tarhonya

directions:
1. Put flour, salt, and cream of wheat into a bowl.
  2. Make a well in the middle and add the eggs, water and butter.
  3. Stir until batter is smooth and thick.
  4. Cut the batter by teaspoon full into a big pot of boiling salted water.
  5. Dip the spoon into the hot water each time to keep the batter from sticking to the spoon.
  6. Cook only half the batter at a time to avoid crowding.
  7. Stir the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon so that the dumplings will rise to the top.
  8. After the dumplings rise, let them cook for 2 minutes.
  9. Remove from the water and drain.
  10. Serve warm.
title: Spaetzle or Little Dumplings

directions:
1. Sear all sides of roast in a hot roasting pan over high heat.
  2. Do not add any fat.
  3. Put all the chopped onions and 2 tbsp of granulated sugar|sugar into roasting pan with meat and cover.
  4. Place in a medium heat 325°F degree oven and slowly roast for about 1½ to 2 hours.
  5. Check the roast periodically to turn it over and push the onions around.
  6. The onions should be taking on a rich brown color.
title: Pork Roast with Onion Gravy

directions:
1. But a pot of water on to boil.
  2. Mix the soft butter, salt and the 4 eggs well.
  3. Add farina ¼ cup at a time till you have a dumpling dough consistency. Thick, not runny.
  4. Then add a little water for moisture.
  5. When the water boils, cut the dumplings into the water with a tablespoon.
  6. When they come to the top, cook about 5 minutes more.
  7. Drain and arrange on meat platter.
  8. Keep warm.
title: Farina Dumplings

directions:
1. Cook a whole head of cauliflower in a pot of salted water till tender.
  2. Drain and place whole head on a serving dish.
  3. In a saute pan melt ¼ lb butter and medium brown 1 cup of bread crumbs, season with ⅛ tsp. salt. Stir and toss crumbs.
  4. Do not let it burn or it will be bitter.
  5. Spoon butter and crumb mixture over the top of cauliflower and serve.
title: Hungarian-style Cauliflower

directions:
1. Melt in a small saucepan over low heat 2 tbsp butter with 1 finely chopped fresh garlic clove.
  2. Saute garlic in butter a minute or so.
  3. Do not let garlic burn or it will be bitter.
  4. Blend in 2 tablespoons flour to make a roux.
  5. Add ¼ tsp salt, ⅛ tsp pepper and heat until mixture bubbles, stirring constantly.
  6. Remove from heat.
  7. Add gradually ¾ cup of cream or milk.
  8. Return to heat and stir until mixture is smooth and thickened.
  9. Blend well drained spinach into sauce and serve.
title: Hungarian-style Spinach

directions:
1. Soak neck bones in salt the day before, then rinse well.
  2. If using Beef do not soak it in salt over night.
  3. Then cook meats and split Peas together for about an hour or when meat is done.
  4. When meat is tender put in the Funcho chopped up very small and dices potatoes and cook for about another hour.
title: Sopa de funcho or Anise soup

directions:
1. Brown the Pork with salt and pepper.
  2. Add Onion.
  3. Cook until Pork is brown.
  4. Add the tomato sauce cook for 10 minutes.
  5. Add the water if it dries out to much.
  6. Now add the Peas and boil until they are tender.
  7. Stir constantly to prevent burning.
  8. Remove from burner and serve hot over steamed rice.
title: Pork Stew and Peas

directions:
1. Mix together the grated cassava, onion and herbs.
  2. Lightly beat the egg.
  3. Add to the cassava mixture and mix well to form a smooth mixture.
  4. Form mixture into small balls.
  5. Lightly fry the cassava balls in cooking oil until golden brown.
title: Cassava Balls

directions:
1. Combine all ingredients except the eggs and lettuce, being careful not to break the fish into too small pieces.
  2. Serve on lettuce leaves.
  3. Garnish with sliced eggs.
title: Fijian Fish Salad

directions:
1. Clean cabbage of outer leaves, root and thick stems. Cut into thick strips, soak in salted water for a while and drain. Wash meat and cut into portions, salt and pepper and drain.
  2. Heat butter in a saucepan and put in meat and onions to sauté.
  3. Dilute tomato paste in a little water and put in pan.
  4. Add water to cover meat and simmer. Just before meat is done, put cabbage in pan with a little salt, putting meat to one side of same pan.
  5. Add more water if needed to cover food and complete cooking making sure food is left in only its own juices without excess liquid.
title: Cyprian Pork with Cabbage

directions:
1. In a large pot, combine equal amount dried corn and beans. Add enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil and cook over high heat for ten minutes.
  2. Reduce heat.
  3. Cover and simmer for two hours or until corn and beans are tender.
  4. In the finished dish, most of the water should be absorbed, and the corn and beans should be tender yet still intact, not mushy. Season with salt, oil, or fat.
title: Kenyan Githeri

directions:
1. Sift flour and salt into a bowl.
  2. Add enough water to make a fairly stiff dough.
  3. Knead well.
  4. Roll out on a floured board into a fairly thick circle.
  5. Brush with oil.
  6. From the centre of the circle, make a cut to one edge.
  7. Roll up dough into a cone, press both ends in, and make a ball again. Repeat that process 2-3 more times.
  8. Divide dough into 4 or 5 balls, and roll each out into a thin circle. Heat a frying pan over moderate heat and dry out each chapati in the pan quickly. Brush pan with oil and fry chapati slowly until golden brown on each side. Serve hot or cold with stew or sauce.
title: Kenyan Chapati

directions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl.
  2. Toss to coat all ingredients with liquid.
  3. Set aside in a cool place for twenty to thirty minutes before serving.
  4. Consume within twelve hours.
title: Jenyan Kachumbari

directions:
1. Cover the grated coconut with boiling water and squeeze out the first creamy thick milk.
  2. Put this aside.
  3. Add more hot water and squeeze again to obtain a thinner milk.
  4. Wash the rice three times in cold water.
  5. Put the thinner coconut milk in a saucepan with a little salt and let it nearly come to the boil.
  6. Add the washed rice and stir carefully.
  7. Keep stirring so as not to burn.
  8. Add the creamy thick coconut milk and continue stirring.
  9. The heat must be moderate.
  10. Cover the rice with greaseproof paper, put on the pan lid and a heavy weight to seal, and steam for about 25 minutes on a very low heat until ready to serve.
  11. Coconut rice can be served with chicken or or on its own with vegetables, or curry.
title: Wali wa Nazi I

directions:
1. Mix all ingredients together; divide into fourths.
  2. Roll each into a circle; spread thinly with melted butter.
  3. Roll up like a small jellyroll and then roll it into a coil.
  4. Roll flat again. Fry in a hot heavy skillet until brown on both sides.
  5. They do not brown very well in a Teflon coated pan.
title: Chapatis II

directions:
1. Bring water to a boil in large saucepan.
  2. Stir boiling water as you sprinkle in maizemeal.
  3. Cook for 20 minutes or until it is very thick and smooth, stirring constantly to prevent burning. #Cover saucepan and continue cooking 10 more minutes over very low heat. Serves 6.
title: Ugali II

directions:
1. Cut Haloumi|Halloumi into 1 cm (1/2") slices. Cut tomatoes in to 1 cm (1/2") slices.
  2. Arrange a piece of Haloumi|Halloumi on a plate followed by a slice of tomato and a basil leaf.
  3. Repeat until you cover the whole plate in a circle. Drizzle over olive oil and season to taste.
title: HALLOUMI AND TOMATO SALAD

directions:
1. Boil Eggplant in skin until tender.
  2. Skin, then crush to a pulp with butter, salt, pepper, onions, and ketchup.
  3. Sprinkle with bread crumbs.
  4. Bake in a moderate oven until brown.
title: Baked Eggplant

directions:
1. Mix seasoning with breadfruit.
  2. Add egg and milk.
  3. Stir in margarine.
  4. Place in a greased pan. Put in moderate oven. Bake until brown.
title: Breadfruit Pudding

directions:
1. Grate the cheese, then mix the cumin seeds and pepper powder with the cheese.
  2. In a bowl put the flour and margarine and prepare dough, using the ice water to mix.
  3. Make the dough into 15-20 balls, then roll the balls into rounds.
  4. Onto the circle sprinkle the grated cheese and roll it.
  5. Bake the rolls in an oven for 20 minutes at 275°F.
  6. Take the cheese rolls from the oven and apply the beaten egg on top of the rolls and resume baking until finished.
title: Cheese Rolls

directions:
1. Peel the cassava with a sharp paring knife or vegetable peeler.
  2. Finely grate the cassava. Place the cassava into a bowl lined with a double-thickness of dampened cheese cloth.
  3. Bring the ends of the Cheese cloth together to enclose the pulp, and wring the cloth vigorously to extract the cassava juice into the bowl.
  4. Transfer the juice to a heavy skillet. Stirring constantly, cook over moderate heat for about 1 minute, until the cassareep is smooth and thick enough to hold its shape almost solidly in the spoon.
title: Cassareep Guyanese-style

directions:
1. Bring water to a boil.
  2. Place the tamarind pulp in a ovenproof mixing bowl and pour boiling water over it.
  3. Stir in sugar or honey.
  4. Cover and allow to stand several hours or overnight.
  5. Strain the tamarind juice|tamarind water through a strainer or clean cloth.
  6. Add more sugar to taste.
  7. Refrigerate and serve over ice.
title: Tamarind Drink

directions:
1. Bring salted water to the boil in a saucepan.
  2. Add the sweet cassava tuber pieces
  3. Cook until tender
  4. Serve with any main dish: fufu, plantains or boiled rice.
title: Boiled Cassava Tubers

directions:
1. Make a hole on a heap of sieved flour with a hand, add salt, little water and knead.
  2. While kneading sprinkle some flour so that it does not stick to the table or the board.
  3. When dough is ready, leave it for half an hour.
  4. Then make makaruli with special needles.
  5. Leave them to dry.
  6. Boil in salted water till they become tender.
  7. Strain makaruli and serve in a pan, pour olive oil and Cheese from brine on them.
title: Pastrovski makaruli

directions:
1. One kilo of peeled Potato is cooked in salty water.
  2. When the Potato is almost completely cooked, without pouring the water in which it was cooked off, add 3 or 4 handfuls of Wheat or corn|maize flour and continue cooking it.
  3. When you put the flour into the pot, make a hole in the middle of that pile with a tucanj or kacama and cook it for about 30 to 40 minutes in a medium-high heat.
  4. When it is cooked, pour the remaining water off, remove the pot from the heat and start mashing the mixture with a kacama taking the pot back to heat from time to time until the Potato becomes like a paste without any lumps.
  5. In another pot melt 3 or 4 spoons of skorup (cream skimmed from milk) and a crumbled block of Cheese, pour it over the hot kacamak and stir it.
  6. When the mixture is stirred well, kacamak ( the fatty porridge ) is ready to be served.
title: Fatty porridge

directions:
1. Wash peppers, take the stalks out, then put into a wooden vessel and leave for 2–3 days.
  2. Then pour Lamb milk over it (jardum), put some salt and leave for 15–20 days.
  3. Should be served only after that period of time passes.
title: Peppers in jardum

directions:
1. Cook the head, lungs, kidney and tongue of Pork until done.
  2. Save the water it was boiled in.
  3. Remove bones and grind.
  4. Grind and add: 2 cooked cabbages, 4 raw onions, 3 or 4 slices dry bread (soak in water meat was cooked in), 1˝ handful salt, a handful pepper and a small handful herbs.
  5. Add pig's blood (about 3/4 litre) and 3 or 4 cups water meat was cooked in and mix well.
  6. Fill casings with mixture.
  7. Then cook rings of Trèipen in boiling water in open kettle.
  8. Sausages are done when clear juice spurts out when they are punctured with needle.
  9. Hang sausages to cool.
  10. When ready to use, heat well in frying pan or in oven.
title: Trèipen

directions:
1. Sift flour into a large bowl and make a well in the center for the yeast.
  2. Add a tbsp of sugar and a bit of warm milk.
  3. Mix a bit to just get the ingredients together.
  4. Cover and allow to rest for 15 minutes whip one egg with the butter and add to the dough along with the rest of the milk, butter and salt.
  5. Mix well and knead the dough.
  6. Leave to rise for about 20 minutes.
  7. Knead the dough again, then on a floured surface, make little men out of the dough and put them on parchment paper on a baking sheet.
  8. Allow to rise again for 20 minutes.
  9. Brush them with beaten egg then bake them for 20 to 30 minutes in a preheated oven at 180°C to 200°C.
  10. Once baked, the boxemännercher can be iced.
  11. Just dissolve half a cup of powdered sugar in a bit of water and brush onto the little men.
title: Boxemännercher

directions:
1. Combine all in a blender.
  2. Serve chunky, not smooth.
title: Creole Sorbet

directions:
1. Dice Bacon and cook over low heat in a Dutch ovenor other heavy soup kettle until almost all the fat has been rendered. Pour off rendered fat and add corn, water, and Onion. Cook, stirring often, for 10 to 15 minutes.
  2. In a saucepan, melt butter and stir in the flour; when bubbly add the milk, stirring constantly. Cook, continuing to stir, until steaming hot; then add the corn mixture. Mix well and season to taste with salt.
  3. Add parsley on top to garnish.
title: Creamed Corn Soup

directions:
1. Potatoes should always be boiled in their skins, or `jackets', if possible. Never be guilty of paring a new potato before boiling.
  2. Wash and scrub the potatoes well. Put them, with their jackets on, in the boiling water. Let them cook until they are soft enough to be pierced with a fork. Do not let them remain a moment longer, or they will become waxy and watery. Nothing is more disagreeable than a watery potato.
  3. When done, take them off the heat and drain them dry. Put them into a steamer, sprinkle with salt, and let them stand to allow the steam to evaporate. After five minutes, take them out of the steamer and peel quickly. Serve in a covered vegetable dish. Nothing is more unpleasant than to be given a cold potato at the table. Properly cooked, the potato should be dry and flaky and most acceptable.
  4. If the potatoes are old and beginning to sprout, it will be found better to put them on in cold water after paring or peeling, then turn on the stove, and let them cook gradually.
  5. The Creoles use the water in which the potatoes have been boiled for destroying the green flies and insects that infect rose bushes.
title: Boiled Potatoes

directions:
1. Wash fish and squeeze the juice of 1 lemon over the fillets. Sprinkle with salt.
  2. Place margarine and water in a nonreactive skillet over medium-high heat. Add the potatoes, garlic, parsley, chile pepper|hot pepper, salt and juice of 1 lemon. Bring to a boil and cook about 10 minutes or until potatoes are almost done.
  3. Add the fish, top with the onions and celery, immediately reduce heat to simmer, cover and cook fish about 10 minutes or until cooked through. Do not overcook or let water boil.
  4. Makes 4 to 5 servings.
title: Bahamian Boiled Fish

directions:
1. Cut up your cabbage into small pieces.
  2. dice the onions (preferably in long thin pieces).
  3. grade your garlic on a Cheese grader into the crockpot.
  4. fill crockpot 3/4 of the way with water.
  5. cook on high for 3–4 hours.
  6. now add your tomato sauce (and more water, if needed).
  7. add any seasonings you like for flavor.
  8. i use pepper, salt, garlic salt, and Italian seasoning cook on low for 2 more hours or until you have reached your desired consistency.
  9. eat your heart out.
title: Crockpot Cabbage Soup

directions:
1. In a large skillet brown the ground Beef and drain. Using a fork or Potato masher, break Beef into pea size pieces. Use food processor and chop cabbage, add to Beef, add soup, garlic, Onion, salt and pepper, let simmer.
  2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
  3. Use bisquick dough, bread dough or pizza dough for wrap. Separate dough into 6 pieces, roll into 6 inch circles. Spray sheet pan, put dough circles in pan add ½ cup mix and close dough. Repeat and brush dough with olive oil.
  4. Bake 10–15 minutes or until golden brown
title: Californian Cabbage Rolls

directions: 1. Shred carrots, mix with raisins and sprinkle with oil and vinegar. serve on leaves.
title: Carrot and Raisin Salad

directions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl.
  2. Toss to coat all ingredients with liquid.
  3. Set aside in a cool place for twenty to thirty minutes before serving.
  4. Consume within twelve hours.
title: Kachumbaris

directions:
1. Mix the flour with a little cold water to make a paste.
  2. Bring the milk to the boil and bind it with the flour paste.
  3. Leave to boil for a short while and take off the heat.
  4. Add the cubed butter.
  5. Stir and add salt to taste.
  6. Then pour over the cauliflower and sprinkle some nutmeg on top.
title: Bloemkoolsaus

directions:
1. Mix the flour with a little cold water to make a paste.
  2. Bring the water or fish stock to the boil and bind it with the flour paste.
  3. Leave to boil for a short while and take off the heat and add the butter.
  4. Add the parsley.
  5. Stir and add salt to taste.
title: Peterseliesaus

directions:
1. Melt the butter in a clean, smooth pan.
  2. Add the flour and mix the flour and butter to a white mass.
  3. Then add the boiling water or fish stock in small amounts, stirring well and in between bringing the sauce back to the boil.
  4. Then leave to boil for 10 minutes and season with salt.
  5. Take the sauce off the heat and add the lemon juice.
title: Zure Saus

directions:
1. Melt the butter in a clean, smooth pan.
  2. Add the flour and mix the flour and butter to a white mass.
  3. Then add the boiling water or fish stock in small amounts, stirring well and in between bringing the sauce back to the boil.
  4. Then leave to boil for 10 minutes and season with salt.
  5. Take the sauce off the heat add part of the warm sauce to the beaten egg in small amounts.
  6. Once well beaten, add this back to the rest of the sauce and then whilst beating add the lemon juice in.
title: Zure Eiersaus

directions:
1. Melt the butter in a clean, smooth pan.
  2. Add the flour and mix the flour and butter to a white mass.
  3. Then add the boiling water or fish stock in small amounts, stirring well and in between bringing the sauce back to the boil.
  4. Then leave to boil for 10 minutes and season with salt.
  5. Take the sauce off the heat and add in the rest of the butter in small pieces.
title: Botersaus (fijne versie)

directions:
1. Make this sauce the same way as the botersaus and after cooking add the pureed tomato, grated onion, pepper and salt.
  2. Just before serving add the finely chopped parsley.
title: Tomatensaus

directions:
1. In a cast iron skillet, melt the butter, then add the Honey. Add Chicken pieces. Lower the heat a bit, and cook for 20 minutes turning the Chicken at least 4 times.
  2. Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
  3. Add sliced bananas to the skillet, cover, and bake for 45 minutes. If there is too much liquid at the end of baking, you can add 1/4 to 1/2 cup thin cream to make a sauce. Serve over plain rice.
  4. Serves 4.
title: Bahamian Chicken

directions:
1. Chop the onion fine and sauté it in the butter for about 10 minutes. Make sure it doesn't go brown.
  2. Add the flour and mix the flour and butter to a white mass.
  3. Then add the boiling water or fish stock in small amounts, stirring well and in between bringing the sauce back to the boil.
  4. Then leave to boil for 10 minutes and season with salt.
  5. Take the sauce off the heat and add the vinegar.
title: Lichte Uiensaus

directions:
1. Bring the stock to the boil, and add the vermicelli.
  2. Cook the vermicelli in about 10 minutes.
  3. In the mean tie mix the butter and flour to a white, stiff mass.
  4. Add a few spoonfuls of the stock, stirring all the while, until you get a paste.
  5. Add this paste to the rest of the soup, stir and bring to the boil.
  6. Leave to boil for a few minutes.
  7. Add the parsley just before serving and add pepper and lemon juice to taste.
title: Bliksemsoep

directions:
1. Peel and cube the potatoes.
  2. Bring the water to the boil and dissolve the stock cubes.
  3. Chop the cleaned leek (including the green) and saute on a low heat in the butter.
  4. Add the stock and the cubed potatoes. Leave the potatoes to cook through and through.
  5. When cooked, mash with a fork. Put the mashed mixture back in the pan and add the warmed milk and some pepper.
  6. Leave the soup to boil for a short while and stir in the chopped parsley and celery just before serving.
title: Aardappelsoep

directions:
1. Wash and cut all the vegetables in small cubes, the carrots, celary, Onion, potatoes, Peas, turnip and the Beef.
  2. Put in deep casserole cover with water, add the tomato puree and put to boil on high flame, the veg. have to be covered and the water three quarters pull in a deep casserole.
  3. Meanwhile in a small bowl put the flour salt pepper, the margarine and the corn Beef, mix and rub well with your clean hands till they resemble crumbs, then add a little water and continue working it if still dry ad more water a little at a time till it comes like a big ball and not too dry or to soggy,cover and leave to set till the vegetable starts to boil, as soon as it starts boiling put the flame on its lowest the lowest the better, then pick bits of the dough (dumplings) small pieces and form into small like balls put one by one in the boiling casserole, bring the flame up again till it boils as soon as it starts to boil with the dumpling in lower the flame again on a very low heat leave for 60minutes while stirring from time to time, see that you made enough water at the start with the veg. If after 60minutes you still have a lot of gravy leave till it thickens.
  4. When you see that the stew thicken it be ready to serve, this best served hot and if you prefer when ready put a spoonful of curry and mix with the ready stew.
title: Family Tradition Stew

directions:
1. Mix the sieved flour and salt with approximately 200ml. of cold water into a soft pliable but not sticky dough, knead well leave to rest for about 90 minutes.
  2. When rested, roll stretch and pull the dough on a floured surface, into long strips, spread half the fat over the entire lenth of dough, first with a palette knife then with clean hands, take one end of the dough and roll it up like a swiss roll, make it uneven turning it tightly sometimes then more loosely, rest it in the frig.
  3. Repeat the rolling and sometimes so that the roll is once more a long strip, spread the remaining fat, roll it up again like a swiss roll this time in a different direction from the first roll, all these rolling enhance the flakiness of the finished pastry, rest it again.
  4. Mash the ricotta with the salt and pepper , add the beaten eggs , cut off pieces of dough the size of a small ball with a sharp knife, pull out each piece with your fingers like a thin disc.
  5. Place a spoonful of ricotta mixture in the center, close the dough around it and seal the edge with your fingers, place on a lightly oiled baking sheet and bake on 200'c / 400'f /gas 6. for 25 minutes or till golden
title: Rikotta Cheese Cakes

directions:
1. Take exotic fruits ( bananas, kiwis, oranges, grapefruit, watermelons, pineapple, fresh or in tin ) and Apples, grapes, strawberries.
  2. Peel the fruit.
  3. Cut it in cubes.
  4. Place it in a bowl (with the juice of the fruit).
  5. Sprinkle with old rum.
  6. Mix it.
  7. Cover the bowl with aluminium paper.
  8. Place the bowl in the fridge for one hour.
  9. Serve very cold.
title: Martinique Fruit salad

directions:
1. Heat butter in heavy saucepan and add Crayfish, Onion and garlic. Saute over medium heat until the Crayfish have changed color, about 5 minutes.
  2. Add the fennel, chile pepper|hot pepper and water. Cover and cook at a gentle simmer for 30 minutes. Remove and discard the fennel and the chile pepper|hot pepper.
  3. Remove the Crayfish and pound in a mortar and push through a fine sieve or reduce to a puree in an electric blender with a little of the stock. Return the pureed Crayfish to the saucepan, add the coconut milk and heat through.
  4. Beat the eggs yolks with a little of the soup and stir into the saucepan.
  5. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the soup is lightly thickened.
  6. The Crayfish shells may be simmered the water first to make a more flavorful stock instead of using plain water.
title: Bisque de Cribiches

directions:
1. Peel avocado and cucumber; chop in chunks and place in a blender.
  2. Add parsley, lemon, and blend until smooth.
  3. Add the crushed ice and blend together again.
  4. Strain into glasses. Garnish with lemon slices or cucumber peel.
title: Avocado Aperitif

directions:
1. To create proper texture be sure not to remove scales.
  2. Gut and thoroughly clean fish. If using snapper remove gills.
  3. Place fish into pot.
  4. Add water.
  5. Clean leek and add it to pot.
  6. Add onion, sliced celery and salt and boil on a medium flame for 40 – 60 minutes.
  7. Served with fish and parsley.
title: Ukha

directions:
1. Mix together.
  2. Pour a bit of oil or butter in the bottom of a small skillet, pour enough batter in to lightly coat the bottom.
  3. Cook until golden brown on both sides.
  4. Blini can be served with butter, caviar, sour cream or just about anything which sounds good on pancakes or crêpes.
title: Blinchiki

directions:
1. Soak peas in water for 2 hours, then boil until it is very soft.
  2. Mash peas until puree mass.
  3. Add well washed millet and boil until millet is ready.
  4. Chop onion finely and fry in oil.
  5. Add onion and salt to taste to kulesh.
  6. Serve hot.
title: Peas Kulesh

directions:
1. Boil shrimp and remove outer shell (15 – 20 minutes).
  2. Slice each shrimp along vein, deeply enough to lay out flat (butterfly fashion).
  3. Beat together egg, milk, flour and seasoning until smooth.
  4. Dip each shrimp in batter.
  5. Drain and spread in a single layer on a tray.
  6. Sprinkle almond if used.
  7. Chill before frying, 1 – 2 hours (optional).
  8. Heat fat to 370°F.
  9. Fry shrimps until brown.
  10. Deep or shallow frying.
  11. Drain on absorbent paper.
  12. Serve hot.
title: Camaron Frito

directions:
1. Boil eggs hard (10 minutes after water boils).
  2. Make white sauce.
  3. Cut eggs into slices.
  4. Put alternate layers of eggs, sauce and bread crumbs (as in macaroni and Cheese).
  5. Sprinkle top with Cheese.
  6. Bake 15–25 minutes in a moderate oven or until done.
title: Egg and Cheese Pie

directions:
1. Boil macaroni.
  2. Strain and mash or use sifter.
  3. Add grated cheese, milk and margarine.
  4. Mix well.
  5. Serve with spoon and bowl.
title: Macaroni Cheese Dinner

directions:
1. Soak rice in water for 3 hours. Then grind it with grated gabulhi adding enough quantity of water to make a thick paste.
  2. Add salt to it. Then spread it round slowly with a tbsp in a pan (like pan cake). Fry for 3 minutes without turning sides.
title: Kiru folhi

directions:
1. Cook the okras in boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes.
  2. While they are cooking,mix the corn meal and cold water to a smooth paste.
  3. When the okras are soft, lower the heat, add salt and corn meal mixture, stirring constantly with a "cou-cou stick" (wooden spoon) until the mixture becomes fairly stiff.
  4. When mixture breaks away cleanly from the side of the saucepan, the cou-cou is ready.
  5. butter a bowl, turn the mixture out neatly onto it, shaking it so that it takes on the shape of the bowl.
  6. Turn it out on to a serving dish, make an indentation in the top and place a knob of butter in it.
title: Cou-cou

directions:
1. Wash the okras and cut off the heads and tails. Cut into cartwheels and place in a pot with 2 cups water and all the other ingredients except the cornmeal. Bring to the boil and simmer for about 15 minutes.
  2. In the meantime, place the cornmeal in a bowl and pour over 4 cups water to saturate the meal. Stir to make sure it is wet throughout.
  3. After the 15 minutes pour out about three quarters of the okras and the cooking liquid and set aside.
  4. Return the pot to a very low heat and pour in the wet cornmeal. Stir constantly to break up any lumps. Add the reserved okras and liquid a little at a time stirring to make sure the mixture is smooth. A coo-coo stick is normally used for this purpose - it resembles a small cricket bat.
  5. However, a wooden spoon also does the job quite well.
  6. Continue to stir and cook on very low heat for about 10 minutes. When finished the Coo-Coo should be smooth and stiff. Transfer to a buttered dish.
title: Coo-Coo - Fungi

directions:
1. Pre-heat the oven at 220°C.
  2. Dice the carrot, zucchini, onion and leek and fry with a little bit of butter.
  3. Add the crab to the vegetables and fry.
  4. In a bowl mix the breadcrumb with the milk and then add to the crab and vegetables.
  5. Season with salt and pepper and put aside.
  6. Meanwhile cook the crayfish in boiling water for 1 minute.
  7. Let it cool down and shell it.
  8. Add the crayfish to the rest of the mix and pour it into individual buttered tins.
  9. Cook in the oven for 20 minutes at 220°C.
  10. To be served hot!
title: Crab stuffed with Crayfish

directions:
1. Peel and cut potatoes. Cut Chicken into pieces and wash. Cut onions and garlic and grind together. Place Onion, garlic, cumin, and curry powder in a small bowl and then add 1/4 cup of water and mix to make a curry paste.
  2. Add oil to a pot and heat, and then add curry paste and stir frequently and let it fry for 5 minutes. Add Chicken to the pot and fry for another 5 minutes.
  3. Add potatoes to Chicken. Add water.
  4. Add tomatoes if necessary. Simmer for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. This dish can be served with roti or rice.
title: Chicken Curry I

directions:
1. Cut meat into small pieces and wash. Cut onions and garlic and grind together. Put oil in a pressure cooker and heat to a medium temperature.
  2. Add the grinded Onion an garlic to the pressure cooker and let it fry for a few minutes. Add curry powder and cumin|jeera to the pressure cooker. Keep stirring and let it fry for approximately 3 to 4 minutes.
  3. Now add the meat. Add salt. Cover the pressure cooker loosely and cook until meat is well fried.
  4. Stir periodically. Add enough water to cover the meat.
  5. Let it pressure for 5 to 7 minutes depending on the tenderness of the meat.
  6. Add the potatoes and cook untill done. This dish can be served with rice or roti
title: Beef Curry

directions:
1. Boil the potatoes with the egg until potatoes are cooked. Peel potatoes and eggs. Heat oil in a pan, and fry the eggs until brown on all sides. Drain the eggs.
  2. Put 1 Tbsp. of the oil in a pot, heat and add the ground onions and garlic. Fry for 1 minute, then add the curry powder. Fry again, for 3 mintues stirring often so that it does not burn.
  3. Add potatoes and eggs with the water. Bol for appros 10 minutes. Serve with rice or roti.
title: EGG CURRY

directions:
1. Brown onion in cooking oil.
  2. Add chicken until completely brown.
  3. Add enough water to completely covered chicken.
  4. Add salt and pepper and/or instant bouillon to desired taste.
  5. When chicken is about done, add mixed vegetables and cook for another 10 minutes.
title: Kadon Mannok

directions:
1. Peel plantain.
  2. Slice thinly at an angle lengthwise into dip size chips.
  3. Heat oil and fry slices until crisp.
  4. Lightly salt.
title: Plantain Chips

directions:
1. In a cast iron skillet add chopped Onion, garlic, vinegar and water.
  2. Bring to boil. Add , simmer until tender. Add pepper to taste.
title: Paksiu

directions:
1. Collect all ingredients and equipment.
  2. In saucepan put all seasonings and vegetables except tomato in water.
  3. Boil for 20 minutes.
  4. Add tomatoes. Cook for another 5 minutes.
  5. Thicken more if desired. Serve hot.
title: Belizean Pumpkin Soup

directions:
1. Tear lettuce leaves. Prepare other vegetables.
  2. Put into a bowl. Toss.
  3. Add vinegar/oil or any of your favourte dressing.
title: Belizean Tossed Salad

directions:
1. Brush the mussels in clean water, constantly refreshing the water.
  2. Add the cleaned whole vegetables to the pan, add the mussels and bring to the boil (use only the water on the mussels, do not add extra water).
  3. Wait until they open (after about 10 minutes), take them out of the shells.
  4. Warning: mussels that do not open during boiling are not fresh and should not be eaten.
  5. Leave to drain well.
  6. Roll through the breadcrumbs and quickly fry in the hot oil.
title: Gebakken Mosselen

directions:
1. Brush the mussels in clean water, constantly refreshing the water.
  2. Add the cleaned whole vegetables to the pan, add the mussels and bring to the boil (use only the water on the mussels, do not add extra water).
  3. Wait until they open (after about 10 minutes), take them out of the shells.
  4. Warning: mussels that do not open during boiling are not fresh and should not be eaten.
title: Gekookte Mosselen
Uitsmijter (Fried egg with cheese and ham)

directions:
1. Place all the ingredients in a large saucepan, cover with ½ - inch of cold water and bring to the boil, stirring.
  2. Reduce the heat, partially cover the pan and simmer gently for about 2 hours, keeping an eye on the water level and topping up when necessary, until meat is very tender and can be shredded with a fork.
  3. Preheat the oven to 400F and grease a wide shallow baking pan. Remove the meat from the saucepan and shred into thin strips using two forks. The meat should be soft enough to pull apart very easily.
  4. Transfer the shredded meat to the greased pan, pour over enough of the cooking juice to moisten then roast in the oven for 30 minutes until well browned on top. Serve with rice.
title: Varenga

directions:
1. Grate about 8 peeled potatoes and transfer to sieve to drip dry.
  2. When drippings have settled, pour off clear liquid and add remaining sediment (starch) to grated potatoes.
  3. To mixture add 2 eggs, 2 heaping Tablespoons flour, 1 Tablespoon grated Onion, and 1 teaspoon salt.
  4. Add a pinch of freshly ground pepper if desired.
  5. Mix into a uniform batter and spoon into hot lard or oil in skillet.
  6. Flatten each pancake gently with spatula, as they should be on the thin side.
  7. Fry to a crisp golden brown on both sides and serve immediately.
  8. Some like their Potato pancakes sprinkled with a little salt and topped with sour cream.
  9. Others prefer them sprinkled with just Granulated sugar|Sugar or Granulated sugar|Sugar and sour cream.
title: Polish Placki Kartoflane

directions:
1. Beat cream Cheese with 1/2 cup milk at low speed until smooth. Add pudding mix and remaining milk.
  2. Beat until smooth, 1 to 2 minutes. Mix cherry pie filling and Liquor.
  3. Reserve a few cherry|cherries for garnish, if desired.
  4. Spoon 1/2 of pudding mixture evenly into individual dessert dishes.
  5. Sprinkle with cookie crumbs. Top with pie filling, then with remaining pudding mixture.
  6. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with reserved cherry|cherries and additional cookie crumbs.
title: Black Forest Parfaits

directions:
1. Brush the margarine on one side of the cod and put it under a medium heat grill for 5 minutes.
  2. Turn the cod over, brush the other side with margarine and return to the grill for another 3 minutes.
  3. Sprinkle the parsley on the cod and cover with the cheese.
  4. Slice the tomato and put on top of the cheese.
  5. Place the dish under the grill for a few more minutes until the cheese is melted.
title: Kabeljauw met Kaas

directions:
1. Bake Eggplants in a 350 oven for 25 minutes.
  2. Let the Eggplant cool.
  3. Peel the skin off, trying to preserve as much of the flesh as possible.
  4. With a fork, mash the Eggplant in a bowl.
  5. Stir in the vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper.
  6. Cool for half an hour to optimize flavor before serving.
title: Eggplant Salad from the Philippines

directions:
1. Cut Beef in small strips.
  2. Peel and chop Onion and garlic.
  3. Quarter the Eggplant.
  4. Bring the water to a boil and add the Beef.
  5. Boil until Beef is tender.
  6. Remove Beef reserving broth and sauté with garlic and Onion.
  7. Add broth into the Beef, garlic, and Onion.
  8. Bring to a boil, add vegetables and season to taste with salt.
title: Kare Kare from the Philippines

directions:
1. Oven 350 fahrenheit.
  2. Cook macaroni according to package instructions. Drain. Set aside.
  3. Grease a cassarole dish using cooking spray or butter and pour macaroni into it.
  4. Add can of tomatoes, seasonings and shredded Cheddar.
  5. Cook, uncovered 30–40 minutes until Cheese melts and is slightly golden.
  6. Check after 30 minutes to make sure Cheese is not darkening too quickly.
  7. If you find that bits of the macaroni have cooked and browned, that's fine.
  8. It adds even more flavor.
  9. It will take on a crunchy feel when you taste it.
title: World Recipe Baked Macaroni

directions:
1. Place Chicken in shallow casserole.
  2. Mix apricot nectar and soup mix together. pour over Chicken.
  3. Cover, bake 180*C for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
  4. Serve with boiled rice.
title: Apricot Chicken

directions:
1. Shred potatoes, garlic and onions in food processor or with hand grater.
  2. Put oil in baking pan.
  3. Heat in oven while mixing ingredients.
  4. Put shredded potatoes, garlic and onions in large bowl.
  5. Add salt pepper and eggs.
  6. Pour 2 tbsp hot oil into mixture.
  7. Blend well and pour back into hot pan.
  8. Bake at 400 degrees for about 45 minutes until browned
title: POTATO KUGEL

directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  2. Pour the oil into the bottom of a baking dish, and arrange the sausages over it in a single layer.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven.
  4. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, eggs, and half of the milk until smooth.
  5. Gradually mix in the rest of the milk until a smooth batter is achieved.
  6. Season with salt and pepper.
  7. Remove the sausages from the oven, and ladle the batter over them until the sausages are 3/4 covered.
  8. Return to the oven, and bake for 35 minutes, or until the center is risen and browned.
  9. Don't worry if the underside seems slightly soft, as this is normal.
title: English style Toad in the Hole

directions: 1. Rub this blend on meats before grilling.
title: Basic Rub Spice Mix

directions:
1. A basic spice mixture used in dozens of Emeril Lagasse's recipes.
  2. Mix it up and keep some on hand to "kick" any dish "up a notch!"
title: Emeril's Essence

directions:
1. Combine all ingredients, mixing well.
  2. Store in an airtight container until ready to use.
title: HOMEMADE CREAM SOUP RECIPE

directions:
1. Cut the Pork into small pieces and crack the bone and put it all into a large kettle.
  2. Add the cold water and cook until the meat is tender.
  3. Remove the bone and measure the liquid that remains.
  4. Add enough water to make one quart.
  5. Heat to the boiling and stir in the corn meal.
  6. Add salt and pepper and cook for 2 hours.
  7. As you cook this you’ll see the meat turning into shreds.
  8. Cool.
  9. When ready to use, cut into slices and sauté.
title: Breakfast Scrapple of Pork

directions:
1. In a saucepan cook Bacon, celery and Onion over medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes or until Bacon is cooked.
  2. Drain.
  3. Add Potato and water.
  4. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until Potato is tender.
  5. Stir in remaining ingredients and heat through.
title: Bacon Corn Chowder

directions:
1. Cut chorizo into the number of slices you would like per serving.
  2. Fry them in a little olive oil, add eggs (one or two) and fry them together with the chorizo.
  3. The spice of the chorizo will add flavor to the eggs.
  4. When the chorizo is crisp but not burned and the eggs are cooked to your liking remove all to a plate and serve with toast.
title: Fried eggs with Chorizo

directions:
1. 1 or 2 tablespoons of Granulated sugar|Sugar (white or brown)
  2. Enough hot milk to soak the bread.
  3. Enjoy on a cold morning. It is simply delicious.
title: Bread Cereal

directions:
1. Lightly brush four 9- or 10-inch flour tortillas with a small amount of cooking oil, or spray non-stick coating onto 1 side of each tortilla.
  2. Spray non-stick coating into four taco salad molds or small oven-safe bowls.
  3. Press tortillas, coated sides up, into molds or bowls.
  4. Place a ball of foil in each tortilla cup. Bake in a 350F oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until light brown.
  5. Remove the foil. Cool. Remove Tortilla Bowls from the molds.
  6. Fill the bowls with salad of your choice and serve immediately.Makes 4 bowls.
title: TORTILLA BOWLS

directions:
1. Break off the stems of the mushroom.
  2. Sauté the finely chopped onion in the butter or margarine.
  3. Add crab meat.
  4. Make a well in the middle of the frying pan and add the brandy.
  5. Blend it into the crab meat mixture.
  6. Stuff mixture into the mushroom caps and set them in an open pan.
  7. Pour ¼ inch water in the pan and bake in a moderate oven for 10 minutes.
title: Mushroom with Crab Meat Stuffing

directions:
1. Cut butter into flour as for pie crust. Add water to make a soft dough.
  2. Divide into 2 parts.
  3. Pat by hand into two strips 12 by 2 inches on ungreased cookie sheet.
title: World Recipe Danish Pastry

directions:
1. Bring butter and water to rolling boil. Add 1 cup flour. Stir until smooth.
  2. Remove from heat. Add vanilla, almond extract and the eggs, one at a time.
  3. Beat well. Divide into 2 parts and spoon on above dough evenly.
  4. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Turn off oven and leave in 10 more minutes.
  5. Spread with Buttercream Icing (below) when cool.
  6. Sprinkle with toasted slivered almonds.
title: Cream Puff Topping

directions:
1. Brown the Beef, garlic, Onion and green bell pepper|green peppers in a skillet for about 10 minutes over medium heat.
  2. Stir in flour, salt and pepper.
  3. Add water and cook, stirring, until the mixture bubbles and thickens.
  4. Pour the meat mixture into a three-quart casserole.
  5. Layer the corn on top of the Beef.
  6. Spread the mashed potatoes on top of the corn and sprinkle with the Parsley.
  7. Bake in 350 oven for 30 minutes.
title: Beef Shepherd's Pie

directions:
1. Whirl the Pears, cranberry sauce, ice cream, and lavender in a blender, just until smooth.
  2. Serve immediately in tall glasses. Garnish with lavender, if desired.
  3. Another serving option: serve the smoothie as a chilled dessert soup in a small bowl or stemmed glass.
title: Cranberry-Pear Smoothie

directions:
1. In small bowl mix Cheddar Cheese and a handful of Jack cheese|Monterey jack Cheese for the top.
  2. Mix the rest of the Jack cheese|Monterey jack Cheese and the onions in a bowl. Mix beans and meat. Mix tomatoes and soup in a small bowl.
  3. Line a 13X9" pan with tortillas. Layer the meat and Cheese and onions then finish with corn tortillas.
  4. Spread soup and tomatoes and top with cheeses.
  5. Cover with foil and bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes. Let stand about 5 minutes before serving.
title: World Recipe Mexican Casserole

directions:
1. Dice bread ends and measure about 4 1/2 cups. Melt butter in a 2 quart pot.
  2. Add celery, Onion and garlic. Sauté over low heat 5 minutes.
  3. Add Parsley, herbs and pepper to sautéed vegetable mix and stir. Add boiling water.
  4. Stir; bring mix to a boil and take the pot off the range. Now lightly fork in the bread cubes.
  5. Cover the pot and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
title: Homemade Stove Top Stuffing

directions:
1. Stir cream and buttermilk in a pint jar. Cover and shake.
  2. Let stand at room temperature, uncovered, 6 hours to overnight, then chill well.
  3. When ready to serve sour cream, beat to medium-stiff peaks - not stiff.
  4. Serve immediately. Whipped mixture should double in volume.
  5. Makes a scant 4 cups, whipped.
title: HOMEMADE SOUR CREAM

directions:
1. Cut the liver into approximately 1 inch slices.
  2. Place in your food dehydrator for 24 hours*.
  3. Use pam or the equivalent on the drying racks, so the liver won't stick.
  4. Let dry for 24 hours.
  5. Or you could place them on a cookie sheet and bake in a 325°F oven for about 45 minutes to help dry them out.
title: Liver Treats

directions:
1. Place chicken pieces in large pot.
  2. Cover with cold water (5 – 6 cups).
  3. Add carrots, celery, and potatoes to water.
  4. Add salt to taste if you want.
  5. Cover and simmer on low heat about 2 hours until the chicken becomes tender.
  6. Add the rice, cover and cook over low heat for about 30 minutes until the rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
  7. Remove soup from heat.
  8. Pull the chicken meat off the bone (if will practically fall off), discard bones.
  9. Return shredded pieces to pot.
  10. Stir well.
  11. Let cool.
  12. Store in the refrigerator or freeze.
title: Doggy Chow Chow Chicken

directions:
1. Mix together, freeze in ice cube tray. serve.
  2. Plus: these don't dmage gums and teeth like ice does!
title: Fruity Yogurt Treats

directions:
1. Mix together, (make sure dough is not too sticky or too dry), knead, roll out 1/8 thick,cookie cut, place on greased cookie sheet. (
  2. use this popular glaze: 1 egg,2 tbsp milk and a dash of garlic to free them of fleas!
title: Glazed Chicken Treats

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
  2. In mixing bowl, combine all ingredients.
  3. Mix well by hand. On baking sheet, form into the shape of a large dog bone.
  4. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes.
  5. Let cool and serve.
title: Tweeter's Thanksgiving Treat

directions:
1. Dissolve boillion in water and tear meat into smaller pieces about 1/2 inch squares.
  2. Freeze for about 12 hours or until solid.
title: Frozen Doggie Yums

directions:
1. Disolve the bouillon in the water.
  2. Spoon some bouillon into an ice cube tray and put some Chicken pieces in it.
  3. Repeat until bouillon is used up.Freeze for about 12 hours.
title: Yummy Chicken Freezeies

directions:
1. Heat oven to 175°C.
  2. And grease a baking dish.
  3. In a mixing bowl, mix the raw eggs, milk, chicken stock, salt and pepper to taste, beat all this well.
  4. Stir in the chopped hard boiled eggs.
  5. Put the bread and the chicken in the baking dish and pour the egg mixture over it all, dot it with butter and sprinkle a bit of paprika over it.
  6. Bake for about half an hour or until all the liquid has been absorbed and the pudding is slightly browned around the top and the edges.
  7. Cool before serving.
title: Lazy Bone Egg Dog Pudding

directions:
1. In a large pot, boil the rice and chicken stock.
  2. Add in the saffron then cover the pot and reduce the heat to low to allow it to simmer for 20 minutes approximately until rice is soft.
  3. In a separate frying pan or skillet, simmer enough water to be able to cover the eggs, then, add in vinegar.
  4. Break eggs into the skillet one by one and allow them to simmer in the liquid.
  5. Poach these for 5 minutes.
  6. In the meanwhile, put the cooked rice onto a dish.
  7. Take out the eggs from the liquid with a big spoon and put these over the rice.
  8. Pour the curry sauce on top and serve.
title: Eggs with Saffron Rice

directions:
1. Dissolve honey in water in large non-aluminum saucepan.
  2. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
  3. Add rhubarb.
  4. Reduce heat to low; simmer, uncovered, 15 to 25 minutes or until rhubarb is tender but still intact.
  5. Stir in vanilla.
  6. Combine cornstarch with 3 tablespoons water; mix well.
  7. Gradually stir cornstarch mixture into rhubarb; cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil.
  8. Reduce heat; simmer 3 to 5 minutes or until mixture thickens.
  9. Pour into serving bowl and refrigerate until cold.
  10. Serve over frozen yogurt.
title: Honey Rhubarb Compote

directions:
1. Milk diluted with water is boiled.
  2. Flour is slightly fried with butter and diluted with hot water.
  3. This mixture is poured in the boiling milk, cleaned millet is added and boiled during 10– 15 minutes on slow fire to softnes.
  4. Butter ans pound kurt are added, the lid is closely put on and the dish is left for 5–7 minutes to stew.
title: Millet soup

directions:
1. Fill ice tray with soda water|club soda and freeze solid.
  2. Grind cubes in blender to crushed ice consistency.
  3. Fill glass with ice and mound on top,i.e. heap into a raised mass, in the same manner as that of a traditional snow cone.
  4. Pour Mad Dog over ice and serve.
title: Hell Frozen Over

directions:
1. Chop onions and saute until colour changes (mixture should be slightly liquidy).
  2. Process hard boiled eggs and walnuts.
  3. Mash drained peas.
  4. Mix all together well.
title: Mock Chopped Liver

directions:
1. Cook potato and onion with a bit of salt in enough water to cover.
  2. When potato is almost cooked, add can of mushrooms, with their juice, (or sautéed fresh mushrooms) and heat through.
  3. Heat the milk separately.
  4. Add the potato mixture to the hot milk.
  5. Let stand a few minutes for flavors to blend.
  6. Thicken, if desired.
title: Easy yet Elegant Mushroom Soup

directions:
1. In skillet over medium heat, in hot margarine, cook onions, covered, 5 minutes.
  2. Add salt, thyme, and pepper.
  3. Cook, uncovered, until onions are tender, about 8 minutes stirring onion mixture occasionally.
title: Pan-fried Onions

directions:
1. Arrange on a salad plate.
  2. Drizzle with raspberry dressing (can be purchased) and garnish with mint leaves.
title: Shrimp and Fresh Fruit Platter

directions:
1. Boil macaroni in water until tender. Drain thoroughly.
  2. Stir in butter and egg.
  3. Mix mustard and salt with 1 tbsp hot water and add to milk.
  4. Add cheese to macaroni.
  5. Leave enough to sprinkle on top.
  6. Pour into buttered casserole.
  7. Add milk.
  8. Sprinkle with remainder of cheese.
  9. Bake at 350°F for about 45 minutes until custard is set and to is crusty.
title: President and Mrs. Reagan's Macaroni and Cheese

directions:
1. Boil unpeeled potatoes 30 minutes.
  2. Rinse under cold water, peel and set aside to cool.
  3. Slice potatoes.
  4. In a large fry pan cook bacon until transparent.
  5. Add the potato slices; cook until lightly browned.
  6. Meanwhile blend eggs with milk and salt.
  7. Stir in the cubed ham.
  8. Cut the tomatoes into thin wedges; add to the egg mixture.
  9. Pour the egg mixture over the potatoes in the fry pan.
  10. Cook until the eggs are set.
  11. Sprinkle with chopped chives and serve at once.
  12. Enjoy.
title: Bauernfrühstück I

directions:
1. Place cauliflower in a heat proof pot cover pot with tin foil and place in pressure cooker.
  2. Add water to pressure cooker base, not in pot with cauliflower.
  3. Cook under high pressure for 5 minutes.
  4. Remove cauliflower from pressure cooker, add butter if desired and cheese also if desired.
  5. Mash to the consistency of mashed potatoes.
  6. Add milk if you want to.
  7. If you want to add cheese you can add cream cheese (tiny chunks) or shredded cheese like cheddar or parmesan cheese.
title: Cauliflower Mashed "Potatoes"

directions:
1. Arrange the pita pieces close together, rough sides up, on 2 large baking sheets.
  2. In a small bowl combine well the sage, the thyme, the salt, and the pepper
  3. Sprinkle the mixture over the pita pieces, and scatter the Cheddar on top.
  4. Bake the crisps in a preheated 375°F oven for 12 to 15 minutes, or until they are golden.
title: Herbed Cheddar Pita Crisps

directions:
1. Heat Oven to 350 °F.
  2. Make brownies as directed for 13x9-inch pan.
  3. Cool completely, for about 1 hour.
  4. Cut into sixty 1-inch squares.
  5. In microwavable bowl, stir together frosting and preserves.
  6. Microwave uncovered on high about 20 seconds or until mixture can be stirred smooth.
  7. Pour into fondue pot.
  8. Keep warm over low heat, and serve within 1 hour.
  9. Spear brownies and fruit with fondue forks; Dip in fondue.
title: Brownies and Chocolate-Raspberry Fondue

directions:
1. Heat oven to 425°F.
  2. Line broiler pan with foil.
  3. Spray broiler pan rack with nonstick cooking spray.
  4. Wash hands.
  5. Place chicken and potatoes on rack.
  6. In small bowl, mix butter, rosemary, thyme, garlic, pepper and oregano.
  7. Rub or spoon mixture evenly on chicken and potatoes.
  8. Wash hands.
  9. Roast chicken and potatoes at 425°F for 35 to 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and internal juices of chicken run clear.
  10. Serve with spinach salad and hot crusty rolls, if desired.
  11. Refrigerate leftovers immediately.
title: Roasted Chicken Dinner

directions:
1. Melt butter in a heavy bottomed skillet over medium to medium high heat.
  2. Slowly sprinkle in the flour a little at a time, stirring constantly.
  3. Continue to stir constantly.Do not walk away! If you burn it even the tiniest bit, it is unusable.
  4. You will notice the flour beginning to brown. The darker the flour, the darker the gravy.
  5. For gumbo, when the roux reaches a deep dark chocolate brown color it is done.
  6. At that point you would add your seasonings, such as onion,garlic, bell pepper and celery.
  7. You can make this ahead of time and keep tightly covered in the fridge or freezer.
title: Instructions for making Roux

directions:
1. Cook macaroni and drain.
  2. Place in a buttered baking dish.
  3. Put in butter,most of cheese, and salt, pepper, and onion to taste.
  4. Put bread crumbs on top of macaroni.
  5. Beat eggs and milk together, then pour over the bread crumbs.
  6. Sprinkle remaining cheese over top.
  7. Bake at 350°F for 20 to 30 minutes.
title: Mom's Macaroni and Cheese

directions:
1. Grate lemon peel and gingerroot.
  2. Mix in brandy or whiskey and let stand for 10 days.
  3. Shake once a day.
  4. Strain through fine muslin, filter paper or cotton ball.
  5. Seal the liquid tightly and store in a cool place.
  6. The extract will keep almost indefinitely.
title: Ginger Extract

directions:
1. Slice onions and season with salt and pepper or Tony's
  2. Cook slowly in 1 tbsp butter or oil to every 2 onions.
  3. When the onions are tender, add 1 cup boiling water and cook on medium/low heat to the consistency of stew.
  4. ''Serve it with any meat''.
title: Smothered Onions

directions:
1. In large pan, over high heat, bring onions and enough water to cover to boil.
  2. Reduce heat to low; simmer covered 30 minutes or until onions are tender.
  3. Meanwhile, in large skillet over medium heat, melt margarine; add mushrooms.
  4. Cook about 5 minutes.
  5. Stir occasionally until tender and lightly browned.
  6. With slotted spoon, remove mushrooms to bowl.
  7. Stir flour into drippings remaining in skillet until well mixed; over medium low heat, gradually stir in milk.
  8. Cook, stirring frequently until thickened and smooth.
  9. Remove from heat.
  10. Stir in sherry, salt paprika and pepper.
  11. Drain onions.
  12. Slip off skins.
  13. Add to skillet along with mushrooms.
  14. Over low heat, cook about 5 minutes.
  15. Stir constantly until vegetables are heated through and coated with sauce.
title: Old-fashioned Creamed Onions and Mushrooms

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 475°F.
  2. Snap off and discard woody bases from asparagus. If desired, use a paring knife to scrape off scales.
  3. Combine oil and 1 tablespoon of the chervil or 1 teaspoon of the tarragon.
  4. Drizzle over asparagus. Toss gently to coat.
  5. In a greased 15x10x1-inch baking pan arrange asparagus in a single layer. Sprinkle lightly with salt.
  6. Roast asparagus, uncovered, 4 to 6 minutes or until just tender, stirring once.
  7. To serve, place the asparagus upright in a glass jar or flat on a serving platter.
  8. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon snipped chervil or 1 teaspoon snipped tarragon.
  9. Garnish with chervil sprigs, if desired.
title: Asparagus Bouquet

directions:
1. Melt butter in a pan
  2. Add flour and make sure all lumps are smoothed out
  3. Add milk and let thicken, stirring to make sure no lumps form
title: Scalloped Salmon

directions:
1. Cook potatoes in large pot of boiling salted water about 40 minutes until tender when pierced.
  2. Drain.
  3. Cool slightly, peel and mash in large bowl.
  4. Stir in butter until smooth.
  5. Scrape into a greased shallow 2 quart casserole.
  6. May now be covered and refrigerated up to 2 days.
  7. To serve, heat oven to 375°F.
  8. Arrange marshmallows on top of potatoes.
  9. Bake 20 minutes until marshmallows puff and brown and potatoes are hot.
title: Mashed Sweet Potatoes with Marshmallows

directions:
1. In a skillet, brown sausage and drain.
  2. Spoon into an ungreased 10-inch pie pan.
  3. Top with potatoes and cheddar cheese.
  4. In a bowl, beat eggs, milk, salt and pepper; pour over cheese.
  5. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and paprika.
  6. Bake uncovered, in a 375°F oven for 30 – 35 minutes or until golden brown.
title: Sausage and Potato Quiche

directions:
1. Cook, dry (I really mean no water) in covered pan over low heat until mushy, 20 to 30 minutes.
  2. Blend in processor if needed.
title: Homemade Applesauce I

directions:
1. Preheat broiler.
  2. Coat broiler pan with non-stick cooking spray.
  3. Rinse salmon and pat dry.
  4. Sprinkle with salt and pepper on each side.
  5. Place salmon on broiler pan and sprinkle with half the tarragon.
  6. Place about 3 inches from heat source and broil 3 to 4 minutes.
  7. Turn, sprinkle with remaining tarragon and broil 3 to 4 minutes until fish turns from translucent to opaque.
  8. Top each with a lemon slice.
title: Tarragon Salmon Broil

directions:
1. Combine cornstarch and cocoa.
  2. Whisk into cold water in a saucepan until there are no dry bits.
  3. Cook, stirring frequently, until mixture comes to a boil.
  4. Stir 1 minute until mixture thickens.
  5. Remove from heat, stir in sweetener and vanilla, cover and allow to cool.
  6. Store in clean jar in refrigerator up to 6 weeks.
title: Diabetic-friendly Chocolate Sauce

directions:
1. Peel parsnips, quarter, and remove any woody core.
  2. Parboil for 15minutes.
  3. Place in an ovenproof dish.
  4. Add stock and sprinkle with salt,pepper and nutmeg.
  5. Dot with butter and bake for 30 minutes on a low shelf in a moderate oven (generally parsnips are baked in the same oven as the main meat dish, whose cooking temperature governs that of the parsnips).
title: Baked Parsnips Irish-style

directions:
1. Again just melt your coatings,chocolate or white, or color the white.
  2. Melt in small bowls in pan of water, just warm never hot.
  3. Dip the pretzels in and lift with a fork, shaking off excess coating.
  4. And lay on wax paper cookie sheet, that will fit in your freezer.
  5. You really don't have to use the freezer.
  6. They will set up setting out, but look better and set up faster in frig or freezer.
  7. Good luck.
title: Easter Coated Pretzels

directions:
1. Cut pork into 1-inch cubes and place in a large saucepan.
  2. Place chicken thighs in another large saucepan.
  3. Cut onion half into 2 pieces.
  4. In each saucepan, place 1 piece of onion, 1 clove garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, 6 peppercorns and 3 cups water.
  5. Bring each to a boil.
  6. Skim foam from surface.
  7. Cover pork and simmer 1 hour.
  8. Cover chicken and simmer 45 minutes.
  9. Remove cooked pork and chicken from broths with a slotted spoon and place ina large pot or dutch oven.
  10. Strain broths, discard solids, and add broths to meat.
  11. Drain and rinse hominy and add to meat.
  12. Bring to a boil; reduce heat.
  13. Cover and simmer 30 minutes.
  14. Taste posole and add more salt if needed.
  15. Serve in large soup bowls.
  16. Add garnishes to soup as desired.
title: Posole Blanco

directions:
1. In a large bowl, combine frozen berries, the water, and frozen concentrate.
  2. Place half of the mixture in a food processor.
  3. Cover and process until almost smooth.
  4. Repeat with remaining mixture.
  5. Serve immediately.
  6. If desired, serve with additional fresh blueberries and raspberries.
title: Very Berry Sorbet

directions:
1. Mix butter and grated cheese.
  2. Combine dry ingredients, and add to the cheese mixture.
  3. Roll into log 2 inch in diameter.
  4. Wrap in wax paper and chill overnight.
  5. Slice as thin as possible.
  6. Place on non stick cookie sheet, or foil, and place a halved pecan on top.
  7. Bake 375 for 14-15 minutes or until light brown.
  8. If using foil, cool, and peel off.
  9. Store in covered container, refrigerated.
title: Cheese and Cayenne Cookies

directions:
1. Melt butter, add onion and cook until tender but not brown.
  2. Add potatoes and just enough water to cook potatoes.
  3. When potatoes are tender add parsley, salt and pepper.
  4. Then add clams with their juice.
  5. Just before serving add 2 cups of milk and heat but do not boil.
  6. Makes enough for 4 large bowls of clam chowder.
  7. Garnish with a sprinkle of parsley on top.
title: New England Clam Chowder I

directions:
1. Soften butter and cream in honey.
  2. Serve on breads, muffins or crackers.
title: Honey Butter

directions:
1. Boil applesauce on high heat, then add sugar and vinegar.
  2. I hold the cinnamon until last ½ hour because I think it evaporates some.
  3. Cook on high heat (about 4 hours) until the apple butter is as thick as you want it when you cool and serve.
title: Apple Butter in a Crock Pot

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F.
  2. Beat eggs then stir in milk, sugar, salt and flour beating constantly with a wire whisk.
  3. Pour batter into sizzling hot pans on top of melted butter and bake for 35 minutes.
  4. Remove from pans.
  5. Serve warm with jelly, sour cream, syrup, honey or powdered sugar.
title: Pannukaku

directions:
1. Cover bottom of 9 x 13 inch pan with water.
  2. Sprinkle with cinnamon.
  3. Slice apples and layer over water in pan.
  4. Mix the following and add to apples: mix the flour and sugar and put over apple slices.
  5. Put butter piece over flour and sugar mixture.
  6. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
  7. Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
  8. Enjoy.
title: Quick and Easy Apple Crisp

directions:
1. Combine milk and cheese.
  2. Stir to spreading consistency.
  3. Spread about 2 teaspoons on each side of bread, thin cut in 2 pieces.
  4. Roll bread and wrap with bacon.
  5. Place on broiler pan.
  6. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until bacon browns.
  7. These freeze well.
  8. Thaw before cooking.
  9. Enjoy.
title: Bacon Roll-ups I

directions:
1. Grease a 12-cup bundt pan and coat with sugar.
  2. Cream shortening and sugar; add unbeaten eggs, one at a time beating well after each.
  3. Add flour all at once and beat well.
  4. Add vanilla.
  5. Bake in the bundt pan at 325°F for 1 hour or until done.
  6. Cool at least 10 minutes.
  7. Then turn upside down on a cake plate.
  8. This cake is very good served with ice cream or fresh fruit or both.
title: Mrs. W's Bundt Cake

directions:
1. Melt butter in a heavy medium pan over medium low heat.
  2. Add sifted flour and whisk for 1½ minutes.
  3. Do not allow to brown.
  4. Gradually add milk, whisking constantly.
  5. Season to taste with salt and pepper and stir constantly with a wooden spoon until sauce is the consistency of thick cream, about 15 minutes.
title: Italian-style Béchamel Sauce

directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 225°F and warm an ovenproof platter.
  2. Beat the flour, salt, sugar, egg, 2 t oil, and 1 c ice water in a bowl and refrigerate.
  3. Shell and devein the shrimp.
  4. Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels.
  5. Heat 3 inches of oil to 365°F in a heavy pot or skillet.
  6. Dip each shrimp into the batter and drop into the hot oil. Don't crowd the pot.
  7. Do a few at a time, frying for about 1 minute or until golden.
  8. Proceed until all the shrimp are fired, draining each batch and keeping warm on the platter in the oven.
  9. Serve with chili sauce or tartar sauce.
title: Batter-fried Shrimp

directions:
1. Melt the butter in a saucepan.
  2. Add the onion and celery and cook over medium heat, stirring often, until the onion is soft.
  3. Stir in the tuna, rice, parsley, and salt and heat through.
  4. Sprinkle with cashews and serve hot.
title: Tuna and Rice

directions:
1. Peel and slice quite thin the potatoes and apples.
  2. Boil together in same water until tender.
  3. Meantime, peel onions and slice thin.
  4. Melt butter in skillet and lightly saute onion slices; drain apples and potatoes and spread on a hot platter.
  5. Over these, spread the onions.
  6. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
  7. Lastly, pour the warmed cream over all and serve at once.
title: Old-fashioned Lunenburg Breakfast or Supper Dish

directions:
1. Purée watermelon and raspberries in a blender.
  2. Scrape mixture through a fine sieve into a bowl, discard seeds.
  3. Stir sugar into purée.
  4. Pour 2 tbs puree into each glass and top with champagne or wine.
title: Watermelon Berry Sparkler Drink (Non-Alcoholic or Alcoholic)

directions:
1. Cut fish into serving pieces.
  2. Heat shortening in fry pan over medium heat.
  3. Mix salt and cornmeal; roll fish in cornmeal mixture.
  4. Place fish in fry pan; fry for 3 minutes or until browned.
title: Southern Pan-fried Bass

directions:
1. Bring 2 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot.
  2. Carefully drop the peaches into the water and boil for 10 to 15 seconds.
  3. Carefully remove peaches and let cool to touch.
  4. Peel off skins and remove pits.
  5. Cut the peaches into ⅛ inch slices and set aside.
  6. In a medium pan, combine wine, sugar, cinnamon and cloves.
  7. Cook on medium for about 10 minutes until a syrup is formed.
  8. Remove and let cool.
  9. To assemble; divide peaches among 4 wine glasses.
  10. Pour syrup over peaches and garnish with fresh mint if desired.
  11. Serve with biscotti.
title: Pesche al Vino

directions:
1. Slice eggs in half lengthwise; remove yolks and mash.
  2. Stir in remaining ingredients.
  3. Fill whites with mixture using a spoon or pastry tube.
  4. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
title: Pretty in Pink Pretzels

directions:
1. Cut the zucchinis in half lengthwise, then slice into ¼ – ½-inch thick half moons.
  2. Heat the oil and a little butter, if desired, on medium heat.
  3. Add the zucchini, mushrooms and garlic.
  4. Sauté until vegetables are just tender.
  5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
title: Zucchini with Mushrooms

directions:
1. Heat the butter in a medium skillet with a lid; add the carrots and salt.
  2. Stir to coat well with butter and to distribute the salt.
  3. Cover and cook on low heat until tender, 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
  4. Do not over cook.
  5. Stir in the parsley and serve at once.
title: Skillet Carrots

directions:
1. Thinly slice the apples into 24¼-inch-thick slices.
  2. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons cheese over one half of the tortilla.
  3. Place four apple slices, barely overlapping, on top of cheese.
  4. Then sprinkle 2 more tablespoons of cheese on top of the apples and fold the tortilla in half.
  5. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
  6. Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook three quesadillas until the cheese melts and the tortillas are golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side.
  7. Repeat with the remaining butter and tortillas. Serve hot and plain.
title: Apple Cheddar Quesadillas

directions:
1. Put enough oil to come to a depth of at least 1 inch in a large, deep skillet or saucepan.
  2. The broader the vessel, the more of these you can cook at once, but the more oil you will use. (they cook very quickly, so don't worry if your pan is narrow)
  3. Turn the heat to medium-high; you want the temperature to be at about 350°F when you start cooking.
  4. Stack the tortillas and cut them, pie-like into 4 to 8 wedges.
  5. Fry as many at once as you will fit without crowding, turning if necessary.
  6. Total cooking time will be about 2 minutes; the chips should not brown, but just begin to darken in color.
  7. Remove with a tongs or slotted spoon and drain on paper towels or paper bags.
  8. Sprinkle with salt and serve hot or at room temperature.
title: Fried Tortilla Chips

directions:
1. Place batter in preheated, pregreased iron skillet.
  2. Preheat oven to 350°F.
  3. Bake for 35 minutes or until golden brown.
title: Froggy's Cornbread

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F.
  2. Season the spareribs with salt and pepper generously on both sides.
  3. Place on a roasting rack in a pan and roast for 30 minutes.
  4. Turn the spareribs over and continue to roast for another 30 minutes.
title: Simple Oven-roasted Spareribs

directions:
1. Trim the stem and root ends of a radish (make sure it’s small enough to fit the individual section of an ice-cube tray), and use a paring knife to scrape off most of the red skin.
  2. Leave just enough red to give the radish a veined appearance.
  3. Rinse the radish off, and use a small melon baller to cut ½-inch-diameter hole into the radish.
  4. Fit an olive, cut side out, into the hole, and place the radish in the ice-cube tray.
  5. Repeat this process until the tray is full, then pour water over the eyeballs, and freeze.
title: Eyeball Highball

directions:
1. Cut eggplants into diagonal slices; dredge in flour; beat together egg, oil, salt and pepper.
  2. Dip eggplant slices in egg mixture, then in seasoned bread crumbs; put in greased baking pan and cover with foil pierced with fork to make air vents.
  3. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes.
  4. Unwrap, top each slice of eggplant with a slice of tomato and sprinkle with shredded cheese.
  5. Return to oven and bake 10 minutes more or until cheese is bubbly.
title: Oven-fried Eggplant

directions:
1. Put butter in a mixing bowl.
  2. Mix with electric mixer (medium/low speed).
  3. Gradually add honey, then bacon.
  4. Refrigerate (up to one week).
title: Marie Callanders' Honey Bacon Butter

directions:
1. Season oysters with salt and pepper.
  2. Slice pimento into 12 strips, placing one strip on each oyster.
  3. Wrap each oyster with a strip of bacon, closing with a toothpick or skewer.
  4. Broil about 8 minutes, browning bacon to a golden crisp.
title: Oysters in Blankets

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
  2. Cut a very thin slice from bottom of each tomato so that it won't wobble.
  3. Do not cut into the liquid part of the tomato.
  4. Cut a ½ inch slice off tops of tomatoes and scoop out seeds and pulp from cavity, leaving the shell of the tomato intact and being careful not to penetrate the bottom.
  5. Sprinkle insides of tomatoes with salt and freshly ground pepper.
  6. Put ½ tablespoon buttermilk in bottom of each shell.
  7. Fill each shell with a raw egg, which will come almost to the top of tomato.
  8. Carefully spoon 1 tablespoon buttermilk on top of each.
  9. Sprinkle with salt.
  10. Place in shallow baking dish and bake 25 minutes, or until eggs are set but not overcooked.
title: Buttermilk Eggs in Tomato Shells

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
  2. Separate each biscuit dough into 8 biscuits.
  3. Cut each biscuit into 6 pieces and place the pieces into a large bowl.
  4. In a small bowl, combine the sugar, cinnamon and raisins.
  5. Sprinkle the cinnamon mixture over the biscuit pieces and toss until evenly coated.
  6. Place the dough mixture into a bundt pan that has been lightly coated with nonstick vegetable spray.
  7. Bake for 30 minutes let cool for 10 minutes, then invert the pan to release the babka ring.
title: Mr. Food's Pull-apart Polish Babka

directions:
1. Melt the fat in the kettle and add the diced onions.
  2. Cook until brown, then add flour, stirring constantly.
  3. Add milk, a little at a time, stirring constantly.
  4. When the soup is hot and thickened, add the cheese and stir until it's combined.
  5. Season with salt, pepper, paprika and serve.
title: 1918 Cream of Onion and Cheese Soup

directions:
1. Place all ingredients in your machines fully assembled pan and in the order specified by your machines manufacturer.
  2. Select the basic or white cycle and press start.
  3. After the first 10 minutes of kneading check the dough and make any necessary adjustments.
title: Strawberry Bread I

directions: 1. Process cranberries and oranges in food processor then place in mixing bowl and stir in remaining ingredients.
title: Cranberry Pecan Relish

directions:
1. Combine first 5 ingredients in a large dutch oven.
  2. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
  3. Add cranberries, reduce heat and simmer 25 minutes, stirring frequently.
  4. Quickly ladle cranberry mixture into hot sterilized jars, leaving ½ inch headspace.
  5. Cover at once with metal lids, and screw bands tight.
  6. Process in boiling water-bath 10 minutes.
title: Spiced Cranberries

directions:
1. In large pan dry fry almonds over medium heat until they look brown.
  2. Place them to one side.
  3. Rinse fish and dry with kitchen paper.
  4. Place a tablespoon of flour on a plate and roll fish until nicely coated.
  5. Turn heat to medium hot and melt a chunk of butter in the pan.
  6. Add trout and cook uncovered 5 minutes per side.
  7. Return almonds to pan to rewarm before serving.
title: Trout with Almonds

directions:
1. Peel cabbage leaf by leaf and cut out center stems.
  2. Roll up tight as if making cigars and cut across into shreds as thin as possible.
  3. Heat oil and toss in a handful of the cabbage shreds.
  4. Cook for 2 minutes the scoop out to drain.
  5. Repeat until all cabbage is cooked then sprinkle with salt and sugar and eat hot.
title: Cabbage Fries

directions:
1. Combine all ingredients.
  2. Store in airtight container.
  3. Give mix with the recipes for dressing and dip makes ½ cup of mix.
title: Ranch-style Dressing and Dip Mix

directions:
1. Peel eggs and slice into ¼ inch thick rings then melt butter in skillet and add milk.
  2. Gradually stir in flour and cook, stirring constant for 5 minutes.
  3. Add eggs then season with salt, pepper, rosemary and thyme.
  4. Serve on hot fresh biscuits.
title: Creamed Hard-boiled Eggs

directions:
1. Place a couple of leaves of kale on each of 4 individual salad plates.
  2. Equally divide the endive and oranges on each plate, sprinkle pecans on top, and add a spoonful of dressing. I suggest vinaigrette.
title: Endive and Orange Salad

directions:
1. Drain liquid off salsa and set aside.
  2. Dice tofu. Soak solid remains from salsa and diced tofu in wine overnight.
  3. Lay out shredded lettuce on a platter.
  4. Crack three eggs into a mixing bowl and add in set-aside salsa "juice".
  5. Fry up as an omelet, and lay out on the lettuce platter.
  6. Pour salsa/tofu/wine mix into the egg. Roll up.
  7. Garnish with mozzarella. Serve hot.
title: Salsa Explosion

directions:
1. Dice the vegetables; mix
  2. Cut the lemon in half; squeeze
  3. Salt to taste
title: Diced Tomato and Cucumber Salad

directions:
1. Peel potatoes and cut into chunks about 2 inches in size. Place in large pot of salted water (at least 1 teaspoon of salt in the water) and boil 15 minutes or until potatoes break easily when pierced with a fork.
  2. Drain potatoes well but leave them in the pot.
  3. Add hot milk, beginning with the smaller amount. Add butter. Mash with potato masher and add more milk, butter, salt and pepper if necessary to suit your taste.
title: Mashed Potatoes I

directions:
1. Put cardamom in the milk and bring to boil.
  2. Reduce the heat and continue to stir till reduced by around one-third – care should be taken that the milk particles does not get stuck to the pan as it will spoil the taste.
  3. Remove cardamoms from milk by using a strainer.
  4. Add the copped almonds, pistachios and crushed saffron.
  5. Pour the mixtures in small containers or cups.
  6. Freeze until firm.
  7. Remove from the refrigerator about 5 minutes before serving.
title: Kulfi Ice Cream

directions:
1. Boil dates in lightly salted water stirring frequently until it is a thick paste.
  2. Mix in finely chopped nuts.
  3. A traditional variant is to strain the pulp out of the paste producing a honey-like date syrup. This procedure uses considerably more dates and can take several days to produce sufficient syrup.
title: Iraqi Charoset

directions:
1. Pour the beer into a glass.
  2. Next, fill a shot glass with the amaretto and rum.
  3. Use a match to light the shot on fire.
  4. Drop the shot into the beer.
title: Flaming Dr. Pepper

directions:
1. Peel the oranges and lemons.
  2. Cut up the fruit and squeeze them into the crock pot.
  3. A garlic press works, or some kind of juicer or fruit squeezer.
  4. Put the remaining fruit pulp into the crock pot as well.
  5. Add the raisins, honey, and spices.
  6. Stir.
  7. ''note: do not add whiskey yet!'' If you cook the whiskey, even for a short time, the alcohol will start to evaporate. Start the crock pot and let the mixture cook for about 2 – 4 hours.
  8. Stir occasionally.
  9. It's complete when the fruit pulp gets cooked down.
  10. Strain into a pitcher. Mash down the fruit in the strainer to get all the liquid.
  11. Now add the whiskey to the pitcher and stir.
  12. Taste, and add more whiskey to your liking.
  13. Serve hot in shot glasses, espresso cups, or coffee mugs.
  14. After the first round, each individual serving can be heated in the microwave.
title: Boilo

directions: 1. Layer stout over ale.
title: Black and Tan

directions:
1. Boil the water in a pot. Add the coffee to the water and bring to a boil over low heat.
  2. Remove from the heat for five minutes to allow the coffee to settle.
  3. Put the cardamom in the pot, strain the coffee into it and add the saffron.
  4. Bring back to boil once and serve.
title: Qahwa Arabeya

directions:
1. Fill a medium hot bar glass two-thirds full of boiling water, stir up, and grate a little nutmeg on top.
  2. Serve with a spoon.
title: Apple Toddy

directions:
1. Stir the first three ingredients together in a small bar glass.
  2. Grate the nutmeg on top.
title: Brandy Sling

directions: 1. Fill tumbler with boiling water and whiskey, grate nutmeg on top.
title: Hot Whiskey Sling

directions:
