1. Preheat deep fryer to 350 °F (175 °C).
  2. Slice mozzarella into sticks 1 – 3 cm in diameter.
  3. In a small bowl, whisk egg.
  4. Fill another small bowl with bread crumbs.
  5. Dip 3 – 4 sticks at a time into the egg.
  6. Shake excess egg off sticks and place them in the bread crumbs.
  7. Shake bowl of bread crumbs, evenly coating all sticks. Add more bread crumbs as needed.
  8. Place coated sticks to the side and repeat for remaining sticks.
  9. After all sticks have been coated, repeat the egg-dip and crumb-coat for each once more.
  10. Place all sticks in fryer basket and submerge in 350 °F oil.
  11. Let sit for 30 seconds, gently rocking basket occasionally.
  12. Lift basket and let cool for a few seconds. If cheese is not beginning to ooze out from half the sticks, resubmerge in oil for another 10–15 seconds, gently shaking the basket. Repeat until the cheese is just starting to ooze out.
  13. Dump onto paper towel and pat off excess oil gently.
  14. Serve hot.
title: Mozzarella Sticks

directions:
1. In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, honey and cinnamon. Stir well to blend ingredients.
  2. Arrange fruit on plates and drizzle the honey-yogurt dressing on top.
title: Fresh Fruit Salad with Honey Yogurt Dressing

directions:
1. Combine apples, celery, raisins, and walnuts in a bowl.
  2. Stir.
  3. Add yogurt and stir all ingredients together.
  4. Chill to blend flavors or enjoy right away.
title: Low-cal Waldorf Salad

directions:
1. Using a spoon or melon-baller, scoop out the melon then place in a blender or juicer.
  2. Coarsely chop pears and place in blender or juicer.
  3. Add ginger and blend until smooth or to desired consistency then pour into a glass and serve.
title: Ginger, Melon and Pear Beverage

directions:
1. Core and stem the pears, then coarsely chop and add to a blender.
  2. Add the lime juice.
  3. Peel the kiwi then coarsely chop and add to blender.
  4. Add ice, cover blender and blend until desired consistency.
  5. Pour into a glass and garnish with thin-sliced pear wedges.
title: Pear, Kiwi and Lime Juice

directions: 1. Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth or to desired consistency then serve in glasses.
title: Frozen Blueberry Smoothie

directions:
1. Cut each avocado in half lengthwise around the seed in the middle of the avocado.
  2. Scoop the seed out of the middle with a spoon.
  3. Use the spoon to scoop the avocado flesh into a bowl.
  4. Mash the avocado with a fork until smooth.
  5. Mix in the remaining ingredients until well combined.
title: Guacamole with Tomato

directions:
1. In glasses, layer pineapple, raspberries, yogurt, banana, and dates.
  2. Sprinkle the top with almonds.
title: Fruity Breakfast Parfaits

directions:
1. Line pan with cooking oil.
  2. Place cabbage in pan. Fry until tender and brown.
title: Mrs. Truman's Cabbage

directions:
1. Blend yogurt, mayonnaise, onion, parsley, celery, and pepper.
  2. Stir in remaining ingredients.
  3. Cover and refrigerate for several hours.
title: Creamy Potato Salad

directions:
1. Cook macaroni as directed; drain.
  2. Put cheese and milk in microwave safe bowl. Heat in microwave until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes on high.
  3. Combine cheese mixture and macaroni. Add salt and pepper to taste.
title: Macaroni and Cheese I

directions: 1. Measure into blender and blend at high speed until smooth
title: Vera's Banana Milkshake

directions:
1. Blend fruit with syrup at high speed until smooth.
  2. Pour puréed fruit back into measuring cup and add enough syrup or water to make one cup.
  3. Dissolve gelatin in boiling water, pour into a bowl (deep enough to whip gelatin later).
  4. Stir in fruit puree.
  5. Cool.
  6. Refrigerate gelatin mixture until it piles softly, but is not firm.
  7. With cold beaters, whip the gelatin until foamy and doubled in volume.
  8. Refrigerate until firm.
title: Fluffy Fruit Gelatin

directions:
1. Cook broccoli, onions, and carrots in a small amount of water until tender and set aside.
  2. In a saucepan, melt margarine and stir in flour. Add milk slowly while stirring. Cook until sauce thickens, stirring occasionally.
  3. Add cheese and stir until melted.
  4. Add vegetables to cheese sauce and stir.
  5. Split open potatoes. Pour equal amounts of vegetable cheese mixture over each potato. Top with sliced tomatoes.
title: Pizza Potatoes

directions:
1. Cut fruit into pieces, and mash through a strainer or with a fork. (If using peaches, peel and core first.)
  2. Crush ice cubes. Beat together fruit, milk, and yogurt in a blender or food processor. Add crushed ice and beat again.
title: Refreshing Summer Shake

directions:
1. Cut melon in half and scrape out seeds from center.
  2. Heap fresh berries and/or fruit into hollowed out part of melon.
  3. Top with low-fat yogurt, cottage cheese, or sherbet if desired.
title: Stuffed Melon

directions:
1. Place ingredients in food processor.
  2. Using the metal blade, process ingredients continuously for 2 or 3 minutes.
  3. The ground peanuts will form a ball, which will slowly disappear.
  4. Stop machine.
  5. Scrape the sides of the container with a rubber spatula.
  6. Continue to process until the desired smoothness is obtained.
title: Old-fashioned Peanut Butter: Food Processor Method

directions: 1. Combine ingredients. Add salt and pepper to taste.
title: Chicken Salad

directions:
1. Boil chicken. Remove from stock and debone. Return to stock.
  2. Add salt, pepper, 2 sliced medium onions and 1 cup ketchup. Simmer until thickened.
  3. Serve over rice.
title: Red Chicken Stew

directions:
1. Cut biscuits in half.
  2. Roll each half around a party sausage.
  3. Bake at 350°F until lightly brown.
  4. Serve with honey mustard sauce.
title: Party Sausage Appetizer

directions:
1. Pour oil in baking pan to ½ inch high and heat pan until hot.
  2. Pour mixture in hot pan.
  3. Bake at 350 °F for 20 minutes.
title: Aunt Eunice Jackson's Cornbread

directions:
1. Boil shad (without the roe) in water and vinegar with seasonings for 20 minutes. Drain off the water.
  2. Put shad in a heavy, tightly covered roaster and bake in 200 degree oven for 5–6 hours. Add roe and about 1 qt. Water 30 minutes before the shad is done.
  3. Put strips of bacon across shad and brown under broiler (to minimum 155 degrees) before serving.
title: Boneless Baked Shad

directions:
1. Wrap shad roe with bacon and keep in place with a toothpick.
  2. Place in a 350 °F oven until the bacon is sizzling.
  3. The bacon should be a minimum 155 °F and the roe 145 °F.
  4. The roe should be seared on the outside but still moist on the inside.
title: Baked Shad Roe

directions:
1. Saute shad roe in butter.
  2. Sear on the outside but leave roe moist on the inside with minimum 145 °F.
title: Sauteed Shad Roe

directions:
1. Spread one side of each of the slices of bread with butter; turn buttered side of four slices over and top with a slice of cheese.
  2. Layer tomato slices evenly over the cheese. Sprinkle marjoram over tomato slices. Top with bacon and remaining cheese slices.
  3. Place remaining bread slices, buttered side up on top of cheese slices.
  4. Place a large skillet over medium heat until hot. Cook sandwiches until golden, turning once.
title: Grilled Tomato Sandwiches

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 °F
  2. Make shallow slits around the middle as if you were cutting the potatoes in half lengthwise.
  3. Bake until done, 30 to 60 minutes, depending on size.
  4. Peel broccoli stems. Steam whole stalks just until tender and chop finely.
  5. Carefully slice the potatoes in half and scoop the insides into a bowl with the broccoli.
  6. Add the milk, 3/4 cup cheese and pepper.
  7. Mash together until the mixture is pale green with dark green flecks.
  8. Heap into the potato jackets and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
  9. Return to oven to heat through (about 15 minutes).
title: Broccoli Baked Potatoes

directions:
1. In a small bowl, mix chicken, mayonnaise, relish, salt, and pepper.
  2. Add other ingredients as desired.
  3. Serve with crackers, as a sandwich on whole wheat bread, or on top of a green salad.
title: Quick Chicken Salad

directions:
1. Coarsely chop peaches; reserve juice.
  2. In a saucepan, mix peaches and juice with honey and cinnamon.
  3. Dissolve cornstarch in water; add to the peaches.
  4. Heat on medium heat until mixture boils and thickens, about 4–5 minutes.
  5. Spoon ⅓ cup over hot pancakes. Reserve the fruit-based pancake topping in the refrigerator but pour or spoon remaining contents into the glass jar.
title: Peach Pancake Topping

directions:
1. Heat spinach and drain well.
  2. While spinach is cooling, brown onions in butter for 4–5 minutes.
  3. Combine the spinach and onions in a bowl with bread crumbs.
  4. Season with salt and pepper, if desired, and add eggs.
  5. Heat a nonstick pan and coat with cooking spray. Drop spoonfuls (about ⅓ cup) of spinach mixture into skillet and cook both sides until lightly browned.
title: Spinach Cakes

directions: 1. In a small bowl, mix tuna and sandwich spread.
title: Quick Tuna Spread

directions:
1. Prepare macaroni according to package directions; drain and rinse.
  2. Combine mixed vegetables and cheese. Add mayonnaise or salad dressing and seasonings to vegetable mixture.
  3. Toss with macaroni.
title: Vegetable All-summer Salad

directions:
1. Mix cornmeal and salt.
  2. Bring water to boil.
  3. Introduce cornmeal to boiling water and mix well.
  4. Continue to beat slowly – stirring for about five minutes or until smooth and thick.
title: Blue Corn Porridge

directions:
1. Fill large cooking pot with hominy and water. Cook hominy, covered, over medium heat until kernels burst open and are “al dente” (several hours).
  2. Add remaining ingredients, cover, and simmer until meat is tender (2 or 3 hours).
title: Pueblo Posole

directions:
1. Put all ingredients into a big bowl.
  2. Mix.
  3. Enjoy!
title: Our Fruit salad

directions:
1. Begin with thoroughly chilled cream.
  2. Chill mixing bowl and beaters.
  3. Whip the cream on medium speed.
  4. Add sugar (2 tablespoons to ¼ cup granulated) and any flavorings while whipping cream.
  5. Cream is whipped when soft peaks form.
title: Whipped Cream

directions:
1. Thoroughly mix up all of the ingredients using your hands.
  2. Press the mixture into a baking tray about 1 cm thick.
  3. Bake at 175 °C / 350 °F for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
  4. Best eaten hot, though you can store it in an airtight container and eat cold.
title: Coconut Oat Flapjack

directions:
1. 1st, take out a medium-sized salad bowl and put in 2 large leaves of lettuce.
  2. Then put in ¼ a cup of roasted almonds, sprinkle in some basil, sprinkle in some thyme leaves, and you're done!
  3. Enjoy!
title: Gafna's Delight

directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
  2. Stir ingredients together.
  3. Place in the oven for 1 hour. Stir contents occasionally during cooking.
title: Cranberry Sauce with Bourbon

directions:
1. Mix all ingredients together in a casserole dish
  2. Bake for 1 hour at 350 °F
title: Corn Casserole

directions:
1. Boil water and honey. Carefully remove the foam.
  2. Add all remaining ingredients except Vodka. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
  3. Allow mixture to cool slightly. When cooled add the Vodka and stir until well mixed.
  4. Add everything including solids to a suitable container, I usually distribute into two containers splitting solids evenly.
  5. Store in a cool dark place for one week. The longer this sits the better the flavor will be.
  6. Serve room temperature, chilled or even warmed. Just serve it often.
  7. For Storage, you just can't beat the green Grolsch beer bottle. I always save mine for this purpose as well as making the flavored Olive oils that everyone enjoys. If you go to the bigger Liquor stores, you can find the 50-ounce Grolsch bottles. This recipe will nearly fill both of them. The 12 ounce bottles also make a great gift for those close friends that you may want to share with.
title: Krupnik

directions:
1. Combine ingredients in blender.
  2. Add a couple of ice cubes and blend briefly.
  3. Allow to set for a few minutes.
  4. Pour contents over ice in salt-rimmed glass.
title: Beer Margarita

directions:
1. Place butter in heavy skillet.
  2. Add ham and onion.
  3. Sauté over low heat until tender (approximately 2 minutes).
  4. Set aside.
  5. Slice each bagel into 4 thin slices.
  6. Arrange 6 bagel slices at bottom of lightly greased baking dish.
  7. Top bagels with ham and onion mixture.
  8. Then top with cheddar cheese.
  9. Finally top with remaining bagel slices.
  10. In a separate bowl whisk together eggs, milk, parsley, and salt and pepper to taste.
  11. Pour the egg mixture over the bagel layers.
  12. Bake at 375°F for approximately 30 minutes or until eggs are firm and cooked through.
title: Bagels and Egg Casserole

directions:
1. Combine all ingredients except mint in the container of an electric blender
  2. Process until smooth.
  3. Garnish with mint.
title: Peach Yogurt Shake

directions:
1. blend ingredients together
  2. Serve with your choice of fruits or vegetables or crackers
title: Banana Dippie

directions:
1. Melt the butter with the oil.
  2. Combine the flour and salt in a bowl, make a well in the center, and add oil and butter.
  3. Stir vigorously until combined, and then add water until the dough holds together and comes away from the sides of the bowl.
  4. Wrap the ball of dough in plastic and let rest in the refrigerator while preparing the stuffing.
title: Cheese Sanbusa Turnovers

directions:
1. Blend them all in a food processor till they become frothy.
  2. Serve immediately.
  3. Enjoy!
title: Strawban Delight (Strawberry Banana Smoothie)

directions:
1. Put provolone cheese, spinach, and carrot stick on chicken breasts.
  2. Roll and secure with toothpicks.
  3. Brown in frying pan with oil for 5 minutes.
  4. Add can of flavored diced tomatoes.
  5. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
  6. Serve and enjoy.
title: Chicken Pizzola

directions:
1. Pinch the leaves off a strawberry.
  2. Cut the strawberry down the middle, from top to bottom.
  3. Now the halves easily slice into heart-shaped pieces. Trim as needed. Serve with Heart-shaped Strawberry Pancakes.
title: Easy Strawberry Hearts

directions:
1. Dilute yeast in water.
  2. Add salt, then half of four and stir.
  3. Mix remainder of flour with hand until dough is firm.
  4. Knead until dough is smooth.
  5. Divide dough (unless you want a large loaf) and put in a covered bowl.
  6. Let rise until dough has <u>almost</u> doubled in size.
  7. Sprinkle a light layer of flour on a cookie sheet (unless you use those silicone mats) and put dough on cookie sheet (if your making two loaves put each on separate cookie sheet) take a brush (one that you would use for basting) and spread some flour over dough.
  8. Bake in 400°F oven for approximately 30 minutes or until done.
  9. Wrap in cloth while cooling to keep crust soft.
title: Prosphora

directions:
1. Cut pork into 4 pieces.
  2. Place in large soup kettle. Cover with at least 2 quarts water.
  3. Heat to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for several hours until meat is tender. Remove scum.
  4. Drain sauerkraut, reserving juice.
  5. Add cabbage, sauerkraut, onion, and garlic. Season to taste.
  6. Cover and bring to a boil again, then reduce to a simmer for 1 hour.
  7. Add mushrooms and cook until tender; remove meat.
  8. Stir in more sauerkraut juice, if needed, to make soup more sour. (If juice is added, continue cooking for an additional 30 minutes).
  9. Cut meat into slices and serve with soup.
title: Kopustu Sriuba Su Kiauliena Ir Graybais

directions:
1. Cut up fruit and remove seeds if any.
  2. Place ingredients for desired drink in blender.
  3. Blend 30 to 45 seconds.
title: Yogurt Shake

directions:
1. Cut up fruit.
  2. Place ingredients for desired drink in blender.
  3. Blend 30 to 45 seconds.
title: Tropical Refresher

directions:
1. Cut the apples then all the other fruit
  2. Place it in a bowl refrigerate before a meal
title: Salata

directions:
1. Boil the liquid until reduced by two thirds.
  2. Let it cool.
  3. Produces 200 ml (7 fl oz)
title: Defrutum

directions:
1. Place the yogurt in a dish and beat until smooth. Stir in the honey, leaving a slight marbled effect.
  2. Cut the fruits into wedges or bite-sized pieces, or leave whole.
  3. Arrange the fruits on a platter with the bowl of dip in the center. Serve chilled.
title: Frudités with Honey Dip

directions:
1. Toast the brioche slices until golden on both sides. Spread four of the slices thickly with the chocolate spread and sprinkle over the chopped pistachios in an even layer.
  2. Place the remaining brioche slices on top of the chocolate and nuts and press down gently. Using a sharp knife, cut the sandwiches in half diagonally and serve immediately.
title: Chocolate Brioche Sandwiches

directions:
1. In a bowl, add the flour, and mix in the nutmeg, salt and beaten eggs yolks.
  2. Stir in the milk, beating constantly so that the mixture is smooth.
  3. Whisk the egg whites until they are stiff, and add the parsley to this.
  4. Fold the egg white mix into the batter, mixing well.
  5. Pour entire mixture into frying pan, and cook as you would a regular omelette (to desired doneness).
title: Crempog Las

directions:
1. Sift the flour and salt into a bowl.
  2. With your hand or a spoon, make a hole (or a well) in the center.
  3. Crack the eggs and slowly mix into the flour.
  4. As the mix thickens, gradually add the milk, stirring constantly.
  5. When the batter is free of lumps, add the butter and mix again.
  6. Drop large spoonfuls of the batter onto a hot griddle or frying pan that has been well-greased.
  7. Cook the ffroes until they are browned, and then flip and cook the other side.
  8. When ffroes are cooked, lavish with a lot of salty butter.
title: Ffroes

directions:
1. Clean and peel the potatoes; slice into potato-chip size.
  2. Place slices in layer on the bottom of a liberally buttered casserole dish.
  3. Sprinkle a layer of chopped onion on top, and then repeat the process until ingredients are used, making sure the top layer is potatoes.
  4. Add pats of butter or margarine on top potato layer, along with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Cover casserole dish with aluminum foil.
  6. Bake at 350 °F for about one hour; serve hot or cold.
title: Teisen Nionod

directions:
1. Split the chicken in 2.
  2. Rub all over with a lemon half.
  3. Combine the salt, pepper and paprika and sprinkle it over the chicken halves on both sides.
  4. Mix the melted butter with the thyme.
  5. Spear a lemon half on a fork, dip it in the butter mixture and use it to baste the chicken skin.
  6. Place the chicken on the BBQ grill 3 inches from the coals and grill for a total of 25 to 30 minutes, turning often, until tender.
  7. Keep the butter warm.
  8. Use the same lemon half to baste the chicken often.
  9. This will make the skin crisp and tasty while flavoring the chicken.
title: Lemon BBQ Chicken

directions:
1. Remove all visible fat from chicken.
  2. Place each breast in the center of a 12 inch square piece of aluminum foil.
  3. Fold the sides of the foil up so the lemon juice won't run out.
  4. Halve the lemons and squeeze the juice of ½ lemon over each chicken breast.
  5. Sprinkle each with ¼ teaspoon tarragon and pepper.
  6. Fold the foil together and seal well to secure the chicken inside.
  7. Place the wrapped chicken in a shallow baking dish and bake at 350f for about 45 minutes.
title: Lemon Chicken I

directions:
1. Place all and cover with 2cm (1 inch) of water over the top of the rice
  2. Bring to the boil, then turn down heat to lowest and simmer for 15 – 20 minutes.
title: Geel Rys

directions:
1. Cut off the top of the onion, remove the skin. Cut a "X" over the onion, and turn it 90°, cut another "X". Keep doing it until you cut at least 10 – 16 times. Remember to leave the bottom intact, otherwise the flower will be destroyed. After doing this, cut the core out of the center.
  2. Put the onion into an iced water for 2 minutes, then carefully spread the onion petals apart.
title: Blooming Onion

directions:
1. In a large pot saute onion until golden.
  2. Add root vegetables and saute for 2 minutes.
  3. Add ½ inch of water to pot, salt and pepper, place sausage on top and add kale last.
  4. Don't mix!.
  5. Cover pot with lid and cook until potatoes are soft.
  6. Check to make sure water has not totally evaporated.
  7. Take out sausage and put aside.
  8. Add butter to pot and mash vegetables to desired consistency.
  9. Serve immediately along with sausage.
title: Mashed Potatoes-Carrots-Parsnip-Kale

directions:
1. Mix equal parts parsley, chives, tarragon and chervil.
  2. Mince well.
  3. Add during last few minutes of cooking.
title: Basic Fines Herbes

directions:
1. Grease a 20.5 x 25 cm (8 x 10 inch) roasting tin.
  2. Blend the fresh yeast with 300 ml (½ pint) warm water.
  3. If using dried yeast, sprinkle it into 300 ml (½ pint) warm water with the sugar and leave for 15 minutes, until frothy.
  4. Put the flour and salt in a bowl and rub in 15 g (½ oz) of the lard.
  5. Make a well in the centre and pour in the yeast liquid.
  6. Beat together to make a dough that leaves the sides of the bowl clean, adding more water if necessary.
  7. Turn on to a lightly floured surface and knead well for about 10 minutes, until smooth and elastic.
  8. Place in a clean bowl.
  9. Cover with a clean tea-towel and leave in a warm place for about 1 hour, until doubled in size.
  10. Turn the dough on to a floured surface and roll out to a rectangle about 0.5 cm (¼ inch) thick.
  11. Dot one-third of the remaining lard and the butter over the surface of the dough.
  12. Sprinkle over one-third of the fruit, peel and sugar.
  13. Fold the dough in three, folding the bottom third up and the top third down.
  14. Give a quarter-turn, then repeat the process twice more.
  15. Roll the dough out to fit the prepared tin.
  16. Put in the tin, cover and leave in a warm place for 30 minutes, until puffy.
  17. Score the top in a criss-cross pattern with a knife, then bake at 220°C (425°F) mark 7 for about 30 minutes, until well risen and golden brown.
  18. Turn out and serve immediately or leave to cool on a wire rack.
  19. Serve plain or with butter.
title: Lardy Cake

directions:
1. Bring the water to a boil in a large saucepan then add the salt and pour the meal into the centre of the pan so that it forms a pile (do not stir).
  2. Remove the pan from the heat, cover with a lid and allow to sit for 5 minutes.
  3. Take a large fork (2 pronged meat fork is best) and stir the mixture until the pap is a fine-grained crumble (similar to coucous).
  4. Re-cover set over a low heat and allow to simmer gently for 45 minutes.
  5. Serve hot in place of rice or mashed potatoes.
title: Putu (Krummelpap)

directions:
1. Mix all together.
  2. Churn in ice cream maker (or freeze, stirring regularly).
title: Pelotazo Malagueno

directions:
1. Peel an apple and remove the core.
  2. Slice in rings.
  3. Place on a lightly greased cookie sheet, or on clear plastic wrap laid out on a cookie sheet.
  4. Dry in an electric oven at low or warm temperatures, in a gas oven the pilot light is sufficient.
  5. Drying takes 6-9 hours, making this a good overnight project.
  6. The size of the apple slices and your oven temperature are the variables you will have to experiment with.
  7. The apples need not be dried to a crisp.
  8. Store in an airtight container.
  9. These should last several weeks at room temperature.
  10. Good for traveling!
title: Apple Ring Snacks

directions: 1. Add spices, lemon and honey to cider then simmer 10 minutes.
title: Hot Apple Cider

directions: 1. Combine all ingredients and store tightly covered in a cool dry place.
title: Down Home Apple Pie Spice

directions: 1. Combine all ingredients and store in cool dry place.
title: Poultry Seasoning

directions: 1. Combine all ingredients and store in cool dry place.
title: Meat and Vegetable Blend Seasoning

directions: 1. Mix all ingredients together.
title: Pina Colada Dip

directions: 1. Combine ingredients in a shallow dish.
title: Port and Honey Marinade

directions:
1. Sprinkle ¼ cup of sugar over berries then set aside.
  2. Mix flour, sugar and salt.
  3. Combine salad oil and milk in a small bowl and whip with fork then pour over flour mixture.
  4. Mix with fork until moist then turn into greased square cake pan.
  5. Press dough into pan building up edges about one inch deep.
  6. Spread berries over the dough.
  7. Mix sugar, flour and salt together then cut in butter until crumbly and sprinkle over fruit.
  8. Bake at 425°F for 45 minutes.
title: Blueberry Streusel Cake

directions:
1. Place mayonnaise in a large heavy duty plastic bag.
  2. Add cauliflower then seal and shake to coat.
  3. Place breadcrumbs in a large heavy duty plastic bag.
  4. Add half of cauliflower mixture then seal and shake to coal.
  5. Spread in a single layer onto a lightly greased baking sheet.
  6. Repeat with remaining cauliflower and breadcrumbs.
  7. Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
title: Fried Cauliflower

directions:
1. In a bowl combine corn bread mix, eggs, milk and yogurt until blended.
  2. Stir in corn and cheese then pour into a greased rectangular baking dish and bake at 400°F for 22 minutes.
  3. Cut into squares and serve warm.
title: Cheddar Corn Bread

directions:
1. Put onions on the bottom of the crockpot, then the roast on top of them.
  2. Pour the salsa over everything and cook on low for 4 – 6 hours until pork is cooked and onions are tender.
title: 3-ingredient Crockpot Pork Roast

directions:
1. Open the whole tinned tomatoes and pour the juice into a deep container. Chop the tomatoes and add to the juice
  2. Grate the Cheese
  3. Prepare your chosen topping (ie. chop the ham, slice the mushrooms, etc.)
  4. Grill one side of the sliced white bread and turn over and slightly cook the other side
  5. Place a few spoons of the tomato on the bread and spread out evenly
  6. Top with cheese and your chosen toppings and place back under the grill
  7. Grill until the cheese has melted and serve with a sprig of parsley
title: White Bread Pizza

directions:
1. Preheat oven to 160<sup>o</sup>C (or 150<sup> o</sup>C for a fan-forced oven). Zest the oranges and pulverize with the castor sugar. If you do not have a food processor you can simply rub the zest into the sugar using the back of a spoon until the sugar turns orange. Add the flour to the pulverized zest mixture. Add the meted butter and the beaten egg and mix thoroughly. Bake in a lined (or very well greased) 20 cm cake tin (preferably a spring-form tin) for 90 minutes.
  2. While cake is baking make the syrup and mousse. The syrup is simply the juice and sugar mixed together and you may add a ¼ cup of Cointreau or other Orange flavoured liqueur for added flavour, if you wish. For the mousse beat the cream until soft peaks form and then for a further 30 seconds. Fold melted chocolate into the cream.
  3. hen the cake is cooked remove it from the pan and cut it in half horizontally while it is still hot. Quickly wash and line the baking pan with plastic wrap. Place the bottom half of the cake back into the plastic lined pan and pour on half the syrup evenly. Add the mousse and top with the other half of the cake. Pour the second half of the syrup evenly over the top of the cake.
  4. efrigerate cake for 2 hours and then remove the cake from the tin and place on a serving plate. Make the icing by adding the cream to the melted chocolate. Ice the cake and return finished cake to fridge until ready to serve. Store any unused portion of the cake in the refrigerator.
title: Jaffa Mousse Cake

directions: 1. Combine ingredients and store in an airtight container.
title: Gallic Herbes Blend

directions:
1. Combine all ingredients and mix well.
  2. Chill until ready to serve over your favorite salad.
title: Lemon Horseradish Salad Dressing

directions:
1. Cut up chicken and dip in beer.
  2. Put flour and cornmeal into a brown paper bag adding seasonings to taste.
  3. Put chicken pieces in bag one at a time and shake.
  4. Fry in lard in a hot cast iron skillet.
title: Hillbilly Fried Chicken

directions:
1. Combine flour and beer in a large bowl blending thoroughly.
  2. Cover and allow batter to sit at room temperature for at least 3 hours.
  3. Afterwards gently stir in the sugar and salt.
  4. Cut onions into one-fourth inch or larger slices then separate into rings.
  5. Heat shortening to 375°F.
  6. Dry sliced rings and roll in flour then dip onion rings into batter and fry until delicate golden brown.
  7. The batter can be made thicker by adding more flour or thinner by adding more beer.
title: Mclean Estate Beer Batter Onion Rings

directions:
1. Mix crab and bread crumbs together.
  2. Add remaining ingredients and toss gently.
  3. Turn into casserole dish and bake 20 minutes.
title: Crab Meat Tomato Delight

directions:
1. Cut peaches in half then cook on covered grill over medium indirect heat for 4 minutes.
  2. Turn and cook 4 minutes longer.
title: Savory Grilled Peaches

directions:
1. Drain can of asparagus tips and arrange on bottom of lightly buttered baking dish.
  2. Combine salt and breadcrumbs and spread over asparagus.
  3. Beat eggs slightly then add milk.
  4. Pour over ingredients in dish and sprinkle paprika over top.
  5. Place in cold oven then turn heat to 325°F and bake for 1 hour.
title: Asparagus Tip and Bread Crumb Omelet

directions: 1. Pour everything into a blender and blend on high.
title: Guava Strawberry Smoothie

directions:
1. Stir ingredients into softened butter.
  2. Cover and chill at least 8 hours.
  3. Serve on chicken breasts, baked potato|baked potatoes, steamed vegetables, or pasta. Reserve the sauce-based butter in the refrigerator.
title: Pesto Butter

directions:
1. Stir ingredients into softened butter.
  2. Cover and chill at least 8 hours.
  3. Serve on pancakes, sweet potatoes, winter squash, or gingerbread.
title: Pecan Butter

directions:
1. Stir ingredients into softened butter.
  2. Cover and chill at least 8 hours.
  3. Serve on pork chops or ham, toasted pound cake, waffles, or sweet potato biscuits.
title: Bourbon Butter

directions:
1. Stir ingredients into softened butter.
  2. Cover and chill at least 8 hours.
  3. Serve on steamed vegetables, fish, or chicken.
title: Herb Butter I

directions:
1. Combine first 3 ingredients in container of an electric blender.
  2. Process until basil is finely chopped; pour mixture into a small bowl.
  3. Add salt and pepper; stir well.
  4. Cover and chill until ready to use.
title: Basil Buttermilk Dressing

directions:
1. Combine ingredients in small bowl; stir until well blended.
  2. Chill.
  3. Refrigerate in tightly covered container.
title: Thousand Island Dressing I

directions:
1. Place the vegetables on the bottom of the pot, put the chicken on top,followed by the seasonings.
  2. Pour 3 cups of water over.
  3. Set it on low and cook for 8 to 10 hrs.
  4. Remove chicken.
  5. Add noodles and cook on high for 45 minutes, while you take the meat off the bones.
  6. Mix the meat in.
  7. This is like a very thick chicken soup and the basil makes this delicious!.
title: Crockpot Chicken and Noodles

directions:
1. Fry tortillas in small amount of oil.
  2. Fry eggs sunny side up.
  3. Place the tortillas on a plate and add the fried eggs.
  4. Pour salsa over the eggs then sprinkle with grated cheese.
title: Spanish Breakfast Eggs

directions:
1. Boil potatoes until soft then peel and press through ricer.
  2. Mix with milk, breadcrumbs, salt and egg.
  3. Mold into golf ball size balls.
  4. Flour and drop into boiling water and boil 10 minutes.
  5. Combine chicken and gravy and heat through.
  6. Serve dumplings with gravy poured over top.
title: Wonderful Chicken and Potato Dumplings

directions:
1. Melt margarine in milk.
  2. In casserole combine corns, sugar, flour and beaten eggs.
  3. Add warmed milk and margarine.
  4. Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
title: Corn Pudding I

directions:
1. Combine blueberries, sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg and bring to boiling point.
  2. Boil 5 minutes stirring occasionally.
title: Hot Spiced Blueberry Sauce

directions:
1. Puree yogurt and fruit in blender adding honey once the fruit is well blended.
  2. Pour mixture into a shallow container and freeze for 30 minutes.
  3. Spoon into blender and whip for 1 minute.
  4. Pour mixture into paper cups them freeze until firm.
title: Frozen Banana Yogurt

directions:
1. Grind bologna and peanuts then add relish and mix well.
  2. Add enough mayonnaise to moisten.
title: Bologna Nut Spread

directions:
1. Combine butter and garlic.
  2. Blend well.
title: Garlic Butter

directions:
1. Combine tomato and onion.
  2. Season to taste with salt and pepper and a dash of cumin.
title: Fresh Tomato Salsa I

directions:
1. Fill glass bottle about ⅔ full with washed raspberries.
  2. Pour vodka over them, filling bottle to top.
  3. Cap bottle and refrigerate several days before using, with soda or tonic water or anything else that suits you.
title: Raspberry Vodka

directions:
1. Process peach in food processor or blender until very smooth.
  2. Strain juice, if desired.
  3. Fill champagne flute ⅓ full of peach juice.
  4. Top with chilled champagne or dry sparkling wine.
  5. Stir once, very gently, to combine.
title: Bellini I

directions:
1. Wrap the peeled bananas in the bacon and grill until tender.
  2. Place in a casserole, season and then add the sweet corn.
  3. Thicken the mixture with 2 teaspoons cornmeal mixed with a little cold water. Pour over the bananas and sprinkle with breadcrumbs.
  4. Bake in an oven, pre-heated to 170°C for 15 to 20 minutes and serve.
title: Banana and Corn Casserole

directions:
1. Place apples in a shallow buttered 2-quart casserole.
  2. Combine honey, water, sugar and cinnamon mixing well then pour over apples turning apples to coat.
  3. Dot with butter.
  4. Cover and bake at 350°F for 20 minutes basting twice.
title: Home-baked Apple Quarters

directions:
1. Select a squat pumpkin rather than one that is upright for balance. Field pumpkins used for jack-o-lanterns do not work well. The Cinderella variety or Rouge Vif d'Etampes, as well as many others has the ideal bowl shape.
  2. Start by washing the pumpkin in warm soapy water rinse well and dry.
  3. Using a sharp knife, insert the tip about ⅓ of the way down, and cut away the top to form a lid.
  4. Scoop out the seeds (reserve for roasting) and stringy mass.
  5. Lightly oil the pumpkin inside and out and sprinkle the inside with salt.
  6. Place the pumpkin and lid on a parchment lined baking sheet or spray with an oil cooking spray.
  7. Bake a 325°F for 1 to 1½ hours depending on the size of the shell. This is the tricky part. An over baked shell will not support the weight of the soup so under-baking is preferred.
  8. Bake the pumpkin shell until it begins to soften.
  9. Remove from the oven and cool.
  10. Gently scoop out some of the soft pumpkin from the wall, being careful not to puncture the shell.
  11. Scrape the cooked pumpkin from the lid as well.
  12. Use this cooked portion for No Cream Creamy Pumpkin Soup|a pumpkin soup or freeze it for later use.
  13. Ladle hot soup into the pumpkin and serve.
  14. The lid can be used as a cover or you can serve the soup uncovered.
title: Pumpkin Tureen

directions:
1. Process the almonds.
  2. Make a generous broth with the chicken and lamb, seasoned with salt.
  3. Strain the broth and mix it with the processed almond, honey, strain, cinnamon and saffron.
  4. Simmer until it turns into caramel.
  5. Place slices of bread or biscuit in cups and scald them with the sauce which should be very hot.
title: Christmas Sauce

directions:
1. Cut the top of the apple off as if you were getting ready to clean out a pumpkin.
  2. Scoop out the apple leaving nothing inside.
  3. Fill the apple with applesauce (alternatives include natural yoghurt, apple juice or even syrup).
  4. Put the top back on and let the kids open it up to see what is inside.
title: Apple Surprise

directions:
1. Wash and stem the grapes, then mash, tie the spices in a bag and add to the mashed grapes.
  2. Cook until the grapes are soft and discard the spice bag.
  3. Press the grape through a sieve and measure the pulp.
  4. Add the vinegar and 1 cup sugar to each 2 cups pulp.
  5. Cook and stir until the butter is thick.
  6. Pour into hot jars and process for 10 minutes in a boiling water bath.
title: Spiced Grape Butter

directions:
1. After you have made your Waffles|waffles, place them in a stack on a plate. Drizzle the waffles with syrup to your liking.
  2. Whip your heavy cream until stiff peaks form in a separate bowl. Proceed to place a mountain of whipped cream on top of stack of waffles and syrup.
  3. Add your popcorn evenly over the plate of waffles and place the singular strawberry on the top of the dish- preferably nestled into the whipped cream.
title: Together Breakfast
